loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira G. is the wife of a farmer. She is 44 years old and has four children. Her husband, Angel G., is a rice grower. She also helps in growing rice, especially in land preparation. Most of the people in their location are engaged in the farming business. Their harvest goes to pay the expenses at home and to buy their other needs.

When she learned about CEVI's wide areas of services, she didn't think twice to apply for a loan. She would like to buy the fertilizer and herbicide needed on her farm. With the amount of Php 15,000, she hopes that she can double her harvest.

CEVI helps farmers grow and sustain more than their livelihood. CEVI provides them with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
If you talked with Benita P. about her dreams, she will tell you about graduation day of her four children in college. She will be turning 43 this year and currently working on a 2-hectare farm to provide their needs. Farming according to her is a difficult work. She said that you will work whole day in the farm especially during land preparation under the heat of the sun, immersed in muddy soil.

The dream she has for her children serves as a strength that fuel her desire to work harder in the field. Now, she is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures to buy herbicides, complete fertilizers, crude oil and payment for the laborer as well. 

Her participation in CEVI develops more her business skills. She receives not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides, complete fertilizers, crude oil and payment for the laborer

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita B. is a resident of Sanepa. Sanepa is located in Kathmandu district and most of the people in this region are engaged in small business. She lives in a single family home with her husband and one daughter. Her husband, Mr. Bhakta B., is a driver and her daughter is studying in pre-primary school. 

Her husband’s income is not enough to run her family smoothly, so Rita decided to open her own grocery store. She opened her grocery store two years ago in Sanepa. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop such as rice, maize, various snacks, etc. She uses her income for household expenses.

Rita is applying for a loan of Rs 10,000 to purchase additional grocery items as stock for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Ameena Haq Nawaz Group

texts.en:
This group has 5 members. The leader, Ameena baji, is a widow and has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband died in an accident. She had no financial resources but she never lost courage. She started an embroidered clothes business. Through this business she able to send her kids to school and pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) to expand her business.  Noor Fatima baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Zeba and Syeda baji each want a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for their embroidered clothes business. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy rice sacks to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee the other loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to buy material for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
To provide good education and a bright future for her children is Jenalyn S.'s ultimate goals in life. She is a farmer, tilling a small parcel of land that she inherited from her parents. Jenalyn is 33 years old and has three children. She also has an ambition to have another farm to support more their needs. She needs additional capital to run her farming business. She seeks assistance from CEVI to avail a loan of Php 15,000 to purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and other farm needs.

With all heart and energy, she strives harder to grow her business. According to her, CEVI is a great help to them in sustaining their livelihood. CEVI provides credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides and other farm needs.

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila S. is the owner of a small restaurant. She opened her restaurent in Sanepa, Lalitpur, a few years ago. In her restaurant she makes mo:mo (Chinese foods) and serves mo:mo to her customers. In Kathmandu Valley the demand of buff (buffalo) mo:mo is very high. 

Due to the increasing demands of her customers she needs to buy more cooking tools for her restaurant. So Mrs. Lila is requesting Rs 15,000 to buy more mo:mo cooking tools.

Lila has two sons: her older son works in his own grocery store and the younger son works in a motorbike workshop. Her husband, Mr. Basanta S., helps in her restaurant.

loans.use: To buy more mo:mo cooking tools

loans.name: Riffat Rashid Group

texts.en:
Riaz baji and Kanizan baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell. Nadia Saeed baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy ingredients like lentils, spices and cooking oil for her food selling business. Abida baji wants a loan to buy beads, colored thread and clothes for her decorative embroidery business.

Riffat baji is the leader of this group of ladies. All of them live in the city of Vehari, Pakistan. Her husband, R., works in a factory on a monthly wage. Riffat baji is a very hardworking lady. She knows that her husband’s income is insufficient to meet their expenses; therefore, she prepares decorative embroidery on clothes. Her purpose is to share the financial burden of her husband and to pay off the utilities. She is applying for a loan to buy materials like colored thread, clothes and beads for her decorative embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy embroidery materials

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
N. Gladys is the leader of Tubulwanyise group in Naluvule. She is a hardworking and devoted lady with a business raising poultry and selling paraffin (kerosene) from a pump at her home. For the poultry business, Gladys has been running it for four years with both broiler and layer chicks; for the paraffin business, she has been selling the paraffin for six years.

This is Gladys’ 34th loan from Pearl Microfinance and she is grateful that she has been able pay school fees for her ten children out of which seven have completed school while three are still in school. She also helps to cater for a disabled girl who was abandoned by the roadside seven years ago and no one has ever come up to claim her, plus two orphaned in-laws.

Gladys needs a loan to help with buying feed for her chicks, completing payment for her booked day old chicks, plus completing payment for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and day-old chicks and to pay school fees

loans.name: Babita

texts.en:
Mrs. Babita A. lives in Bhaishipati, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with four members including her husband and her children: a daughter and a son. Her husband, Mr. Bashanta A., works in the government service. Her daughter is studying in secondary school and her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. Adikari started selling cows milk a year ago. She already owned a cow. Now she is requesting a loan to buy another young cow to sell more milk in the local area because she lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is increasing. In Nepal, people love to drink cow's milk so demand for milk is increasing constantly.

loans.use: To buy a young cow for her milk business

loans.name: Majeedan Gous Muhammad Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar baji and Safdari baji each want a loan to buy vegetables to sell.

Yaseen baji wants a loan to buy repairing tools for her motor workshop.

Majeedan baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. Her husband’s name is G. M. and he runs a Punjabi food-selling business. He sells, specifically, samosas (tasty little savory patties) and pakodas (batter fried vegetables). These two items are very popular with people. They give their orders to him because, in the community, people only like his items.

Majeedan baji also runs a clothes-sewing business. She sews clothes to save her income for rainy days. She is applying for a loan to buy items (cooking oil, spices and potatoes and flour) to grow her husband’s Punjabi food-selling business.

loans.use: To buy material for her husband's food-selling business

loans.name: Niru

texts.en:
Mrs. Niru K. lives in a single family with her husband and three sons in Sainbu-Bhaishipati Lalitpur. Her husband, Mr. Bhai Krishna K., is a driver. All her sons are now studying in grades 11, 10 and 9 respectively.

Mrs. Niru is a grocery shopkeeper. She opened her grocery store to improve the living standard of her family. She sells different varieties of grocery foods in her shop such as maize, rice, noodles, biscuits etc.

Mrs. Niru is applying for a loan of Rs 30,000  to purchase additional grocery items for her store to attract new customers.

loans.use: To buys grocery goods

loans.name: Doris Nicole

texts.es: Doris Nicole Q. C. vive en San Cristóbal  ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Doris es madre soltera de 4 hijos entre ellos Kimberly de 18 años, Kevin de 13 años, Henry de 11 años y Yaneth  de 10 años de edad, todos los niños se encuentran estudiando. Doris se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y su producto más vendido y demandado son los perfumes , Doris vende de manera ambulante viajando a los municipios de los alrededores, sus clientes obtienen el beneficio de comprarle a Doris, ya que ella da los perfumes al crédito y el dinero ella los recupera en el transcurso de un mes. Doria solicita un crédito para comprar perfumes que se encuentran en oferta de esta manera lograra incrementar su margen ganancia.
texts.en:
Doris Nicole Q. C. lives in San Crístobal, in the Cuscatlán region of El Salvador. Doris is a single mother of 4; Kimberly is 18, Kevin is 13, Henry is 11 and Yaneth is 10. All of the children attend school.
Doris sells cosmetics and her best-selling and most in demand products are the perfumes. Doris works as a street vendor travelling to neighbouring towns. Her customers benefit from her offering the perfumes on credit and collecting payment a month later.
Doris is requesting a loan to purchase perfumes that are on sale so that she can increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase discount perfumes

loans.name: Man Maiya

texts.en:
Man Maiya B. is a resident of Bhaishipati. Bhaishipati is one the developing villages of lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. Man Maiya B. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is studying in grade 9 and her daughter is in grade 6.

Both Man Maiya B. and her husband are engaged in agricultural work. They own piece of land and they grow green vegetables on their land. They grow seasonal vegetables on their land due to their lack of modern tools and technology. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening.

Now Mrs. B. is requesting a loan of Rs 10,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow vegetables in the monsoon season.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Yanira Iveth

texts.es: Yanira Iveth R. D. V. resiD. en Cojutepeque junto a su madre Doña Mirtala y sus dos  hijos Miguel D. 8 años y Ricardo D. 2 años D. edad. Yanira no recibe ayuda económica D. nadie es por ello que esta joven madre tiene toda la carga económica D. la familia que por medio D. su negocio logra salir adelante, Yanira se dedica a la venta D. cereales en un local ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Cojutepeque donD. ya posee una clientela estable que ha ganado a través D. los años, Yanira solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con mayor cantidad D. productos ya que quiere ofertar a pequeños  negocios su mercadería al por mayor, logrando obtener mayores ganancias que serán D. gran alivio para esta madre.
texts.en:
Yanira Iveth R. V. lives in Cojutepeque with her mother Mrs. Mirtala and her two sons Miguel and Ricardo who are 8 and 2 years old. Yanira doesn’t receive any financial support, so this young mother has the full economic burden of the family. She sells cereals in a booth located in the municipal market of Cojutepeque, where she already has a stable customer base that has won over the years. Because of her business she has been able to keep the family going.

Yanira is asking for a loan to restock her business with a largest number of products and offer them at a wholesale level to get higher profits that will be a big help.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock replenishment

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es: Maria Cecilia A. P. reside en la capital de El Salvador junto a su hija y su madre. Maria posee un panadería ubicada en un lugar muy céntrico donde sus clientes llegan a comprar todos los días, Maria no conformándose e imaginando la manera para aumentar su ingresos tuvo la idea de vender su productos en lugares de los alrededores, como las tiendas y es así como ha logrado expandir su producto en Antiguo Cuscatlán donde posee su mayor punto de ventas, Maria solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para la panadería ya que quiere aumentar su producción diaria; ya que no es suficiente la producción actual para la demanda que posee actualmente.
texts.en:
Maria Cecilia P. A. lives in the capital of El Salvador with her daughter and mother. Maria owns a bakery located in a very central place where customers come to shop every day. Maria started to look for ways to increase her income, and had the idea to sell her products in shops nearby. This is how she got to expand the distribution of her products to Antiguo Cuscatlan which is her largest point of sale.

Maria is asking for a loan to purchase ingredients for her bakery because she wants to increase her daily production, since it is lower than the demand she currently has.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mauricio Sibrian

texts.es: Mauricio Sibrian V. reside en Soyapango uno de los municipios más poblados de El Salvador, Mauricio tiene 48 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos. Mauricio se dedica a la venta de ropa de cama y toallas, su venta las realiza de manera ambulante por varios lugares de todo el país entre ellos Olocuilta, el puerto de La Libertad, Cuscatancingo entre otros. Mauricio solicita un crédito para aumentar su inventario en ropa de cama; ya que posee poca cantidad y variedad de estilos.
texts.en:
Mauricio Sibrian V. lives in Soyapango, one of the most populated cities in El Salvador. Mauricio is 48 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his two children. Mauricio sells pajamas and towels. He is a traveling salesman and travels throughout the country. Among the places he visits are Ollocuilta, the liberty port, and Cuscatancingo. Mauricio is asking for a loan in order to increase his inventory of pajamas. He would like to have larger quantities and more varieties of style.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow his inventory

loans.name: Esse

texts.fr: Esse N. est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est revendeuse de divers articles au marché de Womé, un village situé au sud-ouest du Togo. Esse exerce ce commerce depuis 3 ans et souhaite avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce pour mieux répondre aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Esse N., age 35, is married and the mother of 3 children. She resells various items at the market of Womé, a village located in Southwestern Togo. She's been running this business for 3 years, and wishes to use this loan to bolster her business, in order to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa del Carmen N. D. D. resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad. Teresa  vive con su hija Laura D. 13 años D. edad que actualmente está cursando séptimo grado en la escuela. Teresa recibe ayuda económica D. su esposo D. 35$ mensuales, cantidad que no es suficiente para cubrir los gastos básicos familiares; es por ello que Teresa  monto una tienda en su casa la cual le ha generado muchos beneficios económicos, ya que posee buenas ventas por que la casa D. Teresa se encuentra ubicada en calle principal donD. hay mucha accesibilidad D. la tienda que lleva como nombre “Tienda Jerusalén”. Teresa solicita este crédito para invertir en productos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa del Carmen N. D. D. lives in the La Libertad department. Teresa lives with her 13 year old daughter, Laura. Laura is currently in the seventh graD. in school. Teresa receives $35 of support from her husband every month. That amount is not enough to cover the basic family expenses. That is why Teresa started a store in her house. The store has been generating a lot of economic benefits. Her sales are good because Teresa’s house is located on a main street with lots of accessibility to the store. “Tienda Jerusalén” is the store’s name. Teresa is asking for a loan to buy products for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Erdenedulam

texts.en:
Erdenedulam P. is 31, a single mother who has two children aged 5 and 6 respectively. Both her children are attending a local kindergarten. She lives with her father, two younger brothers, and her children in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces.

In January 2009, together with her sister, she started running a cosmetics sales business in a rental stall at the Baky, the local market. She used to run a clothing business before she started her cosmetics sales. Once or twice a month, Erdenedulam goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, to purchase cosmetic items at wholesale prices. Her sister works as a saleswoman when Erdenedulam is out to purchase goods. Most of her repeat customers are local residents. She says that "My hope is to expand my tiny business for my children's future, to attain a better life." She requests a loan to purchase more cosmetics to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Mhllhau Group

texts.en: Mhllhau is the group leader of Mhllhau group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for her business. Mhllhau wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Seemae Gul wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Shkallah wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruit and vegetable shop. So they are requesting a group of loan 44100 Afghani. They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding her business

loans.name: Surja Maiya

texts.en:
Surja Maiya M. is a resident of Thecho Village. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district. The majority of the people living in this region are Newar, the indigenous people of Nepal's Kathmandu Valley. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people living in this region are engaged in seasonal farming.

Mrs. Surja Maiya M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is engaged in selling chickens. Her husband and son also equally contribute their effort to that business. They sell broiler chickens in their shop. 

Due to the increasing demand of their customers, Mrs. Surja Maiya M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 25,000 to buy chickens for their business. Mrs. Surja Maiya has already taken out a first loan from Kiva and reimbursed her loan. With her first loan she has able to gain  profit from her shop.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Rasac

texts.fr: Rasac A. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est menuisier depuis 4 ans, et est compté parmi les meilleurs de la zone. Ses œuvres sont de qualité. Rasac souhaite avec ce crédit accroître le rendement de son activité en achetant les outils de travail surtout les planches pour l’exécution de ses œuvres.
texts.en:
Rasac A., age 39, is married and the father of 2 children. He's been a furniture maker for 4 years, and is among the best in his area. His works are of quality. Rasac wishes to use this loan to increase his productivity, by buying work tools and, especially, planks that he needs to create his works.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work tools and planks

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena V. is a 29-year old farmer and mother of four children. She lives in Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur, a poor community in Mindanao whose livelihood is predominantly agriculture. Life is never easy to her since she is just renting the land that she tills. The income that she gets from her farm goes primarily to paying for household expenses, including tuition fee for their her children's education. 

With her desire to grow her business more, she seeks assistance and applies for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She looks forward to the positive results of investing bigger amount in her business.

CEVI helps small business grow. All clients received loans, trainings and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase complete fertilizers, herbicides, ammonium and other farm needs.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar S., 44, is a married man who has three children aged between 7-20. His family lives in a "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. He has been running a sales business related to livestock, traveling to neighboring provinces and purchasing raw materials. He has a Russian vehicle that is used for his business. He drives around the countryside to purchase wool, cashmere, leather and furs directly from local herders at a cheap prices. Then he transport these raw materials to the center of the province to sell to retailers at wholesale prices.

Sometime he goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to sell raw materials for higher prices. With the profit he has been building a house on the plot of land he owns. His eldest daughter Narangarav, 20, is a university student in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Second child Mendgarav, 18, is just graduating from high school and is planning to enroll in university this year.

Ganbaatar is working hard to complete the building of a house for his family needs and to save small amounts for his two children’s tuition. With this loan, he plans to purchase wool and cashmere at cheap prices.

loans.use: To purchase wool and cashmere for his business

loans.name: Shafiqan Ali Hassan Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture making business. 
Anwari begum baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. 
Sarwari baji wants a loan to buy vehicle wheels to sell. 
Rasheedan baji wants a loan to buy paint boxes to sell. 

Shafiqan baji is a wife of A. H. who has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 14 years. Her husband deals with seasonal vegetables. He buys vegetables wholesale and sells to the vegetable shops to earn income. Shafiqan baji also has a thread roll making business. She sells the thread rolls to the thread sellers and earns income. She is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. Her members are very happy to have her as a group leader because of her good behavior. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables to expand her husband’s business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Uguljon

texts.ru: Угулжон – 28 лет. Замужем и мать 1-го ребенка. Она занимается продажей женского нижнего белья и платков а также детской одежды. Она торгует на рынке «Фаровон» города Гафурова. Угулжон закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан и часть товара из города Бишкек Республики Киргизстан. Она ездит за товаром 3-4 раза в месяц. Её муж уехал в Росийскую Федерацию год назад. Угулжон кредитуется у нас с 2006 года. Угулжон просит кредит для закупки новой партии летнего женского белья их хлопчатобумажной ткани. Тогда у Угулжон увеличится ассортимент ее товара.
texts.en:
Uguljon is 28 years old, married and has 1 child. She is involved in sales of women’s lingerie, scarves and also children’s clothing. She sells at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Uguljon buys most of her merchandise at a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan and some in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyzstan Republic. She travels for her merchandise 3-4 times per month. Her husband went to the Russian Federation one year ago. Uguljon has been our client since 2006. Uguljon is requesting this loan to purchase a new stock of women’s summer lingerie, made from cotton. Then, Uguljon’s goods assortment will increase.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer lingerie

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mendbayar B. is a 31-year-old married man and father of two. Two years ago his family moved from the country to the center of Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Before then he was a herder and had a few sheep and goats. Since that wasn't enough to feed his family, Mendbayar decided to live in an urban area to improve his life.

After moving to the center of the province, he started running a carpentry business, making a variety of furniture such as beds, chairs, table, "avdar" "Avdar" is a box for keeping small items such as traditional silver cup and horse reins, horse shoes made of silver, expensive stones, etc. Most Mongolian country households have silver cups and silver horse reins, horseshoes, etc.

Mendbayar's spouse Enhtsetseg helps her husband's business every day by painting and polishing furniture. As they are getting experienced and the furniture they make is beautiful and high-quality, their number of customers is increasing. Mendbayar is a very humble person. He requests a loan to purchase raw material such as planks, glue, paint, and wool for his business.

loans.use: To purchase planks, glue, paint and wood

loans.name: Sarmila

texts.en:
Sarmila S. is a resident of Thecho. Thecho is located in Lalitpur district and the majority of people living in this region are Newars. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Sarmila has four members including herself in her family. She has one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in grade 4 and her daughter is in primary school.

Sarmila’s husband Mr. Dev Krishna opened his furniture shop a few years ago. He makes different types of furniture such as beds, racks, chairs, tables, doors, and windows, etc. He makes all this furniture according to orders from his customers. Nowadays he is receives lots of orders from his customers to make different types of furniture. But due to lack of money he cannot fulfill the orders of the customers.

So Mrs. Sarmila S. is requesting Rs 30,000 as a loan to help her husband to buy wood and other various raw materials to fulfill the orders for furniture from the customers.

loans.use: to buy wood for furniture-making

loans.name: Safija

texts.en:
Safija Huremović was born in 1967. She comes from Kalesija. Safija is married and lives with her husband, who is retired, and her father and son. They have had a family business for a long time; they are raising sheep. Besides that, they do agricultural work, producing vegetables for their own use and food for the sheep.

That business is almost the only source of income for them, because the pension that Safija`s husband receives is not much. So, Safija decided to request her first loan through WWI ( Žene za Žene International ) in the amount of 1500 KM. They will use this loan to buy more sheep in order to extend the business and increase the household income.

loans.use: To purchase more sheep to raise

loans.name: Arshan Asghar Ali Group

texts.en:
Shakooran baji and Shamim akhtar baji each want a loan to buy auto-rickshaws (local three-wheeled motor vehicles). 
Abida baji and another Shamim akhtar baji each want a loan to buy material (leather and nails) for their shoe making business.
 
Arshan baji is the wife of A. A. who has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband runs a seasonal vegetable selling business. He buys vegetables wholesale and sells to his customers. Arshan baji also prepares embroidered dresses on order for her community and cloth shops. She does this work to earn a good income, which she saves for a rainy day. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s vegetable selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bayarsayhan

texts.en:
Bayarsayhan S. lives with his wife and two teenage children in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two children are both high school students. Bayarsayhan has a small retail business selling women's and men's clothing. He sells various women's and men's clothes imported from China at the stall that he rents in the local market. He usually purchases clothes for his business from Ereen, China, a border town where many cheap Chinese products are imported to Mongolia.

Depending on the monthly sale amount, he travels to Ereen, China, once or twice a month to bring back clothes for his business. While he is away in Ereen, his wife helps in his business as a saleswoman at his stall in the market. In the future, he hopes to open a large shop for various apparel.

Bayarsayhan also says that he hopes to start saving some money from his business's profit for his children's future education. His dream is to see his two children receive a good education and pursue their dreams. He is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy men's and women's apparel for resale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna G. is from the town of Sinian, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Edna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 23 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 3,500 PHP which will be used for capital for her rice production. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Edna from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca sells cooked foods in her shop. She is very happy with the nature of her business. Prisca is 28 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cooked food to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Davaadorj

texts.en:
Davaadorj is 64 years old and retired. He lives with his wife and 17-year-old daughter in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a senior in a local high school. Since his retirement income is not enough to support his family, he has started his own small business in food retail. Davaadorj visits small country towns around the province and sells food products, including soft drinks, tobacco, baked goods and so on. When he returns to his city, he transports passengers in his van.

Davaadorj has been in this business for the last five years and acquired many customers in the countryside. He works hard to earn enough money to save up for his daughter's university tuition as she starts university next year. He is requesting a loan to purchase more food products for his business.

loans.use: To purchase food products

loans.name: Yamileth Eneyda

texts.es: Yamileth Eneyda V. L.  reside en el cantón La Loma ubicado en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Yamileth vive  con sus padres y su pequeña hija. Yamileth se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y producción de leche de vaca. Yamileth posee un ambiente ideal para la crianza de su ganado bovino y porcino ya que es un terreno al aire libre con un buen pasto el cual asegura una buena alimentación al ganado, Yamileth solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en ganado para incrementar su volumen de producción en los productos que se derivan de los mismos.
texts.en:
Yamileth Eneyda V. L. lives in the La Loma District of Cuscatlán. Yamileth lives with her parents and her young daughter.
Yamileth works in milk production and raises pigs. Yamileth’s open-air pasture is the ideal environment to raise cattle and pigs and ensures that they are well fed.
Yamileth is requesting a loan to purchase livestock in order to increase production of her cow- and pig-derived products.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle and pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann L. is from the town of East Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with two adult children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a clothing business in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general clothing services to local community members. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Mary Ann joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, and is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital. This loan will be her second from PMPC. Mary Ann plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for use as working capital

loans.name: Sarwari Muhammad Sharif Group

texts.en:
Shamim begum baji wants a loan to buy a horse cart for loading. 
Nadia baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 
Nazia tabasum baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. 

Sarwari baji is a wife of M. S. who has lived in Vehari, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband deals with seasonal vegetables. He has been doing this work for the last five years. Sarwari baji also operates a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. She is applying for a loan to expand her husband’s vegetable selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Soliha

texts.ru: Солиха – женщина 46 лет. Замужем и мать 4-х детей. Занимается продажей парфюмерии и декоративной косметики, а также женской обуви на рынке «Фаровон» города Гафурова. У Солихи очень большой ассортимент товара и соответственно у нее много клиентов. Солиха закупает товар у фирм-поставщиков и индивидуальных дистрибьюторов а также ездит на оптовый рынок города Истаравшан. Сейчас современная молодёжь предпочитает дорогую косметику известных компаний. Поэтому Солиха просит займ для закупки партию декоративной косметики от Российской компании Эйвон и партию женской летней обуви.
texts.en:
Soliha is 46 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells perfumes and decorative cosmetics, and also women’s shoes at the Farovon market in the city of Gafurov. Soliha has a wide assortment of merchandise and, thus, has many customers. She buys her merchandise from supplier firms and individual distributors. She also travels to a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Nowadays, modern young people prefer expensive cosmetics from well-known companies. This is why Soliha is requesting this loan to purchase a stock of decorative cosmetics from a Russian company, Avon, and a stock of women’s summer shoes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and women's summer shoes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mrs D. lives in Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and blessed with four school-aged children. She owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies. She has been engaged in this business for more than 12 years, and earns 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.

Mrs D. joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family and to have some savings.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita G. lives with her husband and two daughters. Her older daughter is studying in Grade 4 and her younger daughter is studying in pre-primary school. Sunita lives in Thecho and has a vegetable shop in Kalimati bazaar, to which she travels 40 minutes every day. She sells different types of vegetable such as potatoes, onions, cauliflowers, greens vegetables, and so on. She set up her shop to improve her family's standard of living.

Sunita is asking for a loan of 30,000 NPR to buy more varieties of vegetables for her shop. Nowadays in Nepal the cost of all vegetables is increasing due to the late monsoon. So now is the right season for Sunita to invest more money in buying large quantities of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To buy vegetables for her shop

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Erdenebayar N. lives with his wife and two teenage sons in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Erdenebayar had worked for the local army for over a decade. When Mongolia transitioned from the communist regime to the free market economy in 1991, he decided to leave his job and pursue small business for himself.

Today he has a small retail business dealing in unprocessed livestock products such as unprocessed wool, cashmere and animal skins. He purchases these livestock products from herder families in the countryside and sells them at profit at the wholesale markets in the city or sometimes in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running this business for the last 18 years and he is very experienced and well-known in the business. His business capital is currently 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). He requests a loan to purchase more wool, cashmere, and animal skins from herders.

loans.use: To purchase unprocessed wool, cashmere, and leathers

loans.name: Hiada Group

texts.en: Hiada is the group leader of Hiada group. There are four members in this group. They want to expand their businesses and make them larger. So they are requesting a group loan of 40000 Afghani. Hiada wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. Khdega wants to take a loan for her son who has a general store. Raual wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Zheua Khnm wants to take a loan for her son who has a wood selling shop. They are thankful for all Kiva lenders who can support all entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married mother of three, and she and her husband work together, selling fresh milk to their community. They purchase roughly 100 liters per day at wholesale prices, and then they sell to anyone who will buy from them in the slum area of Nyamasaria, Kisumu. Monica says that one of the biggest challenges in her business is to preserve the milk she has purchased until she sells it.

Monica will use this loan to buy more milk to sell. She hopes to expand her business in order to pay school fees for her three children, and to improve her lifestyle (which means having enough money for food for the family.) Someday she hopes to expand her business by preserving the milk (through refrigeration).

loans.use: purchasing milk

loans.name: Ram Maiya

texts.en:
Ram Maiya D. lives in a nuclear family in Chapagaun. Chapagaun is located in Lalitpur district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. She lives with her husband, Mr. Surya Bahadur D., and two sons. Both of her sons are now studying.

Both Mrs. D. and Mr. D. are farmers and they prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Especially they grow green vegetables. They sell their vegetables in the local market in the morning and evening daily.

Now Mrs. D. is requesting Rs 25,000 as a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farming work.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kizlaroi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Кизларой-женщина 53 лет.Замужем имеет 4-х детей.Чтобы прокормить свою семью она занимается откормом и купля продажей скота. Её муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы там зарабатывать деньги.Её помогают сыновья.Дополнительно она работает в больнице санитаркой. У Кизлароя есть стадо мелко рогатого скота, примерно 16 коз и 7 овец.Кизларой очень рада что в трудный момент её жизни наша организация помогает.
texts.en:
Kizlaroi is a 53-year-old woman. She is married and has 4 children. She is involved in livestock feeding and sales in order to support her family. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to earn money. Kizlaroi’s sons help her with the business. In addition, she works as an orderly at a hospital. Kizlaroi has a herd of small livestock, which includes approximately 16 goats and 7 sheep. Kizlaroi is very happy that our organization helps her during a difficult period in her life.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат - молодой мужчина 1977 года рождения. Женат и отец 2-х детей. Шухрат занимается производством лепешки а его жена продает их на рынке "Панчшанбе". В июне у нас отмечается большой праздник "День примирения" и закрываются все границы. Шухрат закупает муку у оптовиков в запас, чтобы застраховать себя, если завоз муки на время приостановится. У Шухрата есть свои постоянные клиенты, которые берут лепешки под реализацию и рассчитываются сразу после реализации. Шухрат кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Шухрат очень благодарен нашей организации за поддержку малого бизнеса населения.
texts.en:
Born in 1977, Shuhrat is a young man, who is married and has 2 children. Shuhrat is involved in making flatbread, which his wife sells at the Panchshanbe market. In June, we will be celebrating a big holiday, called Day of Peace, and all the borders will be closed. Shuhrat buys flour from wholesalers for reserve, in order to insure his supply in case flour supply would temporarily stop. Shuhrat has loyal customers, who buy flatbread to resell and pay right after the sale. Shuhrat has been our client since 2008. He always uses his loans purposefully. Shuhrat is grateful to our organization for supporting small businesses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour to make flatbread

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en:
Jasmina Dervišević is 44 years old. She comes from the suburbs of the town Kalesija. She lives there with her husband and daughter who is in second year high school. Her husband works in a store in Kalesija as a salesman.

Jasmina produces vegetable for her own use and for sale, beside that she owns corn and wheat fields. Jasmina, also does poultry business in season. Jasmina has requested her first loan through WWI ( Žene za Žene International ) in the amount of 1500 KM to invest in their farming. Jasmina`s business profit increases their home budget and provides better living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase minerals, seeds and pay transport costs conected to agriculure work

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married 34-year-old woman, a mother of six children (ages 3-17 years), and a self-professed “fish monger.” She sells dried fish, (“Obambo” and “Bude” fish, in the Luo language) in the Kisumu area. Pamela buys her dried fish near Lake Victoria and carries the load on her head as she sells her products door-to-door.

Pamela will use the loan to buy more stocks of dried fish. She wants to have a successful business in order to educate her six children.

loans.use: dried fish

loans.name: Taiba

texts.en: Taiba is 30 years old and married with 4 children.She sells cooked foods and she loves this business. She hopes for the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi A. est un homme de 42 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale. Kokouvi exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans. Il désire avec ce crédit approvisionner son magasin afin de mieux satisfaire à la demande de ses clients. Dans la vue Kokouvi est celui derrière le comptoir habillé en chemise.
texts.en:
Kokouvi A., age 42, is married and the father of 4 children. He owns a grocery store. Kokouvi has been running this business for five years. He wishes to use this loan to supply his store, in order to better meet customer demand. In the picture, Kokouvi is behind the counter wearing a shirt.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his grocery store

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббат 41 год. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Мухаббат занимается продажей фруктов и овощей на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Ее муж помогает ей в бизнесе, иногда заменяет жену, когда у нее есть другие дела. Мухаббат закупает овощи и фрукты у дехканин, которые каждый день ранним утром приносят на рынок свежие фрукты и овощи. Мухаббат является постоянной клиенткой нескольких дехканин. Сейчас время овощей нового сезона и Мухаббат просит очередной займ для закупки свежих овощей.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 41 years old, married and has 3 children. Muhabbat is involved in sales of fruits and vegetables at the Panchshanbe market in the city Khujand. Her husband helps her with the business and sometimes relieves her, when she has other things to do. Muhabbat buys vegetables and fruits from dekhan farmers, who bring fresh fruits and vegetables to the market early every morning. Muhabbat is a consistent customer of several farmers. Now is the time for new seasonal vegetables, and Muhabbat is requesting her next loan to buy fresh vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fresh vegetables

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is 42 years old and a married mother of three. Her children range in age from 16-23. Penina has a food kiosk where she sells vegetables, beans, and rice.  She sells to approximately 15 customers per day.

Penina’s business advice is, “if you don’t diversify, customers will go away.” She therefore will use this loan to buy more cereals for her kiosk. She hopes to eventually have enough money to do a separate business, where she will serve cooked food.

loans.use: buying more cereals for her kiosk

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy has a business selling dried fish in the Kisumu area. She buys the fish at wholesale markets, and then transports the product using local transportation – a “matatu,” or a Kenyan mini-bus. She sells the fish from a market along the roadside. She will use the loan to buy more stock.

Lucy is 43 years old, and she is separated from her husband. She has six children, three of whom live with her. She hopes to boost her business in order to pay school fees for her children, including vocational school for the child who has dropped out of the traditional education system.

Lucy is also a volunteer community health care worker. She volunteers her time to do home-based care, which means that she visits sick people in their homes, and provides counseling to their caregivers.

loans.use: buying more fish for resale

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells cooked foods. Precious is married with 2 children and she is 32 years old. Precious hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase of more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Nora Silvia

texts.es: Nora Silvia E. D. R. resiD. en Soyapango ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador tiene 44 años D. edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos Nanci D. 18 años, Guillermo D. 15 años e Israel D. 7 años D. edad actualmente los tres hijos D. Nora asisten a la escuela. Nora recibe un aporte económico D. 75$ por parte D. su esposo, es por ello que Nora se apoya es su pequeño negocio que es una tienda D. productos D. consumo diario, Ella solita este crédito por que quiere surtir su negocio ya que gran parte D. sus ingresos económicos dependen D. las ventas D. su negocio es por ello que es D. gran importancia tener más variedad y cantidad D. productos en la tienda así ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Nora Silvia E. D. R. lives in Soyapango, San Salvador. She’s 44 years old and lives a house of her own with her husband and their three children Nanci (18), Guillermo (15) and Israel (7); all of them are students. Nora gets a $75 stipend from her husband, which helps her run a small business selling some essentials. She’s seeking a loan because sales from the shop proviD. a large portion of her family’s income. A large, varied inventory will help her increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: store inventory

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 28 years old and a single mother of a 12-year-old and a 9-year-old. She is a wholesaler of Irish potatoes. She hires a lorry (truck) to transport the potatoes to a local outdoor market in Kisumu.

Beatrice will use her loan to purchase more potatoes. Her hope is that her loan will help her improve her living standards, which she defined as “having more food, and meeting basic needs”.

loans.use: buying more potatoes to wholesale

loans.name: Fransica

texts.en: Fransica is a 33-year-old single woman with no children. She has a retail business selling drinks to her customers. Fransica is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Eric

texts.fr: Eric A. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé, un village situé au sud-ouest du Togo. Éric conduit depuis la moto d’une autre personne à qui il verse des mensualités. Ceci ne lui permet pas d’économiser pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Il désire avec ce crédit acheter sa propre moto afin de mieux épargner pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Eric A. is a young man, 37 years old, married, and the father of two. He is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé, a village located in southwest Togo. He has been driving a motorbike belonging to another person, to who he pays a fee each month. This does not allow Eric to economize, so as to provide for his family. He would like to use this loan to buy his own motorbike in order to save money and to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorbike as a taxi

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 1 Itungu Victoria Group

texts.en: Victoria I. is a 33-year-old married mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She also cares for three dependants. Victoria has been in business for ten years buying and selling passion fruits, vegetables and beans. She will use the loan to purchase more passion fruits, vegetables, beans and so on, to expand and increase her business so that she can make more profit. Victoria is an active, hardworking lady whose dream is to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruits, vegetables and beans

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a 35-year-old married woman with five children, aged from 8 to 14 years old. Monica is in the business of selling tomatoes – she buys the tomatoes in bulk and sells them at 'Oile', an outdoor market in Kisumu. Some of her customers operate hotels, which are like local restaurants.

Monica will use this loan to purchase more stock and to expand her business. She will use the money she makes to pay her children’s school fees for next term. Her hope for the future is to become a wholesaler, so that other people would buy products in bulk from her.

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes

loans.name: Helen Achieng'

texts.en:
Helen is a 31-year-old married mother of four children aged from 8 to 16 years old, all of whom are in school. Helen sells fresh Tilapia, a kind of fresh fish, from nearby Lake Victoria. She buys the fish at a local market and then resells them to retailers, and the rest to consumers.

Helen says that right now she “lacks finances to buy fish,” and will use her loan to purchase stock for her business. She hopes that with the proceeds from her business she can continue to educate her children and boost her trade. She says that she wants people to know that she works hard to educate her children, and she hopes to live a long life.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Morena

texts.es: Morena L. A. reside en San Luis Talpa en el departamento La Paz, El grupo familiar de Morena está compuesto por cuatro personas. Morena se dedica a la costurería  elaborando ropa a la talla y diseño que sus clientes le piden. Morena lleva una gran trayectoria de experiencia en su profesión son 19 años que le han dado el buen gusto y calidad a las prendas que elabora, La acabados en los productos de Morena son de excelente calidad ya posee maquinas industriales para su producción. Morena solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio comprando telas para la elaboración de productos.
texts.en:
Morena L. A. lives in San Luis Talpa in the department of La Paz. Morena’s family is made up of four people. She is a seamstress and makes clothing in the size and style that her clients request of her. She has a lot of experience in her profession because she has been imparting her good taste and making quality clothing for 19 years. Her products are very well-made because she has industrial sewing machines for their production. Morena is requesting a loan to invest in her business by buying fabrics for making her products.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Agblemassa

texts.fr: Agblemassa A. est un homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il fait des pépinières de jeunes plants qu’il revend à la population. Ce secteur est très prometteur à cause de la forte demande. il désire avec ce crédit élargir son espace d’exploitation et acheter des intrants pour accroître la capacité de son activité. Il compte sur cette aubaine pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Agblemassa A. is a 35-year-old man, married, and the father of two. He has a nursery for young plants, which he sells to people. This sector is very promising due to the strong demand. He would like to use this loan to enlarge his growing area and to buy fertilizers and the like to expand his business capacity. He is counting on this great opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy inputs and to expand his area

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 1 Masika Elizabeth Group

texts.en: Mrs Elizabeth M. is 35 years old and married with five children, all of whom are in school. Elizabeth has been operating a clinic business for over eight years. She is using her loan to purchase clinical items, such as various drugs for the patients. She is an encouraging and hardworking lady whose future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase clinical items, such as drugs

loans.name: Mr. Houy Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of nineteen people, is located in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. They plan to use their loan for different purposes.

Mr. Houy U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the village bank members. He is a fisherman who can catch a little fish for his living. His wife, Mrs. Oak Lo, assists him with the fishing business. Mr. Houy U. is 55 years old and the father of seven children, four of whom are employed in a garment factoR. while the other three are attending the local school.

Although Mr. Houy U.’s family members have different business activities, they still provide a better living for the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Houy U. decided to ask for a loan to conduct a motorcycle repair business in the local village.

loans.use: To conduct a motorcycle repair business in the local village

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 23 years old and married with four children. Her children are all in school and they range in age from 1 to 11.  Jennifer buys tomatoes from a major market in Kisumu and then resells them. She will use her loan to buy more tomatoes. She says that having the loan will help her to have good business because she will be able to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is happily married with 2 children and she is 34 years old. Grace produces and sell sachet water in retail and wholesale to her customers.

She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more cellophane to produce more sachet water to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more cellophane to produce more sachet water to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 22 years old.  She has a grocery shop selling vegetables next to her house in Kasawino. She sells tomatoes, rice, beans, onions, coriander, and other vegetables – “whatever is in season.”  Eunice buys these vegetables at a large outdoor market in Kisumu and she travels back to her shop via “boda boda” (a bicycle taxi) with the vegetables on her lap. Eunice says that one of her biggest challenges is “irregular customers.” She says that it is difficult for her to predict sales.  Eunice will use the loan to boost her grocery business so that she can live well.

Eunice is married and has two children, ages 2 and 8. She takes care of the two-year-old while she runs her shop. Right now Eunice says that she has difficulty paying for her child’s school fees and uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi K. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Depuis 4 ans, il opère dans dans domaine de la pépinière des jeunes plants de cocotiers et de palmiers. Kossi souhaite avec ce crédit élargir son espace cultivable et aussi acheter intrants lui permettant de développer la culture des plants sélectionnés afin de répondre des aux exigences de la clientèle.
texts.en:
Kossi K. is a young man, 37 years old, married, and the father of three. For four years, he has been operating in the nursery domain involving coconut and palm saplings. He wishes to use this loan to enlarge his growing area and also to buy fertilizers and the like. This would enable him to develop the culturing of selected plants for responding to customer demands.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge his arable area and to buy inputs

loans.name: Celia Marleny

texts.es: Celia Marleny G. D. M. vive en Rosario D. la Paz en departamento La Paz. Celia tiene 44 años D. edad vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos que actualmente son estudiantes. Celia recibe ayuda económica D. 150$ por parte su esposo, pero Celia también trabaja dedicándose a su negocio que es un deposito D. bebidas gaseosas y jugos, también elabora pupusas para vender es por ello que solicita este crédito por que quiere invertir en materia prima para las pupusas ya que a veces su producción no alcanza para la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Celia Marleny G. D. M. lives in Rosario D. la Paz, in the La Paz region of El Salvador. Celia is 44 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children who currently attend school.
Celia receives $150 in financial support from her husband, but Celia also runs her own business, a shop selling soft drinks, juices and homemaD. pupusas.
She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients used in making the pupusas since sometimes her production does not meet customer demand.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in making pupusas

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 1 Kabugho Perepetu Group

texts.en:
K. Perepetu is 24-years old and married with three children of which one is in school. She is taking care of two dependants who are also in school. She has dealt in cassava flour and palm oil for four years so far.

She is using the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour and palm oil for sale and she even purchased a goat and a pig for livestock. She is an active business lady whose dream is to go for training.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour and palm oil for sale and she even purchased a goat and a pig for livestock.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina L. works in a family member's specialized retail store selling a variety of food products in the local community. She is 44 years old, married and has three school-age children. They are from the town of Langub, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. Adelina has been in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Adelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Adelina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 16th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Caroline Achieng'

texts.en:
Caroline is 32 years old. She buys new petticoats from tailors in Kibuye, and she sells them at the market. She chose this business because it was profitable, although she says there are a few competitors in Kisumu.  Caroline faces challenges of not having enough finances to buy stock, so she will use this loan to buy more stock in petticoats.  

She is married, has three children, who range in age from 7 to 14 years old. She has an immediate need to pay her children’s school fees.  When asked about her dreams, she said she wants to “have a car just to drive through the roads”.

loans.use: New Petticoats

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. is from the town of Misom, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old. Marites is married and has 9 school-aged children. To make a living, Marites owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Marites has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Marites joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marites has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Marites is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Marites from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 37 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling ice cream in the local community. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Wilma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Wilma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima Manjić was born in 1959. She comes from a suburb of the town of Kalesija. Fatima lives in her family house with her daughter (who is in the second high school), her adult son (who is employed) and her husband. Her husband works in Afghanistan.

Fatima is busy in agriculture producing vegetables and her main product is cucumbers which she sells to the local agriculture cooperative. Besides that, she produces tomatoes, potatoes and beans. Fatima also raises poultry in season.

Fatima requested her first loan from WWI (Žene za Žene International) to invest in her agriculture business. This is Fatima's way to contribute in providing a better standard of life.

loans.use: To invest in her agricultural work

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 2 Rachael Namahe Group

texts.en:
Rachael N. is 28 years old, married with one boy child who is in school and she is looking after two dependents. She has operated a business dealing in smoked fish and baking madasi for one year so far.

She is using the loan to purchase smoked fish and wheat flour, cooking oil, and baking powder for making madasi. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to educate her child and develop herself.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish and wheat flour, cooking oil, & baking powder for making madasi.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Greetings from M. Eugene, a 31 year-old married man with a 1 year old child residing in Nyarugenge district of Kigali city, the capital of Rwanda. This entrepreneur rents a plot in Nyarugenge market and sells men's clothes especially jeans. Despite his experience of 15 years in this business, Eugene employs 2 regular workers. He is requesting his first loan worth 500,000 Rwf from Vision Finance Company, the partner of World Vision Rwanda.

Before this loan he used to earn a monthly profit of $84 US. He starts his daily activity at 6:30 AM and works to 7:00 PM. With this loan he will buy more clothes to expand his business and with increased profit he hopes to buy a house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience owns a cyber café in her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. Patience is 29 years old. She is married but does not have children. Patience hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more computers to enable her to meet the growing demand of her numerous customers. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more computers

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi A. est un jeune homme de 30 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto. kossi exerce cette activité depuis 3 ans, mais la moto qu’il conduit n’est pas de sa propriété. Il désire avec ce crédit acquérir sa propre moto afin de mieux gagner sa vie.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is a young man, 30 years old, married, and the father of one child. He is a motorbike taxi driver. He has been in this business for three years, but the motorbike he drives is not his property. He would like to use this loan to acquire his own motorbike in order to earn his living better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own motorbike

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: B. is 48 years old and married with two children. B. sells provisions. She is requesting for the loan of N120,000 to purchase provisions to sell in order to meet customer demand. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is 43 years old and married with two children. She presently resides in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her piglets. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, since March 2005. She admitted that with the help of PMPC-Micofinance, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. She is seeking a new loan of Php6,000. She hopes to have a comfortable life someday and to be able to send her children to school so they have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for the piglets

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 27 years old and married to A., a carpenter. They have two children. Rachael sells building materials and has been in business for the past seven years. 

She needs a loan of N120,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. With the profits from her business, she assists her husband in providing for the needs of the home. Rachael lives in the Ikorodu area of Lagos state with her family.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 2 Kabu Mary Group

texts.en: Mary K. is 32 years old and married with five children in school. She sells passion fruits and beans, a business which she has so far operated for seven years. She is using the loan to purchase passion fruits and beans. She is a hardworking business lady who is living as an example to the community. Her future plan is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase passion fruits and beans

loans.name: Rosmonde

texts.fr: G. Rosmonde est née le 14 Mars 1966 à Décamè dans le Département du Zou. Rosmonde est mariée et est mère de cinq enfants. Sur les cinq enfants de Rosmonde, trois sont encore à sa charge et sont tous scolarisés. Rosmonde réside avec sa famille au quartier pk10 sur la route de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Rosmonde vend des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.), des fruits et des boissons de brasserie. Rosmonde a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé; et Rosmonde rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients, Rosmonde sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Rosmonde G. was born on the March 14th, 1966 in Décamè in the County of Zou. Rosmonde is married and is the mother of five children. Of Rosmonde's five children, three are still in her care and all are students. Rosmonde lives with her family in the neighborhood of PK10 on the road of Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin.

Rosmonde sells a variety of products - candies, cookies, cartons of milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, dish-washing soap, bath soap, batteries, candles, fruits, drinks etc. Rosmonde has already been the beneficiary of three loans by ALIDé and Rosmonde has always repaid the loans without difficulty. To reinforce her activities and satisfy more customers, Rosmonde is requesting a forth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ten, six-bottle cases of sugared drinks; four cases of apples and five cases of cookies.

loans.name: Isedra

texts.en:
Mrs. Isedra E. is 46 years old and lives at Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is blessed with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer and lends a hand in farming specifically in corn production, which is their primary activity. 
She is a member of Paglaum MPC since June 2006. Now she is applying for Php 8,000.00 intended to buy farm fertilizers and pesticides. She has many plans for the future -- to buy a carabao to toil the land, build a simple concrete house and be able to send their children to school and finish a degree.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the corn

loans.name: Safija

texts.en:
Safija Beganović was born in 1957 and comes from town of Bratunac. She lives there with her son and daughter-in-law. Her son is employed, but Safija and her daughter-in-law are not. They are busy in the field producing vegetables, and they started orchard farming last year. Safija owns the meadows and sells the grass every year.

Safija decided to request her first loan from WWI (Žene za žene International) in the amount of 1000 KM to buy a cow. Safija saved some money and together with this loan, she will have enough to buy a cow. In this way, Safija's family will have enough milk and milk products and she hopes to be able to sell some as well.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: G. Josephine est née vers 1959 à Affanmè dans la Commune de Dangbo dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Josephine est mariée à GODONOU Fulbert employé dans une boulangerie de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Josephine est mère de cinq enfants dont encore trois à sa charge. C’est les fruits que Josephine vend de façon ambulante à Cotonou. Josephine fait ses provisions de fruits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Josephine a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé ; et Josephine rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients, Josephine sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Josephine was born around 1959 in Affanmè in the community of Dangbo, in Ouémé county in southern Benin. She is married to GODONOU Fulbert, employed in a bakery in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Josephine is the mother of five children, of whom three are still in her care.
