Fruit is what Josephine sells door-to-door in Cotonou. She gets her provisions of fruit at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. She has already benefited from three loans with Alidé and has always repaid them without any difficulties at all. To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more, she is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pineapples, papayas, mangos, and avocados

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
"I started working in the farm as a tenant. I was tilling the land from other farmers. Until now, I am still renting land. Someday, I would be able to buy my own farm to support myself and my family," says Teodora D., a mother of three children. 

The farm that Teodora tills is an average size of 1.5 hectare. This has brought food for their family and made them earn enough income to fulfill their needs. She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides and to use as payment for the laborers.

With her loan, she thinks she could increase their yield. CEVI helps her sustain her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides and to pay the laborers

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Mrs. V. resides in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She operates a business selling fish. She has been engaged in this business for more than 10 years, earning 5,000 PHP per month.

She joined PMPC,a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Evelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support members of her immediate family.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lolita P. is 63 years old and married with four children. She is from Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She started a business when she became a member of Paglaum MPC in July 2008 and now she's on her fifth loan cycle. 

She is seeking PHP 7,000 for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store to buy stock such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries and other household items. With her previous loans, she demonstrated outstanding loan repayment. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and to save for their old age.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Godwin

texts.fr: Godwin A. est un homme de 45 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé depuis 3 ans. Godwin souhaita avec ce crédit acheter son propre engin. Il utilisait depuis lors la moto d’autrui ce qui ne lui permettait pas d’épargner pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille. Godwin compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Godwin A. is a 45-year-old man, married, and the father of one child. He has been a motorbike taxi driver in Womé for three years. He wishes to use this loan to buy his own vehicle. All the while, he has been using somebody else’s. This has not allowed him to save money to respond to family needs. He is counting on this chance to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy his own vehicle

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr: A. Aïchatou est née le 17/05/1984 à Porto-Novo dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Aïchatou est mariée à MIWkounou Frédéric, un commerçant. Aïchatou est mère de deux enfants. Aïchatou et son mari ainsi que ses enfants vivent au domicile de ses beaux parents. C’est les divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) que Aïchatou vend à la devanture de ses beaux parents à Agblangandan un quartier de Cotonou. Aïchatou a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé ; et Aïchatou rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients, Aïchatou sollicite un quatrième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Aïchatou was born on May 17, 1984 in Porto-Novo in Ouémé county, in southern Benin. She is married to MIWkounou Frédéric, a merchant, and is the mother of two children. She and her husband, as well as their children, live in the home of her parents-in-law. Various goods, such as candies, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardine, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, candles, etc., are what Aïchatou sells in the entryway of her in-laws, there in Agblangandan, a district of Cotonou. She has already benefited from three loans from Alidé and has always repaid them without any difficulties at all. To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more, she is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a 50-kg sack of sugar, 50 kilos of cassava flour, three boxes of cookies, and some boxes of candy

loans.name: Odsuren

texts.en: Odsuren L. is a 64 year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. All her children are grown up and live with their own family. L. and her husband Davaa are both retired. Since their pension amount of 280,000 tugrugs (equal to $ 200 USD) is not enough to live by, they have been running a retail business in selling food products through a small food booth they own. in 2001, when she began to run her tiny business, her working capital was 100,000 tugrugs. Now her working capital has increased and reached 1 million tugrugs. Odsuren purchases a variety of food products such as candy, biscuits and tobacco at wholesale prices from the local market to resell them at retail prices. With this loan, she will buy food products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Kizlargul

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Кизларгул женщина- 44 лет.Замужем имеет 3-х детей.Кизларгул занимается откормом скота.Она откармливает мелко рогатого скота дома.Её муж уехал на заработки в Казахстан.Она узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки скота.Скот является для неё источником дохода. Ей помогает дочка Гулсуной.Кизларгул очень благодарна нашей организации.
texts.en:
Kizlargul is 44 years old, married and has 3 children. Kizlargul is involved in livestock feeding. She feeds small livestock at home. Her husband went to work in Kazakhstan. She learned about our organization and came in to obtain a loan to purchase livestock. Livestock is her sole source of income. Kizlargul’s daughter, Gulsunoi, helps her with the business. Kizlargul is grateful to our organization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Marie-Claire

texts.fr: F. Marie- Claire est née le 22/07/1959 à Takon dans la Commune de Sakété dans le Département de Plateau au Sud du Bénin. Marie-Claire est mariée à FATOKE Jacob ; mais elle est veuve depuis un an. Marie-Claire est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés et maintenant à sa charge.  Marie-Claire vend les vêtements et chaussures à Agblangandan un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Marie- Claire vend aussi des repas, précisément le riz. C'est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Marie- Claire fait ses provisions pour préparer le riz. Quant aux vêtements, c’est à Lomé, Capitale de TOGO pays frontalier au Bénin que Marie- Claire fait ses achats. Marie- Claire a déjà bénéficié de cinq crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener ses activités à un stade supérieur. Pour renforcer son fonds de roulement dans l'optique de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Marie- Claire sollicite un sixième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
F. Marie-Claire was born on July 22, 1959 in Takon in the community of Sakété, in Plateau county in southern Benin. She is married to FATOKE Jacob; but she has been a widow for a year. She is the mother of three children who are all in school and now in her care. Marie-Claire sells clothing and shoes in Agblangandan, a district in the city of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She also sells meals, rice to be exact. Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin, is where she finds her provisions for making rice dishes. As for clothing, it is in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin, that she makes her purchases. Marie-Claire has already benefited from five loans with Alidé. She was able to use them to raise her business to a higher level. To boost her working capital with the aim of satisfying her customers more, she is requesting a sixth loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two 50-kg sacks of rice and seven dozen shoes, as well as clothing for children

loans.name: Marvic

texts.en:
Marvic B. is from the city of Oroquieta City. She is 43 years old. Marvic is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marvic owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marvic has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marvic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvic has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marvic is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marvic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To puchase additional stock

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla N. est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale. Agé de 32 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. komla désire avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en alimentant son magasin de nouveaux produits. Ce faisant il augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et par conséquents ses profits pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla N. is the owner of a general store. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He would like to use this loan to increase his business capacity by supplying his store with new products. By doing this, he will increase his turnover and consequently his profits in order to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his shop

loans.name: Paoline

texts.fr: H. Paoline est née le 21 Juillet 1982 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin. Paoline est mariée à AFFOGNON Abèl un mécanicien de profession. Paoline est mère d'un enfant. Paoline vend des mèches et produits de coiffure dans sa boutique à Abattoir sur la route de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. C’est au Nigeria, pays frontalier au Bénin que Paoline fait ses provisions de mèches et produits de coiffure. Paoline a déjà eu un crédit de ALIDé qu’elle a bien remboursé. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients Paoline sollicite un deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Paoline was born on July 21, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to AFFOGNON Abèl, a mechanic by profession, and is the mother of one child. Paoline sells hair extensions and hairdressing products in her shop in Abattoir on the road to Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Nigeria, a country bordering Benin, is where she acquires her supplies of goods. She has already had a loan from Alidé and has repaid it. To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more, she is requesting a second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and products for hairdressing

loans.name: Mr. Yoen Khem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people who all live in Khsom village in Kandal province make up the village bank and they will use the loan in different ways. Mr. Y. K. is the village bank president. He has been selected by the members. Mr. Y. K. is a fisherman who can catch a little fish for his living. In his business, he now faces a small problem because his boat is too old and it cannot go to catch the fish; thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a boat for this purpose. His wife, Mrs. Yom Keop, is conducting a firewood cutting business. They try to help each other in order to improve their living conditions. Mr. Y. K. has six children who are all working in different businesses.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is from the town of Landing, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Liza is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Liza owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Liza has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Liza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Patricia Guadalupe

texts.es: Patricia Guadalupe L. D. C. vive en Tenancingo el departamento D. Cuscatlán junto a su esposo Ernesto y sus dos hijas Guadalupe D. 9 años D. edad y Adamaris D. 2 años D. edad. El esposo D. patricia trabaja como albañil y da un aporte mensual D. 100$ a la familia; Patricia también trabaja ya que es ella quien monto y actualmente dedica tiempo para atender su negocio que es un tienda con variedad D. productos ubicada en su casa, Patricia solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir su tienda con mercadería que es solicitada por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Patricia Guadalupe L. D. C. lives in Tenancingo, in the department of Cuscatlán, with her husband Ernesto and their two daughters, Guadalupe, who is 9 years old, and Adamaris, who is 2 years old. Patricia’s husband works as a mason and provides the family with $100 per month. Patricia also works because she took the initiative to open a business, which is small store with a variety of products in her house. Patricia is requesting this loan because she wants to stock her store with merchandise that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Delphine

texts.fr:
B. Delphine est née vers 1973 à DANGBO dans la vallée de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Delphine est mariée à OLIVIER HINNNOUHO un menuisier de profession. Delphine est mère de deux enfants, tous deux scolarisés. Delphine vend des glacières, des tissus, des chaussures et des céréales. C’est à Lomé, Capitale de TOGO pays frontalier au Bénin que Delphine fait ses provisions de glacières, tissus et chaussures. Quant aux céréales, Delphine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Delphine achète ses produits sur commande et les distribue à crédit à ses clients. Delphine
a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé ; et Delphine rembourse ses crédits toujours sans aucune difficulté. Pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients, Delphine sollicite un troisième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
B. Delphine was born around 1973 in DANGBO in the Ouémé valley in southern Benin. She is married to OLIVIER HINNNOUHO, a cabinet-maker by profession, and is the mother of two children who are both in school. Delphine sells coolers (insulated containers), cloth, shoes, and grains. Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin, is where she acquires her supplies of coolers, fabrics, and shoes. As for grains, she supplies herself at Dantokpa, the grand international market of Benin. She buys goods by special order and distributes them on credit to clients. Delphine has already benefited from two loans from Alidé and has always repaid them without any difficulties at all. To bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more, she is requesting a third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy six 5-meter lengths of damask cloth, six small coolers, and two 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Verónica Maria

texts.es: Verónica Maria B. H. vive en Zaragoza en el departamento de La Libertad. Verónica tiene 25 años de edad es madre soltera de dos niñas Estefany de 10 años de edad y Camila de tan solo 7 meses. Verónica se dedica a la venta de pupusas los días viernes, sábado y domingo posee ganancias de un 46% sobre la venta. Verónica solicita un crédito para compra de materia prima para la elaboración de pupusas para aumentar su margen de producción al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Veronica Maria Beltran Hernandez lives in Zaragoza in the province of La Libertad. Veronica is 25 years old and is a single mother with two children, Stephanie, 10 years old, and Camilla, seven months old. Veronica sells pupusas on Friday, Saturday and Sunday. She earns a forty-six percent profit on what she sells. Veronica is asking for a loan for supplies to make more papusas. She would like to increase her production forty-six percent, equal to her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more supplies

loans.name: Ganchimeg

texts.en: Ganchimeg M. is 44 years old, married and the mother of three. She lives with her husband and youngest one on other's plot of land in Ulaanbaatar the capital city of Mongolia. Two children are grown up and live separately with their own family. In 2001, Ganchimeg started running a clothing sales business selling pajamas and bathrobes at the Narantuul, the biggest four season outdoor market in the capital city. She goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, once every month to purchase PJs and bathrobes at cheap prices and then resells them in Mongolia. With the profit, she bought a place to live for her eldest two children. Now she is saving a small amount for her youngest child's future university tuition. She requests a loan to purchase more pajamas and bathrobes to increase her business inventory. Her dream is to have big stalls at the famous shopping malls.

loans.use: To purchase pajamas and bathrobes

loans.name: Takku Liggey 13 Teffes Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Takku Liggey 13  Teffes regroupe des femmes et des hommes habitant un quartier en bordure de mer dans la ville côtière de Mbour située à 70 km de Dakar la capitale Sénégalaise. Ils s’activent dans des activités telles que la vente de chaussures, de tissus, de la restauration et de la pêche. Les revenus tirés de leurs différentes activités leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Avec le prêt qu’ils sollicitent ils veulent renforcer leur activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey 13 Teffes brings together women and men who live in a seaside area of the coastal city of Mbour, located 70 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. They are active in business, such as in selling shoes and fabrics, food catering, and fishing. The revenues derived from their different activities enable them to look after their children. With this loan they’re requesting, they want to bolster their commercial businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria Antonia M. D. D. resiD. en Santa Tecla en el departamento D. La Libertad. Maria vive en casa propia junto a su esposo Víctor y sus tres hijos Aarón D. 10 años D. edad, Josué D. 8 años D. edad y José D. un año D. edad. Maria tiene un negocio D. venta D. medicina popular que no requiere D. prescripción médica, el negocio D. Maria está ubicado en buena zona ya que se encuentra en el mercado Dueñas D. Santa Tecla un lugar muy transitado, las ventas D. los productos D. Maria son en efectivo y sus ventas son diarias, Maria solicita este crédito para compra D. medicinas que le hacen falta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Antonia Mejia D. D. lives in Santa Tecla in the state of La Libertad. Maria lives in her own house with her husband Victor and her three children: Aaron, ten years old, Josue, eight years old and Jose, one year old. Maria sells common medicines that don’t require a doctor’s prescription. Maria’s business is located in a good area. You will find it in the market called “Caretakers of Saint Tescla”, a very active place. Maria only sells her products for cash and the sales are daily. Maria is looking for a loan in order to buy medicine that she doesn’t offer currently in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. is a rice grower. She is 40 years old and has nine children. Her children also help her on the farm when they are not busy in school. The harvest she gets from her farm is intended for family use. Some excess is sold to rice traders as their additional living in the family.

With her heart to look after the needs of her children, she wants to apply for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and herbicides. She thinks that by doing so, she will be able to better support her family.

CEVI has helped her sustain her business. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
51-year-old Elizabeth P. is a mother of three. She has been assisting her husband in their farming business since 1994. They started with a one-hectare rice field. And they are planning to buy another hectare for the expansion of their business. This is their long-term plan. But presently, the couple is trying to sustain their business. Thus, Elizabeth is applying for a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) amounting to Php 10,000.00.

She is pleased with her membership in CEVI because aside from the loan she enjoys, she also gets to mingle with other people during their group meetings. She is able to share her feelings and faith with them in their devotional time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and other farming necessities

loans.name: Matilde Antonia

texts.es: Matilde Antonia B. reside en Tepetitán en el departamento de San Vicente. Matilde tiene 36 años de edad y vive con su pareja José y sus tres hijos Stanley de 17 años, Jessica de 18 años y Efrain de 7 años de edad, todos asisten a la escuela. José la pareja de Matilde se dedica a la profesión de albañil que le deja 200$ mensuales mismos que son de aporte para la familia, Matilde se dedica a la venta de huevos de gallina y a la elaboración de tortillas; Matilde solicita un crédito para comprar más huevos para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Matilde Antonia B. lives in Tepetitán in the state of San Vicente. Matilde is 36 years old and lives with her partner José and their three children: Stanley, seventeen, Jessica, eighteen and Efrain, seven. The children all go to school. Jose, Matilde’s partner, is a bricklayer. He earns $200 per month that goes towards the support of his family. Matilde sells chicken eggs and tortillas. Matilde seeks a loan in order to buy more eggs and increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of chicken eggs.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
52-year-old Elma J. always prioritizes her family’s welfare. She always sees to it that their four children are provided with their basic needs and their tuition and school fees are met on time. Thus, together with her husband, Elma strives hard to improve their farm financing business. This way, they’ll be able to provide for these needs especially with greater expenses in the future.

As an active member of the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), Elma is now asking for a loan of Php 10,000.00 to purchase fertilizer and other farming necessities. Elma is confident that with the help of God through CEVI, she and her husband will be able to improve their family’s financial status.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente S., a 56-year-old native from Norala, South Cotabato, values education so much. He is very determined to work harder to earn more to support the schooling of their four children. He wants to expand his present farming business in order to elevate their financial capacity to send their children to college. He wants to at least acquire an additional hectare (2.5 acres) of land and sustain his business needs for more seeds and other farming materials. He is currently applying for Php 10,000 loan from the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) as additional capital for the business.

Vicente is very satisfied with the services he gets from CEVI especially his chance to mingle with other people and be able to hear fresh biblical revelations in their monthly meetings.

loans.use: To buy seeds and other farming necessities

loans.name: Folashade

texts.en:
A. has a fish pond where she rears fish. She has over four thousand fish in her pond located at the back of her house. She has been in this business for the past eleven years. She is 44 years old and married with a child.

A. hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase more fingerlings and fish food. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more fingerlings and fish food

loans.name: Jomie

texts.en:
Aside from his farming business, Jomie D. of Norala, South Cotabato manages a piggery with his wife.

Jomie is 33 and the father of two. As a couple, their main goal is to send their children to school and see them obtain their degrees. This motivates Jomie to strive harder as a responsible breadwinner.

Jomie’s membership in the Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) paves his way to be closer to his dreams. He is applying for a Php 10,000 loan from CEVI. This sum will be used to purchase some farming necessities.

Jomie is blessed with their monthly meetings in CEVI because the learning he gets he also shares with his family. This makes him a better husband and father in the family.

loans.use: To buy farm necessities

loans.name: Santos Eduardo

texts.es: Santos Eduardo R. B. tiene 21 años de edad reside en San Salvador junto a su madre y sus hermanos. Lidia la madre de Santos es quien apoya a su hijo en el negocio ambos se dedican a la venta de pupusas que se encuentra ubicada en la casa donde viven, Santos ha manejado ya tres créditos en los cuales ha sido muy puntual y se encuentran cancelados en su totalidad a la fecha, ahora Santos solicita un nuevo crédito por que él y su madre siguen creciendo en su negocio y necesitan comprar más materia prima para la producción de pupusas.
texts.en:
Santos Eduardo R. B. is 21 years old, and lives in San Salvador alongside his mother and his brothers. Lidia, Santos' mother, supports Santos in their joint venture of making and selling pupusas (think corn tortillas) from their home. Santos has already received 3 loans, under which he was very punctual and complete with his payments. Santos is now requesting a new loan in order to grow his business and purchase more raw materials to make more pupusas.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Adekanbi

texts.en: M. sells drinks and bags; she started this business over five years ago and she hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more bags to sell.M. is 41 years old and married with four children. She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Soeun Shin Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank consists of 18 people located in Khsom village and they will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Soeun S. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. C. Sru, is a fisherman who fishes in the lake in the village. He catches few fish because he has insufficient fishing equipment. To solve this problem, Mrs. Soeun S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and fishing tools for her husband's business. Mrs. Soeun S. is 56 years old and the mother of five children, one of whom is assisting his father and another is employed in a garment factoR..

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and fishing tools

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
For the last four years, A. Nasiba has dedicated herself to selling clothing in the market. She began her business selling small quantities of clothes but over the years she has gone on to acquire greater quantities to sell. Nasiba began her business due to financial difficulties her family found itself in for a long time. Her husband’s income did not suffice to cover the household expenses which is why she decided to invest in this business. As the years went by, two children were born and her responsibility increased since it was necessary to work harder to maintain her humble home. Currently Nasiba requests 2500 Somoni in order to re-stock her clothing. She counts on your help and thanks all of you for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: W. Julien

texts.fr: A. W. Julien est né vers 1972 à Gbakpo dans la Commune de Akpro Missérété dans le Département de l’Ouémé. Julien réside dans cette Commune depuis son enfance et il y mène comme activité principale la mécanique. Julien est père de deux (02) enfants dont un (01) est scolarisé. Julien est un mécanicien vélo moteur. Pour améliorer ses prestations de mécanique dans le but d’accroître ses revenus, Julien a besoin de moyens financiers pour acheter les équipements nécessaires dans son atelier de mécanique. C’est la raison pour laquelle Julien sollicite un prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. W. Julien was born around 1972 in Gbakpo in the township of Akpro Missérété in the Department of the Oueme. Julien has lived in this township since infancy and he works here at his principal business as a mechanic. He is the father of 2 children, one of whom is enrolled in school. Julien is a bicycle/motorcycle mechanic. In order to improve the services he renders and to increase his income from them, Julien needs working capital to buy the necessary equipment for his mechanic's workshop. This is the reason why Julien is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mechanic's equipment

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 2 Immaculate Mercy Group

texts.en: I. Mercy is 20 years old, married with two children. She has been in business for two years so far, selling coffee as a cash crop. She is using this loan to purchase bags of coffee to add to her stock. This will improve her business, adding capital and allowing her to sell wholesale. I. Mercy is a hardworking business lady encouraging people in her community to work. Her dream is to construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of coffee

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo is the mother of three children and she is 50 years old. Although advanced in age, Fumilayo has shown no sign of relenting in her business. She is very determined to pull her family out of poverty and to increase her productivity and profitability. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Emily Aluoch

texts.en:
Emily is a mother of three school-aged children who works hard at her trade as a tailor.  She has been making dresses and mending clothes for over five years in the town of Kisumu, Kenya.  She sells her dresses on the road out of town.  

Emily is also experienced as a peer counselor and used to counsel people with sicknesses and children dealing with difficult issues.  

She hopes to use the proceeds of her loan to buy additional supplies and to expand the range of her clothing offerings.  In the video, Emily can be heard saying “I hope to boost my business to…have different clothes.  So if I get the money I will be very proud to do it.”

loans.use: Supplies to make clothing

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
37-year-old Nancy F. proves to herself and to her family that she is more than just a plain housewife. She started engaging in her farming business in the last 15 years to support her husband in meeting their needs, especially in financing their six children’s education. While they are obtaining a good income during harvest, Nancy still finds it insufficient, thinking that as their children are growing, so are their needs. With this in mind, Nancy desires to acquire an additional hectare (2.5 acres) of rice field to improve their harvest.

Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) is now helping her by lending her Php 10,000 as additional capital for her business. The institution is also providing her with new techniques in proper business management through their free training and seminars for active members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farming necessities

loans.name: Izatullo

texts.en:
E. Izatullo has a butcher shop and has been running a meat-selling business for 10 years. He provides the markets with meat and his family with food. Izatullo is 40 years old and married with four children. He is requesting a loan of $3,000 US. This micro entrepreneur is qualified to receive this loan considering the profitability of his business, his determination, and his experience. Izatullo is counting on your help. Your support will really help him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Mrs. Koemly Yi Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people living in Kaoh Reah Leu Village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes.

Mrs. Koemly Y. is the 47-year-old village bank president. Her husband, Mr. Chhum Dany, is a musician who is hired by people to play during weddings, parties, and so on. This couple has two children who are employed in a garment factory.

Mrs. Koemly Y. is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows vegetables. In her growing, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to grow more vegetables on her field. In order to solve this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticide for her cultivation. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s conditions with this loan.

All the members are in the picture but two of them are blocked.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizers and pesticide for her cultivation

loans.name: Sanam

texts.en:
Sanam sells a variety of men's shoes in the local market. By offering a range of shoes, she provides a convenient stop for her customers who often will buy more than just one item from her. She has had this retail business for about 10 years and is in the process of expanding it. 

Sanam lives in the town of Tursunzade with her husband and four children. She has requested a loan of 2500 Somoni to increase her working capital and help sustain her business. Purchasing inventory from wholesalers has required a substantial investment from Sanam which is why she decided to obtain a loan. This loan will give her added flexibility and will help cover some of her growing expenses while she develops a larger business. Additional profits generated by her business will provide her with a stable income and the ability to support her family financially.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 3 Masika Levenia Group

texts.en: M. Levenia is 35 years old and married with eight children in school. She has been buying and selling goats for over 12 years. She is using this loan to purchase goats to sell. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase goats to sell

loans.name: Farhod

texts.en:
Farhod sells different kinds of construction materials, including wallpaper, in one of the local markets. He has been in this trade for three years. Farhod is married with two children. He lives in Tursunzade.

Farhod has passed many milestones on his road to success. He has learned to adapt with each wave of change in the market world. Today he is a stable and confident entrepreneur with many bright ideas and plans for the future. One of his current plans is to increase his turnover capital with the help of a loan of $3000 US. Farhod is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude.

loans.use: To purchase new goods

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena C. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is 48 years old, married and has three adult children. Elena is from the town of Plaridel. She has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Elena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke sells drinks and pepper soup. Jumoke is 40 years old and married with three children. Jumoke hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and pepper soup ingredients. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup ingredients

loans.name: Zoir

texts.en:
N. Zoir is a young man who likes to make his own way. He runs a clothing business which is how Zoir supports his wife and son. Little by little, and with hard work his business has expanded. Still, Zoir wants his business to grow even more. For this reason he is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni that he will spend buying more merchandise. This way he will have new products to offer to his customers. With your help Zoir will be able to establish himself, save money, expand his business and form a family.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 42 years old. Adelfa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Adelfa owns & operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Adelfa has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Adelfa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Adelfa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Adelfa is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Adelfa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Umarali

texts.en:
R. Umarali is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 3 years. He is baking the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His father and sister help him with his business. Having many customers, Umarali sells the majority of his products just from his home. However, he runs a trading place in the central local market where he also sells ”lepeshka”. Umarali is requesting $2000 USD in order to purchase, at wholesale prices, the flour required for his bread baking. Umarali is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase flour at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Mrs. Saravy Nhoek Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of twenty-three members, is located in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province and they plan to use the loan, which they obtained, for different purposes. Mrs. Saravy N. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is a middleman who buys vegetable products to re-sell in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it S. she decided to request a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell to earn more income. Mrs. Saravy N., 44 years old, is a widow with two children, one is a grocer while the other is employed in a garment factory. 

Two members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 3 Biira Rose Group

texts.en: B. Rose is 38-years old, married, and has nine children in schooling. She has been selling cassava flour as a business for eight years, so far. She is using the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour for sale. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her kids and to buy a plot of a land.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose sells foodstuff. Bose is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Bose is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN50,000 to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Kihara Mothers 3 Musoke Edith Group

texts.en: M. Edith is 20-years old, married, with one child in schooling. She has been dealing in the cassava flour business for over one year. She is using the loan to purchase bags of cassava flour for sale. She is a hardworking business lady who encourages others to work and whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bags of cassava flour for sale.

loans.name: Olasanyi

texts.en: S. is 44 years old, married and has three children. She is a committed LAPO client. She is a seamstress and also sells clothing materials. She has been in business for eight years and needs a loan of NGN50,000 to purchase more clothing materials to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Шарифа Пулотова  1968 года рождения , замужем имеет 3 детей. Она сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2002 года.  Торгует на рынке женской одеждой. Она также является членом базарного совета , поэтому ее иногда заменяет сестра.  В настоящий момент  сезон летних вещей. Она должна съездить за товаром в Уратюбе и привезти летние халаты, кофточки . платья и многое другое. Благодаря поддержки КИВА улучшила свой товар и ассортимент.
texts.en:
Born in 1968, Sharifa P. is married and has 3 children. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2002. She sells women’s clothing at the market. She is also a member of the market union, so her sister helps her with the sales sometimes. Now is the season for summer clothing. Sharifa has to travel for the merchandise to Uratube and bring summer robes, blouses, dresses and such. Thanks to the support from Kiva, Sharifa improved her merchandise and variety.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Babughirana Women’S Group Kabongo Sharon

texts.en: K. Sharon is 23-years of age, married with one child. She also looks after three dependents who are all in schooling. She is a tailor and she has been performing her tailoring business for over three years now. She is going to use the loan to purchase clothing material for school uniforms,traditional wear (bitegi, gomes, etc.) for her customers. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase material for uniforms.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann sells provisions, such as drinks, wine, noodles, bathing soap, breveages, etc. Ann is 37 years old and married, with a child. Ann is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en: Monika is a mother of 3 and she is 36 years old. Monika sells frozen foods like turkey and chicken in her shop. Monika lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 in order to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Ndeye Mareme

texts.fr: ndeye mareme M. vend des produits cosmetiques depuis 2006.elle est parent beneficiaire et a une experience de plus de trois ans.a cause de l'accroissement progressive de ses ventes elle sollicite un credit de cinquante mille frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement afin de satisfaire sa clientele.
texts.en:
Ndeye Mareme M. has been selling cosmetics since 2006. She is a parent and member of the credit union and has an experience of more than 3 years. Because of the progressive growth of her sales, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 frs to bolster her working capital so that she can satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose F. sells smoked fish and fresh foods at Kpeme, in Hohoe. She has been in this business since 2000. Rose is married and has three children. Her husband is a pastor. She received junior high school education. She is responsible for all the financial needs of the children. Her loan will be used to buy assorted vegetables to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy assorted vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Хусаинова Манзура является  активным клиентом Микроинвест. Она сотрудничает с 2003 года. В начале имела небольшой оборот. Сейчас ее активы увеличились. Раньше она с подругой арендовали одно помещение.Так им выгодней, потому что оплачивали по полам. Теперь благодаря  поддержки КИВА она отделила  свой бизнес который и расширился.  Благодаря КИВА она улучшила свое семейное положение: дети учатся в  приличных Вузах. Также ее сын хочет купить ей машину. ,Поэтому она учиться на водителя.  Она благодарна за поддержку.
texts.en:
Manzura H. is an active client of MicroInvest. She has been working with us since 2003. At the beginning, she had a small turnover, and now her assets have grown. Previously, Manzura leased one space together with her friend. This was convenient because they each paid half. Now, thanks to Kiva’s support, Manzura separated her business, which also expanded. Thanks to Kiva, she improved her family’s condition – children now attend good universities. Her son also wants to buy her a car, so Manzura is learning how to drive. She is grateful for the support.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of summer merchandise

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: astou N. est vendeuse de bonbons importes.elle evolue aussi dans le domaine de la fripperie depuis 2001.elle est parent beneficiaire et habite a camberene.elle souhaite augmenter son fond de roulement pour mieux diversifier ses produits.elle sollicite un pret decent mille frs.
texts.en:
Astou N. sells imported candy. She has also been developing a business selling used clothing since 2001. She is a parent and a member of the credit union and lives in Camberene. She would like to increase her working capital so that she can better diversify her products. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her working capital

loans.name: Mukadas

texts.en:
A. Mukadas is a brave, married woman who works hard for the good of her 4 children. The strict discipline she uses with her children allows her to count on her household’s advice and support in working the fields. Mukadas’s children’s grateful attitude continues to encourage her, and they have gathered many lessons during this time that they can use when they form their own households. What Mukadas urgently needs right now are fertilizers and other chemicals for cultivating her land and to be prepared for upcoming growing season. Mukadas doesn’t need just good land, she also needs a friendly hand to help her out.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Ribbim

texts.en:
Born in Istaravshan town in 1970, O. Ribbim now lives with his wife and their 4 children. They are also responsible for caring for his elderly parents. Ribbim is a farmer. Recognized by the people of the neighborhood as a serious man, Ribbim would like to expand his crop into a viable source of income. In order to do that, he needs a loan of 8000 Somoni to buy seeds and fertilizer to expand his crop. The income from the sale of this crop will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and to educate all his children to a higher level of education. Ribbim is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.
