loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence H. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Florence sells provisions, stationeries and bottled water in Hohoe. Her husband is a teacher with a very low income to take care of the family. Florence uses all her income towards feeding, clothing and other financial needs of the children. With the high demand for the bottled water, Florence will use the loan to purchase provisions and bottled water in bulk and resell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Florence plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase provisions and bottled water in bulk.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Хаитов Мухиддин проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 34 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Мухиддин более 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Он в основном выращивает овощи. Клиент просит кредит, для покупки удобрений и посева нового урожая.
texts.en:
Muhiddin H. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has three children. Muhiddin has been in the agriculture for more than ten years. He mainly grows vegetables. The client is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for sowing of new harvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to sow second harvest

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en:
Yaw O. is single with no dependent. He has received schooling through senior high.

Yaw sells and rents compact disks and video cassettes at Bla in Hohoe. Yaw will use the loan to buy more of the current foreign movies to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Yaw plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more of the current foreign movies and sell

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.en: E. Firdavs is a 29-year-old man. His wife works as a housekeeper, and they have two small children. His family plans include moving forward with crop production so that he can financially support his children’s studies. Firdavs has been working in agriculture for four years. The biggest problem he faces is that pest insects have affected his crops, and he does not have enough money to deal with the problem. He is requesting this loan in order to use it for his crops, thus thwarting losses. Agriculture is his family’s source of income. For this reason, Firdavs gives thanks to IMON and Kiva for the support they give him via this loan, which will be of great benefit for his crops. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy insecticide

loans.name: Otabek

texts.en: T. Otabek is 50 years old and lives in Shahristan town with his wife who helps him with the living expenses. Otabek has two children who also help him. For seventeen years he has worked his land which produces potatoes and onions. His greatest dream is to be able to establish more crops to that he can leave equal parts to his children. He started farming when his parents taught him to work in this way. Otabek is requesting financing to be able to buy supplies to apply to his crops in order to get a good yield and sell more in the market. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Kiemiddin

texts.ru: Киемиддин Мусоев проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Клиент более 10 лет занимается предоставлением услуги, он имеет собственный трактор на котором пашет земли односельчан. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свой трактор.
texts.en:
Kiemiddin M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 35 years old. He is married and has four children. The client provides services for more than ten years, he has own tractor with which he plows the land for the villagers. The client is asking for a loan to repair his tractor.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the tractor

loans.name: Udofia

texts.en:
V. runs a dry cleaning outfit. She opens the business from 8 a.m. till 6 p.m. Mondays to Fridays and has attendants who help out in the business and are paid weekly.

V. started this business three years ago and needs a loan of N140,000 to purchase a drying machine. V. is 36 years old, married, and has four children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase a drying machine for her dry cleaning business

loans.name: Silas Aura

texts.en:
Silas W. is married with three children. He runs a semi-permanent food stall in Kisumu City's industrial area and has been in this business for the past year. He has two employees who assist him in serving his clients. His clients are mostly factory employees. He feels he has not fully exhausted his business's potential due to a shortage of capital. He learned about KADET through one of his friends after attempts to access a bank loan turned futile due to his inability to meet the requirements.

He intends to use the loan to increase his daily volume of supplies to be able to meet the demand for his clientele.  He hopes to expand the business and even relocate to more permanent premises.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To increase daily supply of fish and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Humorbi

texts.ru: Чумаева Хуморби проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имет 2 детей. Хуморби более 6 лет занимается услугой, она занимается пашивкой. Муж занимается услугой такси. Клиентка просит кредит, для закупа сырья, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Humorbi J. lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has two children. Humorbi has been providing services as a seamstress for more than six years. Her husband is a taxi driver. The client is asking for a loan to buy raw materials to provide quality services.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ainea Alex

texts.en: Ainea Alex is married with four children and runs a pharmacy in Vihiga town. He serves patients and private clinics around Gisambai Market. He runs the business himself and has been in it for the last seven years. This is Ainea’s fourth loan since he joined KADET. He has a good credit history with KADET as he pays his loans promptly. He plans to use the loan to buy more dispensing drugs for his pharmacy. He hopes to own a bigger dispensing pharmacy and even to create more job opportunities in the community. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to dispense

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace P. is married and has four dependents. She has received schooling through senior high. Her husband is a trader.

Grace sells clothes and bags at Hohoe, which she has done since 2004. She uses her income in payment of the fees and utility bills of her family. She will use the loan to purchase more of the shoes and bags she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед Нуралиев проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 34 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Чамшед более 8 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает кукурузу и овощи. Клиент просит кредит, для закупа минеральных удобрений и семян.
texts.en:
Jamshed N. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 34 years old. He is married and has five children. Jamshed has been in the agriculture for more than eight years. He mainly grows corn and vegetables. The client is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Teopista Kyazze's Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 43 years old and divorced with five children aged between 16 and 29, three of whom go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Teopista resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a restaurant in Kamwokya market in one of Kampala’s suburbs. She sells to an average of thirty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. She doesn’t incur any transportation costs as she buys from her place of work from suppliers who get produce from villages. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business, and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last seven years.

Teopista has been with MCDT for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more food and charcoal and cutlery. Teopista hopes to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more food, charcoal and cutlery

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан Пиров проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 44 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Хасан более 6 лет занимается сельским хозяйством, до этого он работал "экономистом". Хасан в основном выращивает овощи и кукурузу, а потом продает его на рынке. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы собрать свой урожай и посеить второй.
texts.en:
Hasan P. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 44 years old. He is married and has five children. Muhiddin has been in the agriculture for more than six years and used to work as economist before that. He mainly grows vegetables and corn and then sells it on the market. The client is asking for a loan to collect harvest and sow another one.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To collect the harvest and sow a second one

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline G. runs a small food business in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. She is married with four children ranging in age from 2 years to 11 years old.

For three years Jacqueline has sold food in Kigali, working long hours (6 a.m. till 11 p.m.) to contribute to the family’s finances. She currently earns 150,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month. Jacqueline has just requested her first loan through Vision Finance Company. She hopes that the 500,000 FRW loan will help her to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Madina Nalwoga‘S Group

texts.en:
Madina is the leader of a four-member group. She is a 43 years old and married with two children aged 16 and 22 who both go to school. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house where she lives with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day.

Madina resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells cereals in Owino Market and doesn’t incur any transportation costs as she buys from her place of work. She sells to an average of thirty people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for her business and feeding the family. She has been in this business for the last seven years.

Madina has been with MCDT for over ten years and is servicing her twentieth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more maize, beans, groundnuts (peanuts) and sorghum. Madina hopes to see her business grow bigger and to own permanent business premises.

loans.use: To buy more maize, beans, groundnuts and sorghum

loans.name: Bamidele

texts.en:
O. is 43 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Lagos State with her family.

O. sells drinks and snacks and also supplies sarongs. She started this trade eight years ago and needs a loan of N120,000 to purchase more drinks and sarongs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale sells tubers of yam. She is 38 years old and married with five children. She is requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yam to sell

loans.name: By The Grace Of God Group

texts.en:
Sanga is a married woman with 8 children.  Her oldest child is 25 and her youngest child is 10.  Those of her children who are still in school, go to private schools.    

Sanga has two businesses.  For her primary business, she sells various small things at a local market in the Lakpazee community of Monrovia, Liberia.  At this market she sells mainly onions, spices, bottles of oil, and salt.  She also has a business doing agriculture.  In that business, she grows rice and fufu.     

This is her second loan, and she will be restocking her market stand.  Right now her table is very bare from the sales she has made, so she will be restocking.

loans.use: To buy onions, pepper, salt, spices, and more oil

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Гафурова Заррина проживает в Варзобском районе. Возраст 42 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Заррина более 22 года занимается торговлей. Она в основном продает парфюмерию в торговом центре "Садбарг". Муж имеет столовую в университете. Клиентка просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Zarrina G. lives in the Varzob region. She is 42 years old. She is married and has three children. Zarrina has been in the retail business for more than 22 years. She mainly sells perfumes in the retail center Sadbarg. Her husband has a cafe in a university. The client is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Burigul

texts.ru: Аликулова Буригул проживает в Варзобском районе. Возраст 62 года. Муж занимается сельским хозяйством. Буригул более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Сын находится на заработках в России. Клиентка просит кредит, для закупа крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Burigul A. lives in the Varzob region. She is 62 years old. Her husband is in agriculture. Burigul has been in animal husbandry for more than fifteen years. Her son is now working in Russia. The client is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: United Friends #2 Group

texts.en:
Mathew is a shoe salesman in Monrovia.  He is on his second loan with LEAP.  He is requesting a loan in order to buy shoes from the wholesale market. He says that with the loan that he is taking, he will be able to buy between 10 – 50 pairs of shoes.  The amount of shoes will depend on the quality that he chooses to purchase.   

 Mathew explains that he stays competitive in his shoe sales by keeping his area very clean and by taking very good care of all of his customers. Mathew will use 50% of his profits to reinvest in his business and 50% of his profits for his daily needs.

loans.use: A new supply of shoes for his store

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal M. is a young entrepreneur and the owner of a small grocery store in Kabuga, Rwanda. She is 24 years old and married with no children.

Chantal works long hours to bring home an income, working from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. She currently earns a monthly profit of 400,000 Rwanda francs (FRW) to add to the 110,000 FRW her husband makes.

Chantal has requested a loan of 500,000 FRW to help her expand her business. Ultimately, with the profits from the loan, she would like to buy a house and start some family savings.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Курбонов Абдукарим проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдукарим более 9 лет занимается торговлей, до этого более 10 лет он работал шофером. Абдукарим в основном торгует запчастями. Клиент просит кредит, для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Abdukarim K. lives in the town of Vahdat. He is 42 years old. He is married and has three children. Abdukarim has been in the retail business for more than nine years and has worked as a driver for more than ten years before that. Abdukarim mainly sells spare parts. The client is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en: Madeleine Y. is an entrepreneur in Kigali, Rwanda. She offers secretarial services to the public at her shop. She is pictured here with her computer and paper-cutter where she performs services for others in her area. Madeleine is married with one two-year-old child. Her and her husband’s combined monthly income is currently at just 200,000 Rwandan francs (FRW). So, after two years in the business, Madeleine has requested her first loan with Vision Finance Company of 500,000 FRW to help her with the expansion of her business.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Keji

texts.en: Keji Y. is currently in the business of selling charcoal wholesale and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store.  Keji is 39 years old, married and her husband is an SPLA soldier. She has 3 children, all going to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land to build housing for rent. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build charcoal a store.

loans.name: Destine Sisters Group

texts.en:
Theresa is a married woman with three children.  Her oldest child is 13, her second oldest is 8, and her youngest is 5.  All 3 children attend private schools in Monrovia.  Theresa’s dreams center around these children.  She would like them to have a nice house to live in and she would like to be able to send them all to school, up to university.  

Theresa is a fish seller.  She is taking her first loan to restock her fish supply.  She says that with her loan she will be able to buy 3 bags of fish from the beach. Theresa will compete with all the other fish sellers by drying her fish with red wood. This will generate a nice smell and that will attract the customers.

loans.use: To buy three bags of fish for resale

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en: Vanessa I. is the 36-year-old married mother of four. She runs a general store in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. In addition to her four children, Vanessa also cares for two other children. Working almost 12 hours per day, she is able to bring home 150,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month to add to the 200,000 FRW her husband earns. After three years in the business, Vanessa has requested her first loan— worth 500,000 FRW— from Vision Finance Company to help her expand her business. 100217

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Fawusat

texts.en: Fawusat sells bread and cooked foods in her shop. Fawusat is 45 years old and she is a widow with 4 children. She is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN 100,000 to purchase more food ingredients and bread. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more food ingredients and bread.

loans.name: Soba

texts.en: Soba S. is currently in the business of selling tea along along the roadside of Malakia Street. She is requesting a loan She is married and her husband is a peasant. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land for her house. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy furniture and material to building a hotel.

loans.name: Juana Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Juana S. C. tiene 43 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene solamente un hijo a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, además de poseer este negocio, por las noches elabora comida en su vivienda, ella inicio su negocio con capital propio y con la ayuda de su familia que siempre la apoyaba con el negocio de la ropa. El financiamiento que solicita Juana es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa como pantalones, camisas, ropa para niños. El sueño de Juana es brindarles a sus hijos las mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Juana S. C. is a 43 year old single mother. She sells clothes for a living, which she's done for the past 10 years. In addition, she also makes food at home to sell at night. Juana started this food business with her own money, and with the support of her family, who always supported her clothing business. Juana is asking for a loan to purchase clothes, such as pants, shirts, and children's clothing. Juana's dream is to give her children better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Abinbola

texts.en: Abinbola is very happy with Kiva for their financial support. She is 55 years old and married with seven children. She sells clothes and sarongs. She is requesting the loan of N150,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Margarita Gloria

texts.es: La Señora Margarita Gloria Rubí B. tiene la edad de 59 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Margarita es la elaboración y venta de tiste y frijoles cocidos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella inicia este negocio por cuenta propia por lo que tenía que responsabilizarse por sus hijos ya que ella es madre y padre a la misma ves, y es así que decide establecer este tipo de negocio en su vivienda, ya que tenía que cuidar a sus hijos. Y es así que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, leña, cacao, canela  y frijoles. Los sueños de Margarita son de mejorar las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ms. Margarita Gloria Rubí B. is 59 years old. She is a single mother with 3 children who are in school. Margarita makes and sells cooked beans for a living, which she has done for the past 6 years. She began this business by herself in order to take care of her children, as she is their only parent. She therefore decided to establish her business in her home, in order to take care of her children. Margarita is requesting a loan to purchase corn, firewood, cocoa, cinnamon, and rice. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dio

texts.en: Dio M. is currently in the business of selling flour and sugar and is requesting a loan to stock more materials to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. Dio is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a shopkeeper. She has five children and her children go to school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more materials to sell

loans.name: Daniel Kipchirchir

texts.en: Daniel is twenty nine years old and married with one child. He operates a taxi in Eldoret town. Most of his customers hire him for his services both within Eldoret town and in its outskirts. He has been in the taxi business for two years. Daniel is intending to expand his business to serve customers outside Eldoret town. He also intends to graduate to transporting farm produce from the rural sector to urban places. Finally, he hopes to sponsor his wife to go back to college and further her studies in food science at Egerton University. Daniel believes that with this loan he will be able to increase his income thereby contributing to improvement of his family status. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy four new tyres for his taxi and to pay for its maintenance

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity, 42, has four children and lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.  She sells tins of milk in retail and wholesale and hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more tins of milk to sell. Charity says thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more tins of milk.

loans.name: Ebenezer #2 Group

texts.en:
Viola is a widow who is raising her 3 children as well as 4 others who lost their parents.  All of the children she cares for are in school, but she has to send them to government schools, which are not that good in her area. 

Viola’s business is selling drinks like soda, energy drinks, and even beers.  She says that her business seems to be going very well and it really encourages her to see it growing.  She says that her business attracts customers because she has all of her products clearly on display.  

Viola requested this loan from LEAP because she wants to restock her drinks supply. With this loan she will be able to buy cartons of most of the products that she sells.

loans.use: To buy crates of Red Bull, soda, and beer

loans.name: Rosario Angelina

texts.es: La Señora Rosario Angelina S. tiene 71 años. Es una mujer casada. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de frutas. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica  a este negocio. Ella inicio su negocio su negocio con muchas dificultades, por que su Mama no quería que trabajara, ya que a la edad que empezó a vender fue a la edad de 15 años, pero esto no detuvo a Rosario por lo que decide realizar financiamientos para que su negocio no decayera, y por medio de estos no perdió su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de mangos, melones, naranjas, tomate y cebollas. El deseo es seguir trabajando para seguir progresando como lo ha hecho hasta los momentos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario Angelina S. is 71 years old and married. She buys and sells fruits for a living, which she has done for the past 6 years. Rosario began her business with much difficulty, as her mother did not want Rosario to work. Rosario was only 15 years old when she started working, but this did not stop her from raising money to support her business. Rosario is requesting a loan in order to buy mangos, melons, oranges, tomatoes, and onions. Her desire is to keep working and keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Konyo

texts.en:
Konyo J., currently in the business of selling beans and paste, is requesting a loan to purchase groundnut to make more paste for sale. Thirty years old and married to a driver, Konyo has two children, both of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and build a rental shop

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase groundnut to make more paste for sale.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora María de los Ángeles M. tiene 39 años de edad. Su negocio es una pulpería. Y esta ubicada en su vivienda, María obtiene sus productos en camiones repartidores ya que tiene la facilidad de que los productos lleguen hasta su vivienda, ella vive con sus padres que ya son mayores de edad. María lucho para seguir adelante con su negocio a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, con condiciones especiales lo cual le demanda a mayor parte del tiempo y gastos económicos. Pero es una mujer luchadora y es por eso que ha podido sostener su negocio por más de 3 años con el apoyo incondicional de sus padres. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, pan, jugos y refrescos naturales. El sueño de María es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de los Ángeles M. is 39 years old and runs a general store, which is located in her home. Maria has the products she sells delivered to her home. She lives with her parents, who are senior citizens. Maria struggled to move ahead with her business, despite life's difficulties. She has 1 child with special conditions, which demands a lot of Maria's time and financial expenditures. However, she is a fighter, which is why Maria has been able to sustain her business for over 3 years with the unconditional support of her parents. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase sweets, soda, bread, and juice. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah sells loaves of bread in retail to her customers. A 56-year-old widow with six children, Deborah hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Alisia

texts.en:
Alisia M. is currently in the business of selling varous items at the shop and is requesting a loan to stock more items to sell. Twenty-nine years old and married to a nurse, she has five children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, Alisia hopes to be able to buy land and build it for settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more goods to sell

loans.name: Lucia Ramona

texts.es: Lucia Ramona R. tiene la edad de 48 años, es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos y ambos estudian y laboran con ella. La actividad económica de Lucia es la venta de ropa. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente vendía cosméticos, pero no pudo seguir con este negocio por que algunos clientes no le daban los pagos de sus productos, pero por ayuda de una amiga que le conseguía ropa de manera favorable le propone que ofrezca ropa a sus clientes. Con el dinero que solicita será invertido en capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa nueva como camisas para niños, faldas, shorts, pantalones entre otras cosas. Su deseo es tener un negocio estable para proporcionarle estabilidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia Ramona R. is 48 years old, married, and has two children who both study and help their mother. Lucia has made a living selling clothing for more than 20 years. She used to sell cosmetics, but had to give that business up because clients didn’t always pay for the products they bought. A friend of hers helped her start her current business buy helping her find clothing to sell. The money requested will be used for working capital to buy new clothing such as: children’s shirts, skirts, shorts, pants and other items. She would like her business to be stable so she can offer her children stability.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly Velásquez C. tiene la edad de 42 años, es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la compra y venta de ropa. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación del negocio de Nelly es de manera ambulante. Por lo que ha pasado por un sin numero de problemas, ya que su hija tiene enfermedades del hígado y han recurrido a los hospitales ya que los medicamentos han sido muy caros, pero es una mujer muy responsable, es por eso que para ella es muy importante que a su hija no le falte nada. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa para niños, adultos y adolescentes. Los sueños de Nelly son de preparar a sus hijos para la vida y que la salud de su hija mejore.
texts.en:
Nelly is 42 years old. A single mother taking care of four children, she buys and sells clothing. For over 20 years she has worked as a street vendor. However, despite her success she has not been without problems. Her daughter suffers from liver illness and they have turned to hospitals even though the medicine has been very expensive. Nevertheless, Nelly is a responsible woman and it is very important to her that her daughter never lacks what she needs. The loan that she requests is for the purchase of clothing for children, adults, and teenagers. Nelly’s dreams are to prepare her children for life and for her daughter’s health to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clothing for her to sell

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola S. is currently in the business of selling bread and tomatoes and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Thirty years old and married to a policeman, she has six children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and build it for settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a bakery.

loans.name: Fawusat

texts.en: Fawusat is a fashion designer and she sells foodstuff in her shop. Fawusat is a mother of 5. She is 45 years old and married. Fawusat is requesting for a loan in the amount of NGN100,000 to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Adjoavi

texts.fr: Cette femme âgée de 35 est mariée et mère de 01 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier d’agoè qui est un quartier au nord de la ville de Lomé, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de quincaillerie. Elle exerce ce commerce dans une boutique. Sa clientèle est composée d’entrepreneurs, les maçons et les peintres. Le stock dont elle dispose présentement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 03 pots de peinture, 04 boîtes de vernis, 05 boîtes de faume, des carreaux et divers articles de quincaillerie.
texts.en:
This woman of 35 is married and the mother of one child. She lives with her family in the Agoè neighborhood which is a district in the north of the city of Lomé. She sells hardware to earn a living. She sells out of a shop. Her clientele is composed of entrepreneurs, masons, and painters.

The stock she presently has does not permit her to satisfy her customers, so she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 3 tins of paint, 4 tins of varnish, 5 tins of "faume", tiles, and various other items in the line of hardware.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware for resale

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy C. is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a girl who is currently in junior high school. She lives with her daughter in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Dorothy is a petty trader. She sells food items – rice, tomatoes, yams, cassava, etc. She sells on a table top at the market square. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Dorothy also supplies to food vendors. She buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for over ten years. She aspires to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy food items for resale

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is twenty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a boy, who is currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and son in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a mason by profession while she is a petty trader.

Gifty sells meat on a table top at the market square. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. Gifty buys her meat from Kumasi. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat for resale

loans.name: Bogdan

texts.en:
Bogdan offers transportation services in Ivano-Frankivsk where he is originally from. He started his business about 8 years ago, after he quit working as a public van driver. This enterprise has been an effective source of income for his family of four – his wife Lidiya and two daughters, 12 and 9 years old. Currently, his monthly income is about 7,000 Grivnas.

Bogdan works 16 hours a day to provide a decent living for his family. Right now he’s faced with a need to do some repair work on his vehicle. He is requesting a 15,000 UAH loan to fix his car engine. Bogdan has many challenges in his work. However, he doesn’t want to go back to being a hired employee, preferring to work for himself. He is saving money for his children's college education.

loans.use: to fix his car engine

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a farmer while she is a food vendor.

Abena prepares and sells "kenkey" (a staple dish similar to a sourdough dumpling). She sells on a table top at the market square. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. Abena has been in business for twelve years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk to produce "kenkey"

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica K. is fifty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, four sons and one daughter. All are currently in school – senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works with a cocoa marketing company.

Veronica runs a chop bar. She prepares and sells local dishes like ‘fufu’, ‘banku’, rice balls, etc. Veronica wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for two years. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to prepare dishes to sell

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha P. trades in bush meat. She buys the game meat from hunters in her locality. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies food vendors and restaurant operators in her community. Agatha has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk.

Agatha is 43 years old, divorced and has two daughters, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy bush meat

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed K. is a carpenter by profession. He makes furniture such as wardrobes, sofas, beds, etc. for sale. He wants a loan to buy working materials such as wood, plywood, nails, etc. He has been in business for three years.

Mohammed is 49 years old, married and has six children – two sons and four daughters. They are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. His wife is a trader. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town. Mohammed is hoping to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To buy working materials

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is a fish monger. She sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Agnes buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk.

Agnes is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a family house in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Agnes wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi sells foodstuffs and she also grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans in her shop. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina A. is twenty-nine years old, married, and has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in the primary school. Faustina lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic while she is a fishmonger.

Faustina sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a table at the market square and also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is thirty-five years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children – all girls. She lives with her daughters in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Joyce is a professional hairdresser. She has three apprentices who are currently under training. Her shop is located by the roadside. She buys her working materials such as artificial hair, shampoo, pomade, cream, lotion, etc. from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy materials in bulk to be able to render quality services to her cherished clients. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair and other items for her salon

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha A. is a baker who bakes bread for distribution in Hohoe. Martha has been baking since 2004. Her loan will be used to buy bags of flour and other ingredients to bake varieties of cookies to sell. 
Martha is married and has two children. Her husband is a trader. She has received a junior high school education. She is responsible for all the financial needs of the entire family. She hopes to save the new profit from her business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients for cookies

loans.name: Olubode

texts.en:
E. is 38 years old and is married to Olubode, a painter. They have four children. The family lives in Lagos State.

E. sews clothes and also sells tailoring materials. She has been in business for five years and needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase a weaving machine while the balance will be used to purchase tailoring materials to sell.

loans.use: To purchase an industrial weaving machine and tailoring items

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina A. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to six children: two sons and four daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Georgina is a fishmonger and sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a table at the market square and also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes them herself. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. Georgina desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience Z. sells clothes in Hohoe. Her loan will be used to buy shoes and bags to add to what she sells. Patience is married and has one child. Her husband is a farmer who depends on the weather for his farming activity. She has received a junior high school education. She is responsible for paying the housekeeping expenses and utility bills. Patience hopes to reinvest the new profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy shoes and bags

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia K. is thirty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in the primary school. She lives with her daughter in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Lydia is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a table at the lorry (truck) station in the mornings. She buys her goods from nearby communities and wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Lydia has been in business for ten years. She aspires to expand her business and give her child a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Afusat

texts.en: Afusat is 40 years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors in her house. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is very happy with the credit facilities given to her by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Mba'apora Group

texts.en:
The committee Mba’apora is in its fifth cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya.  Each participant manages a line of credit between 20 and 240 U$D.  They have commented that each woman gets up at about 4:30 am, whether it’s hot or cold, in order to earn a living for the day.  They go to the Market 4 in Asunción or to the city Clorinda, in Argentina in order to purchase their merchandise at a good price.  They thank the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the help. 

1 Fidelina B.- Fruit and vegetable sales                     
2 Bernardita G. D. M. Carbonera – Diner                  
3 Eugenia F. D. Ovelar – Meat sales                      
4 Eusebia G. – Undergarment sales                                    
5 Wilma P.- Saleswoman                                    
6 Isabel V. – Candy sales                                       
7 Graciela B. – General sales                               
8 Sofia C. – Food sales                                                  
9 Delia C. – Convenience store

19 Hermelinda Z. – General sales                                        
20 Carolina P. - General sales                                                 
21 Laura A. – Hair salon

loans.use: To purchase fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis K. is a cobbler by profession. He makes all kinds of footwear – shoes, slippers, sandals, etc. for men and women. His workshop is located at the roadside. He procures his working materials from Kumasi. Francis has been in business for 18 years and wants a loan to buy more goods.

Francis is 34 years old, married and has two daughters. Both are currently in primary school. His wife is a trader. He lives with his wife and daughters in a rented apartment in the town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town.

loans.use: To buy leather and shoe soles

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionicio tiene 51 años, está separado de su esposa y vive sólo con su hija de 16 años en su casa propia. Él es un hombre muy honrado y trabajador que desde muy joven se inició en el negocio de la venta de pescado, debido a la gran demanda que hay de nutritivo alimento. Se levanta desde muy temprano para comprar a su proveedor grandes cantidades, las cuales vende en su pequeño puesto del mercado Huamantanga, esto es en el distrito de Puente Piedra a 3 horas del centro de Lima. La venta le resulta muy buena, ya que Dionicio es muy carismático y al ofrecer sus productos nadie puede resistirse a su poder de convencimiento, además se preocupa de que los peces que vende estén en el mejor estado posible, vendiendo productos de calidad. A Dionicio siempre le ha gustado su trabajo y lo realiza con mucha alegría, su hija a veces lo ayuda en la atención de los clientes cuando él debe salir a traer más mercadería. Por otro lado, su trabajo no es nada fácil ya que debe permanecer en su puesto hasta que termine de vender todo, no puede guardar nada para el día siguiente, teniendo pérdidas cuando esto ocurre, lo cual no sucede muy a menudo para el bien de Dionicio y su hija. Ambos ponen muchas ganas para hacer crecer su negocio, esperando en un futuro tener un puesto más grande donde vendan mayor variedad de productos. Este es su tercer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, Dionicio se caracteriza entre todos sus compañeros por ser muy puntual en sus pagos, es por eso que lo estiman mucho y confían en su trabajo responsable. Con el dinero que ahora solicita hará un mayor pedido de pescado para aumentar las ventas en su puesto.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 51 years old, he is separated from him wife and lives with his 16 year old daughter in his own home. He is a very honorable and hard-working man and since he was young he started a business selling fish because of their great demand as a nutritious food. He gets up very early to buy in bulk from his provider, and he sells from his small stall in the Huamantanga market, in the district of Puente iedra which is 3 hours from the centre of Lima. His sales are very good as Dionisio is very charismatic and no one can resist being convinced by his product. He is always careful to ensure that the fish he sells are in the best condition possible and that he is selling quality produce. Dionisio has always liked his work and he does it happily. his daughter sometimes helps him out with the clients when he has to go and get more produce.

However, his work is not easy as he must stay at his stall until he has sold everything - he cannot keep anything until the next day - and he sometimes loses out which cannot happen often for the good of Dionicio and his daughter. They both put a lot of effort into seeing the business grow, hoping for a larger stall where they could sell a wider variety of produce in the future. This is his third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and Dionicio is known by all his colleagues as being punctual with payments, and this is why they look up to him an trust in his responsability. With this loan he will buy a bigger load of fish to increase the sales from his stall.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina B. is forty-one years old. She is widowed and has given birth to six children: three daughters and three sons who are all still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana.

Georgina is a trader, trading in jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, chains, rings, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Georgina also deals in all kinds of ladies’ wear. She sells at the market square in her community. She also hawks (goes door-to-door) and treks to other markets to sell as well. Georgina has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy jewelry in bulk

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 40 años, está separada de su pareja, vive con 4 sus hijos; Jhon de 22, Wini de 14, Jorge de 11 y Alvaro de 8 años. Su negocio es la venta de fruta, la cual trae desde la ciudad de Huaral (a 3 horas de Lima) en su propio carro que maneja ella misma. A Flor le gusta sentirse independiente, pues se considera una mujer muy fuerte y que puede lograr lo que se propone; además cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, que si bien no la ayudan con labores físicas siempre están con ella para darle ánimos y pasar tiempo junto a ellos es otra de las ventajas que posee con su trabajo. Pero no todo es tan fácil, ya que el peligro en las carreteras es cada vez más frecuente, felizmente Flor siempre toma precauciones y conduce con mucho cuidado. Adicionalmente, se dedica a la venta de lotes (terrenos), para una empresa de bienes raíces, aprovechando así, su auto para el traslado de sus posibles clientes hasta los terrenos que ofrece. En el futuro, a Flor le gustaría incursionar en otro tipo de negocio, pero aún no se decide en cual, por lo pronto se siente feliz con lo que hace. Ella se encuentra en 9no préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y muy amistosa con sus compañeras de grupo, quienes le tienen mucha estima. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará algunas averías de su carro para que pueda funcionar en óptimas condiciones, también comprará más fruta para la venta.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old and she is separated from her partner. She lives with her 4 kids; John who is 22, Wini who is 14, Jorge who is 11 and Alvaro who is 8 years old. She is in business selling fruit which she brings from Huaral (3 hours from Lima) in her own car that she drives. Flor likes to feel independent and she considers herself to be a strong woman who can achieve what she puts her mind to. She also is supported by her kids who, although not helping with physical labour, are always with her encouraging her and spending time with them is one of the advantages of the job.

However, it is not always easy and the highways are more and more dangerous. Happliy for Flor she is a very careful driver. Moreover, she also sells plots of land for a real estate company and she also uses her car to take clients to see the plots that she's offering. In the future Flor would like to have a different type of business, although she hasn't decided in what yet, but at the moment she is happy with what she is doing. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she has always been very punctual with her payments. She is friendly with many members of her group who look up to her a lot. With this loan she will tune up some parts of her car so that it runs at its best. She will also buy more fruit to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and to tune up her car/Incremento de mercadería y refacción de su carro

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ataa

texts.en:
Ataa P. trades in food items – flour, sugar, rice, etc. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. Ataa wants a loan to buy food items in bulk in order to increase her stock. She buys her goods from nearby communities and Kumasi. Ataa has been in business for 12 years.

Ataa is 41 years old, married and three children: two sons and one daughter. All are currently in junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a trader. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Ataa wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Ii Group

texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Unidas II formed on November 4, 2008, thanks to the director of the group, Mrs. Elba S., who works selling jewelry and accessories. She contacted a loan officer who worked in the area in order to find out more about the program Women Entrepreneurs. She was then able to group 17 women who liked to work together.  They are now in their third loan cycle, and work together in a supportive way. 

The credit for each woman goes toward her respective small business. They all participate in additional activities in order to save as a group, and to mutually help each other achieve their common goals, both individual and as a group. 

1.	Elba S.-	Accessory and jewelry sales 
2.	Amelia C.-	Food sales
3.	Lourdes Fernández-	Accessory and jewelry sales 
4.	Luciana M.-	General sales
5.	Rafaela  E.-	Fruit and vegetable sales 
6.	Segunda R.-	Food sales 
7.	Juliana A.-	Cosmetics sales 
8.	Sara R.- 	Cosmetics and undergarments sales 
9.	Zulma F.-	Fruit sales 
10.	Emilia S.-	Food sales 
11.	Luisa R.-	Food sales 
12.	Marta C.-	Food and candy sales 
13.	Bernarda R.-	Food sales 
14.	María Martínez-	Fruit sales 
15.	Michel C.-	Accessory and jewelry sales 
16.	Sebastiana P.-	Candy, oil and CD sales 
17.	Regina D. P.-	Food sales

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale or of raw materials

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una madre trabajadora, tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijas de 15 y 8 años; ya que su esposo viajó a España a trabajar para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Es por eso que María al quedarse sola optó por generar una fuente de ingresos adicional, decidiéndose por algo que pueda realizar desde su hogar sin dejar de velar por sus hijas. Entonces comenzó a vender productos de belleza, lo cual le permite obtener ganancias desde su propio domicilio, además le gusta su trabajo porque vende sus productos a personas conocidas, amigos, familiares y vecinos, por lo que trabaja dejando sus productos con garantía, sin caer en deudas que la perjudiquen. Las ganancias son buenas, ya que por cada producto que vende gana el 25%, además con su facilidad de palabra y carisma logra convencer de que adquieran sus productos. María en el futuro quiere implementar un pequeño bazar en su propia casa donde exhiba mejor sus productos y logre mejores ingresos. Este es su tercer ciclo de préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, nunca tuvo problemas de retrasos en los pagos, ya que siempre fue muy responsable, al igual que el resto de su grupo con quienes dice tener mucha química. Con el dinero solicitado hará pedidos de sus productos en mayor cantidad para tener un stock más amplio y variado.
texts.en:
Maria is a working mother. She is 45 years old and she has two daughters who are 15 and 8 years old. Her husband went to Spain to work and give them a better quality of life. This is why, upon finding herself alone, Maria decided to generate some more income, dedicating herself to something she could do from home so as to not leave her kids. She started to sell beauty products, which allows her to earn from her own home. She really like his work because she sells to people she knows; friends, family and neighbours, and she leaves them her products on guaruntee, without falling into dangerous debt. She earns well as for each product she sells she earns 25%. She is a good saleswoman too and with her charisma she manages to convince people to buy her products. In the future Maria would like to have a small shop in her home from where she could better exhibit her products and earn more. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has never been late on payments as she was very responsible like the rest of the group with whom she has good chemistry. With this loan she will buy products in bulk to have a bigger and wider range of stock.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one son and two daughters. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Afia trades in vegetables such as onions and also smoked fish on a table at the market square. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She buys her goods from nearby farming communities and from Kumasi. Afia has been in business for five years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 24 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su bebé de pocos meses de nacido, en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace más de un año para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar, su pareja estudia y trabaja a la vez y ella quiere aportar también con los gastos de su hogar para brindarle a su bebé lo mejor. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo en su casa sin tener que salir y descuidar a su hijo, el cual requiere de muchos cuidados ya que aún es muy pequeño. Las ventas son buenas, pues con su gran carisma logra vender entre sus vecinas muchos productos, resultándole muy rentable su negocio, el cual va creciendo poco a poco. Maritza espera tener una gran tienda donde pueda ofrecer con mayor comodidad su mercadería, sabe que si le pone más dedicación y esfuerzo logrará cumplir todas sus metas para sacar adelante a su familia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, espera que le vaya muy bien como en sus anteriores préstamos, en los cuales ella y sus compañeras fueron muy puntuales. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para aumentar su stock y así lograr mejores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Maritza is 24 years old and she lives with her partner, the father of her baby who is a few months old, in their own home. She has sold cosmetics for a living for more than a year in order to meet the household costs. She partner studies and works as well and she also wanted to support him with their outgoings to give their baby the best. The good thing about her work is that she can do it from home without having to go out with her son, who requires a lot of care as he is still very young. Her slaes are good as she is very charismatic when it comes to sales, which means that her business is very profitable and is growing bit by bit. Maritza hopes to have a big store where she can offer her produce more comfortably, and she knows that with some more dedication and effort she will accomplish all his goals and her family will move forward. This is her third credit with MFP and she hopes it goes well as her previous loans with which she and her colleagues were very punctual. With this loan she will buy larger quantities of cosmetics to increase her stock and thereby increaseher earnings for her home.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet O. trades in maize. She wants a loan to buy bags of maize in bulk. She supplies to other retailers and food vendors. Harriet buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for seven years.

Harriet is 36 years old, married and has three children: one son and two daughters. All are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a trader. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Harriet wants to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Ofori

texts.en:
Ofori A. is twenty-seven years old, is single and has no child. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town.

Ofori is a trader dealing in palm oil. He buys palm oil from surrounding communities and treks to sell. He supplies mostly to retailers and food vendors. He has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy palm oil in large quantities to be able to supply to more customers.

loans.use: To buy palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. runs a provisions store. She sells groceries such as Milo, sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store on the street. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business.

Doris is 26 years old, married and has three children: two sons and one daughter. All are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso.

Doris is a hardworking woman. She is hoping to improve upon her standard of living and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Rincon Portada Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Germán Buch ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, hace más de cinco años, se formo la asociación “21 de Septiembre”, Verónica B. que actualmente es la presidenta, es una de las fundadoras, invitando a sus vecinas y amigas a formar parte del grupo.
Las integrantes de este grupo en su mayoría tienen a los alimentos  como base fundamental de sus negocios, por ejemplo, se dedican a la venta de fruta de la temporada, elaboración y venta de comida, venta de verduras, carne de pollo, refrescos, viveres, otras también se dedican al tejido. Necesitan comprar  otras variedades  de frutas, insumos para la preparación de alimentos y mayor cantidad de productos.
texts.en:
More than five years ago, in the focal centre of German Buch, located in the city of El Alto, the '21st of September' association was formed. The current president and one of the founders, Veronica B., invited her friends to become part of the group.

The members of this group are mainly involved in the food trade as a basis of their businesses. For example, they dedicate themselves to selling seasonal fruits, making and selling foods, selling vegetables, chicken, soft drinks, general groceries and others also knit and weave. They need to buy more fruits and ingredients for the preparation of food and more products.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and ingredients/COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS E INSUMOS

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
Kwasi A. is forty-four years old. He is married and has three children: two sons and two daughters who are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. His wife is a trader.

Kwasi is also a trader, trading in cereals such as maize, etc. He buys his goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in his community. He also treks to other markets to sell on their market days. He supplies to food vendors and retailers. He has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
Salvador G. (cachucha blanca)es originario de una comunidad rural llamada La Ica, a una hora del puerto de VeraC., con una población de no mas de 600 habitantes.

Don Chava como lo conocen en su comunidad se dedica a la cria y venta de borregos. El estuvo trabajando en los Estados Unidos cerca de 6 años, en un inicio en el campo y despues en un restaurante. El tuvo que volver a su país ya que enviudo y tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales aun tres de ellos viven con el.

Don Chava inicio con esta actividad hace 2 años. Es por esto que solicita el credito para comprar alimento para sus boregos. Su meta es poder tener un terreno propio, ya que en el lugar donde los tiene actualmente es prestado.

Es integrante de un grupo llamado las abejitas el cual esta conformado por 4 hombres y 8 mujeres los cuales entre otras cosas se dedican a labores como cría - venta de borregos, antojitos regionales, venta de productos por catalogo y comercio en general.

Ellos solicitan un crédito de $53,000 para poder invertirlo en sus diferentes actividades y poder seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y las de sus familias.

Los otros integrantes del grupo y sus actividades son:

Irma B. H....venta de antojitos regionales
Rosa M. C. ROSA...productos naturistas
Juan Miguel L. M....papeleria
Adriana S. C. ...venta de ropa
Jesus N. M....abarrotes
Martha G. S....venta de ropa
Araceli N. A....venta de ropa
Simon M. T....cria de puercos y pollos
Sandra P. C....venta de ropa
Amada G. P....venta de plastico
Eva C. J....venta de puercos
texts.en:
Salvador G. (white cap) is from a rural community called La Ica. La Ica is a small town with only about 600 people located an hour from the port in VeraC.. Don Chava, as members of his community know, raises and sells sheep. He worked in the United States for 6 years first on a farm and then in a restaurant. He had to return to his country when he became a widow and had to take care of his five children. Three of his children still live with him. Don Chava has been raising sheep for two years and this is the reason he is asking for a loan. He wants to buy food for his sheep. His goal is to have his own land since he is keeping his sheep on land that is borrowed right now. He is a member of a group called “Las Abejitas” that is made up of four men and eight women. The members of this group make a living by raising and selling sheep, selling regional foods, selling products from catalogs, and general commerce. They are asking for a loan of $3,975 to invest in different businesses to be able to continue improving their quality of life and that of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Alimento para Borregos

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua G. is a twenty-one-year-old young lady. She is single and has no child. She lives with her mother in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Akua is a caterer and deals in pastries. She prepares and sells pastries such as chips (french fries), meat pies, doughnuts, etc. She hawks (goes door-to-door) to sell in her community and also supplies other retailers in her community. She buys bags of flour from Kumasi.

Akua has been in business for three years now and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. trades in meat. She sells on a tabletop at the market square. She also supplies other retailers and food vendors in her community. Mary buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk.

Mary is 48 years old, married and has five children: two sons and three daughters who are all currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is a farmer. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Mary wants to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim H. is 29 years old. He is single and does not have children. He lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town.

Ibrahim is a tailor by profession. He sews all kinds of designs for men. He has some apprentices who are training under him. His workshop is located by the roadside. Ibrahim procures his working materials, such as fabrics and other items, from Kumasi. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy working materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is thirty-one years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children: a boy and a girl who are both currently in the primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Cecilia is a trader, trading in bush meat. She buys the game meat from the local hunters and supplies to food vendors and restaurant operators in her community. Cecilia has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy meat in bulk. She desires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy meat in bulk

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
