She is very efficient and her fellow members want her to continue being treasurer. With the money she is asking for, she will buy a bag of seeds for a specific type of seed the will produce a bigger pea.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de semilla de arverja

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es:
La señora María Cecilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y es madre de 02 hijos, los 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su mamá emprendió un pequeño  negocio de venta de abarrotes con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son los vecinos de su barrio.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz de la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
María Cecilia belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro Community Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is 30 and in a common law marriage. She has two dependent children who attend school. Encouraged by her mother, and needing to contribute to the household income, she used her first loan for 300 PEN to set up a small business of selling groceries. She got very good results from the beginning due to the quality of her products, her comfortable prices, and the good attention she gives her customers. She currently continues with the same business, which is located in her house. Her primary customers are her neighbors. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy more products to stock her business. She will buy products such as kilos of rice and sugar, eggs, supplies for personal hygiene, household cleaning supplies, packages of soft drinks, sweets, and other products to keep her customers happy. She feels very happy about the work and service offered. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people like her who want to work and get ahead. She hopes they continue like this for a long time, helping many families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to augment her products

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La señora María Cleofe R. V. tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Incompleta, tiene 1 hijo que depende económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de pan, cuando inicio con Manuela Ramos ya tenía  su negocio el cual lo desarrolla en afueras del Mercado de su distrito, también se dedica a lavar ropa esa actividad lo realiza dos veces a la semana.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Viva con Esperanza II, lo invirtió en la compra de paltas, huevos y naranjas para  vender como complemento a su pan.
Este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de pan y huevos para incrementar su negocio.
María tiene como sueño tener su cafetín para brindar un mejor servicio y crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
María Cleofe R. V. is 55 years old. She lives in the district of Porvenir, in the province of Trujillo, and in the department of La Libertad, Perú. She was unable to complete her grade school education. She has one child that depends on her economically. She makes a living by selling bread. When she started with Manuela Ramos she already owned her own business. She runs her business outside of the main market place of her district. She also makes additional income by washing clothing for people twice a week. Her first loan was for $100 (300 Soles) which she received through "Banco Viva con Esperanza II". She invested the money in purchasing avacados, eggs and oranges to sell with her bread. This next loan that she is requesting for $100 (300 Soles) will be invested in purchasing bread and eggs so that she can increase her sales. Maria's dream is to have her own little cafe so that she can give better service to her clients and so that she can grow as a small business owner.

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bread and eggs so that she can increase her sales.

loans.name: Orfith

texts.es:
La señora Orfith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 27 años, tiene 01 hijo que aun depende de ella y esta estudiando, razón por la cual, pone mucho esfuerzo con el trabajo que realiza.

Orfita, es una mujer joven, le gusta trabajar y se siente mal cuando no tiene nada que hacer, nos cuenta que por iniciativa propia, decidió dedicarse a la venta de salchipapas/pollos, con el fin de contribuir con los ingresos económicos de su hogar, se inicio con S/. 200.00 y viene dedicándose a este negocio poco tiempo, tiene la esperanza que le ira muy bien. Con el apoyo de su pareja compraron su carrito salchipapero y luego; poco a poco fue comprando sus utensilios y materiales para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  

Actualmente, sigue con la venta de salchipapa/pollos, ubicada afuera de su casa donde hay bastante movimiento y cuenta que le va muy en sus ventas, empieza a vender  a partir de las 5:00 de la tarde, ya que a esa hora ya hay clientes que desean probar un aperitivo, es ella misma quien los atiende con esa amabilidad y carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando, pollos en javas, sacos de papas, paquetes de aceites y algunos utensilios de cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Orfith, esta muy segura que su negocio prosperara mas de lo que ahora esta y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Orfith belongs to the La Marginal II Community Bank in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 27, and she has a dependent son who is in school. He is the reason she puts so much effort in the work she does. Orfita is a young woman who likes to work; she feels bad when she does not have something to do. On her own initiative she decided to sell “salchipapas” (a typical Peruvian dish) with chicken in order to contribute to the household income. She started with 200 PEN, and she has been in this business for a short time. She hopes that it will go very well. With help from her significant other they bought a cart called a salchipapero (apparatus fitted with gas fryers and various compartments to conserve hot fried foods). Then, little by little, they are buying utensils and materials to offer better service to her customers. She currently continues selling salchipapa with chicken outside of her house where there is plenty of movement. She is doing very well in her sales. She starts selling at 5:00 on the afternoon. That is when many customers want to taste an appetizer. She waits on them with kindness and her characteristic charisma. With the loan for 1,000 PEN she wants to buy chickens, sacks of potatoes, packages of oil, and some kitchen utensils to replace the ones she currently has. That way she will offer her customers better service and attention. Orfith is very sure that her business will prosper more than it is now. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to prepare her salchipollos (typical Peruvian dish)

loans.name: Nitzi Mariella

texts.es:
La señora Nitzi Mariella, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, Distrito Banda de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 22 años y no tiene hijos.

Nitzi, se dedica a la Venta de Artesanía, nos cuenta que sus ventas le van muy bien y su negocio se encuentra en el local de Feria Artesanal, ubicado en el Centro de la Ciudad y para iniciarse mas a fondo en este negocio, decidió sacar un primer crédito de S/. 300.00,con esto poco a poco fue implementando su negocio y haciéndose conocida.

En la Actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que mes a mes realizan sus pedidos o compras, ya que ella trabaja así y sus principales clientes son turistas, amigos y familiares, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos, y con el carisma que tiene sus ventas lo tiene asegurada. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando artesanías al por mayor confeccionadas a base de barro como: tinajitas, adornos de diferentes culturas; y otros de semillas y productos propio de la región como: aretes, pulseras, collares. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando ropas, y juguetes tanto para niños y niñas. 

Nitzi Mariella, se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nitzi Mariella belongs to the La Marginal II Community Bank in the Banda de Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 22, single, and she does not have children. Nitzi sells handicrafts. Her sales are going very well. Her business is located in the Handicrafts Fair, which in the center of the city. She decided to take a loan for 300 PEN to really start the business. Little by little she has been establishing her business and becoming known. She currently continues with the same business. She now has a client base that makes monthly orders or purchases. Her primary customers are tourists, friends, and family. It is going very well. She generates her own monthly income. With the charisma she has, she is assured of sales. With the loan for 1,500 PEN she wants to make wholesale purchases of clay handicrafts such as large earthen jars and decorations from different cultures. She also wants to buy handicrafts made from seeds and products from her own region such as earrings, bracelets, and necklaces. She will use part of the money to buy clothes and toys for boys and girls. Nitzi Mariella feels very happy for what she has achieved. She is happy because her business is going very well. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping so many women who want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy handicrafts made from clay and seeds

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es: Nemesio tiene 44 años, hace 4 meses se separó de su pareja, quien es la madre de sus 2 hijas que viven con ella. Por el momento está viviendo solo en su casa propia. Sus padres fueron agricultores y él de joven lideraba responsablemente los trabajos agrícolas  por ser la única fuente de ingresos de su familia. Actualmente, cada fin de semana o quincenalmente comercializa sus productos en el mercado y sobre todo en los meses de verano es cuando más rentable le resulta su negocio. En este año Nemesio va priorizar la siembra de café, ya que hizo amistad con compradores de este producto, quienes le ofrecieron comprarle todas sus cosechas una vez recolectadas. Entonces ahora piensa abrir los surcos para quitar las malezas y dejar limpiar sus chacras destinadas para el cultivo de café y por otro lado renovará sus plantas de frutos cítricos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, los ciclos pasados ha demostrado responsabilidad en cada uno de las cuotas programadas. Por eso, quienes lo conocen tienen un buen concepto de Nemesio y es reconocido por los demás integrantes de su banco comunal por su buen humor. El dinero solicitado lo va a invertir en habilitar una nueva chacra, para ello contratará a 2 ó 3 peones a quienes les pagará un aproximado de 500 a 700 soles por dejar limpia y preparada la tierra, si es necesario podrá de sus ahorros para completar este pago.
texts.en:
Nemesio is 44. Four months ago he separated from the mother of his two daughters. They live with her. For the time being, he is living alone in his own house. His parents were farmers, and as a youngster he responsibly led the farming work as it was the only source of family income. Currently he sells his products in the market every week end or twice a month. He sells more in the summer months when his business is more profitable. This year Nemesio is going to focus on planting coffee because he has developed a friendship with coffee purchasers who offered to buy all of his crops once they are harvested. He now plans on opening up the furrows to take out the weeds and leave his fields clean and ready for cultivating coffee. On the other side he will revitalize his citrus fruit. This is his fifth loan with MFP. In past loan cycles he has demonstrated responsibility in every one of his scheduled payments. Those that know him well have a good idea of who Nemesio is. He is recognized by the other members of his community bank for his good temperament. He will use the money he is asking for to set up a new field. He will hire two or three field workers. He will pay them approximately 500 to 700 PEN to clean and prepare the land. If necessary, he will add money from his savings to pay them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To clean his fields

loans.name: Luz Nelida

texts.es:
La señora Luz Nélida G. M. tiene 42 años, vive en el distrito del Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió Primaria Completa, tiene 2 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Luz se dedica a la venta de golosinas y  de comida rápida, inicio su negocio vendiendo fruta, su negocio lo desarrolla en afueras del Centro de Salud Gran Chimú  de su distrito.
Su primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Lideresas en Acción II, lo invirtió en la compra de baldes, vasos, cucharas, platos para la venta de comida y desayunos.
Este crédito de 800 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ollas, golosinas y la construcción de su kiosco de material noble.
Luz tiene como sueño tener su cafetín para brindar un mejor servicio al personal de salud y población que acuden a ese centro de salud.
texts.en:
Sra. Luz Nelida G. M., 42, lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad. She has an elementary school education. She has 2 children, both still in her care. Luz operates a business selling fast food and snacks. She started out selling fruit. She developed the business at a spot near the Gran Chimu health center in her neighborhood. She received her first loan, for 300 soles, from her community bank, Lideresas en Accion II, and used it to purchase containers, drinking glasses, spoons and plates for her food sales. This loan, for 800 soles, will be used to purchase pots and other supplies and for building a kiosk with top materials. Luz dreams of having a cafe where she can provide a better service to the staff of the health center and others who go there.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies for food sales business and construction materials for new kiosk.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años, 03 hijos pequeños que aun dependen de ella.

Su carácter emprendedor y el amor a su familia le motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio, junto con su esposo brindando el servicio de movilidad, que poco a poco fueron aumentando y ganando experiencia en este tipo de actividad. 
 
En la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio de movilidad, tiene sus clientes fijos que a diario les brinda el servicio. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,500.00, invertirá comprando 02 llantas, como repuestos nuevos, para su motokar. Parte del Dinero también lo invertirá comprando.

Rosarito, desea seguir adelante y cumplir sus sueños y metas, porque es una mujer que cuando se propone algo lo cumple. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  por ayudarla a contribuir con sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosario belongs to the La Paz II community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She is 34 years old, partnered and has 3 young children still in her care.

Her enterprising nature and love for her family led her to start her own taxi business, a business that she operates with her husband. They've been adding to the business bit by bit and gaining experience at this particular line of work. She's still in business and now has a regular set of customers for whom she provides service.

With the loan of S/.1,500 [1,500 soles], she will buy 2 tires, for spares, for her "motokar". [Parte del Dinero tambien lo invertira comprando.]

Rosarito wants to continue pushing ahead, fulfilling her dreams and meeting her goals, because she is a woman who knows what she wants and goes and gets it. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos movemento for helping her with her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two tires for motokar business.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: El próximo mes Teodora cumplirá 38 años, actualmente vive con el padre de sus 4 hijos en su casa propia, la cual está hecha a base de madera y han cubierto por dentro con plástico para evitar que se penetre el frió de la noche. De pequeña apoyaba a sus padres en los trabajos agrícolas y lo que más le gustaba era cultivar las plantitas de plátano, ya que es un producto que no necesita de mucho esfuerzo y le permitía cosechar semanalmente. Todos los viernes se dedicaba a cosechar y a encajonar los plátanos para su fácil transporte y cada sábado los comercializaba en el mercado, las ganancias de este trabajo le permitieron cubrir la educación de sus hijos. Pero desde hace 2 años optó por  dedicarse mayormente a la compra y venta de frutas, desde entonces compra su mercadería directamente de las chacras de los agricultores, con esta modalidad gana mucho más a pesar de tener que pagar el transporte. Teodora está muy contenta con su negocio, ahora tiene mucha más clientela y esto le genera mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP, durante los 2 periodos anteriores demostró puntualidad en cada una de sus cuotas. Sus compañeros de banco comunal la llaman “la suavecita”, ya que tiene un trato muy sutil e irradia tranquilidad en sus conversaciones. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en el incremento del capital para su negocio de compra y venta de frutas.
texts.en:
Teodora will be 38 years old next month. She lives with the father of her 4 children in a house they own, a house constructed of wood and covered on the inside by plastic to keep out the cold night air. She used to help her parents with farm work as a young girl and what she most liked was growing plantains because they don't require a lot of effort and they can be harvested twice a year. She used to pick and box the plantains on Fridays so they could be transported easily and, on Saturdays, she took them to the market to sell. The earnings from this work allowed her to pay for her children's schooling. Two years ago, though, she decided to spend the majority of her time buying and selling fruit. Since then, she's bought her merchandise directly from local farmers, something that's allowed her to earn more even though she has to pay transportation costs. Teodora is very happy with her business. She now has many more customers, her business generates more revenue and she's been able to improve her quality of life. This is her third MFP loan. She repaid the installments on the previous two loans on time. The other members of her community bank call her La Suavecita, "The Gentlewoman", because her manner of conversation is so subtle and serene. The loan will be used to increase capital for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
La señora Camila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 57 años 03 hijos, 01 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Viene ejerciendo muchos años; su negocio de venta de jugos, junto con su pareja que también la apoya y se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad, en un puesto muy bien acondicionado, donde atiende a sus clientes. Es muy conocida y querida por sus clientes, ya que sus jugos son únicos y tienen un buen sabor. 
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, lo invertirá comprando frutas como: papayas, manzanas, maracuyás, bananas, naranjas, todos que los compra por cientos, en verduras compra sus veterragas y otros, para dar un sabor mas rico, a sus jugos. De esta manera satisfacer a sus clientes, parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando utensilios de cocina, para remplazar a los antiguos. 

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, pese que es un trabajo duro y tiene que levantarse temprano, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Camila belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro, "Time Is Money", community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She is 57 years old, married and the mother of 3 children, one of whom still lives at home.

She's been working many years. She operates a business, along with her husband, selling fruit juices. The business is located in the city's Central Market, in a stand that has been well fitted out so that she can serve her customers there. She is well known and loved by her customers because her fruit juices are unique and taste so good.

She will use the S/.1,500 [1,500 soles] loan to buy fruits such as papayas, apples, passion fruits, bananas, oranges, all in bulk, along with vegetables such as "veterragas" [not sure--a kind of pepper, perhaps?] that will add flavor to her juices and provide the product that her customers want. Another part of the loan will be used to buy kitchen utensils so that she can replace the old ones.

Camila is happy with her business even though the work is hard and she has to get up early to do it. She believes that it's worth the sacrifice to fulfill her life's dreams and goals. She's also grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping her and other women that want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for fruit drink business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 61 años, 07 hijos, todos ellos ya independientes y con familia.

Su espíritu  alegre y su anhelo D. ver profesionales  a sus hijos, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con cuyas ganancias ayudaría al ingreso económico D. su familia, desD. sus  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. En la actualidad tiene clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  tiene todo los productos  que el ama D. casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atienD.  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas D. pescado en cajas y en variedad D. marcas, huevos en javas y artículos D. higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Victoria, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando, y perseverando día a día y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades D. desarrollarse en el medio donD. se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria belongs to the El Tiempo es Oro, "Time Is Money", community bank in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She is 61 years old, partnered and the mother of 7 children, all now grown.

Her joyful spirit and strong desire to see her children settled in professional careers motivated her to start her own grocery business, the earnings from which would help the family. She's been gaining customers from the beginning. She now has a regular customer base that come to her shop every day because she has all the things that housewives need and because she tends to her customers with a natural charisma.

She wants to use the S/.3,000 [3,000 soles] loan to buy bulk supplies of rice, sugar, pasta, milk, canned fish, eggs and toiletries so that she can continue to proviD. her customers with the products they want.

Victoria feels ready and able to continue working and striving day after day. She's grateful to the Manuela Ramos movement for helping women like her get the chance to help themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”, Distrito de Juanjui, Departamento de Mariscal Cáceres. Es Soltera, tiene 69 años y es madre de 05 hijos todos ellos ya independientes y  con familia.

Lleva ya varios años dedicándose al rubro de alquiler de habitaciones , nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 1,000.00 que los utilizó en la construcción de las primeras 2 habitaciones y las ganas de salir adelante, le hizo progresar poco a poco en este negocio.
Nos cuenta que le va muy bien, en la actualidad tiene 04 habitaciones en alquiler ubicada en su misma casa, habitaciones muy bien cómodas y bien arregladas.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, lo invertirá comprando ladrillos, cementos, triplay, pintura, en la confección de puertas y ventanas de madera para la construcción de mas dormitorios, al fondo de su casa.

Ella es quien toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio, en lo personal, se siente más independiente, segura y capaz.

Elsita; manifiesta su Agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por haberle ayudado a mejorar y hacer posible sus sueños y poder así asegurar su vejez generando sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Señora Elsa belongs to the Community Bank “El Tiempo es Oro” (Time is Money) in the district of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres department. She is single, 69 years old, and has five children, all of whom are independent and have their own families. For several years Elsa has made a living renting out rooms. She says that she started out with S/.1,000 which was used to build the first two rooms. Her desire to get ahead in life meant that her business gradually became successful. She says that she is doing well and now has four very comfortable and well-kept rooms for rent in her own house. With the S/.2,000 loan she plans to buy bricks, cement, plywood, paint and have wood doors and windows made so that she can build more rooms at the back of her house. Elsa makes all her own personal and business decisions, and as a result she feels more independent, safe, and competent. She would like to say how appreciative she is of Kiva partner, the Manuela Ramos organisation, for having helped to improve her life and make possible her dreams so that even in her old age she can earn her own income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of more rooms to rent

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
La señora Hortensia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Unión 28 de Julio”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Yunguyo, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, estado civil casada, es madre de 03 hijos y  tiene estudios de segundaria completa,  vive en el Barrio Chacapata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 10 años, su  primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra de artesanías. 

Con este  préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, podrá comprar arroz en cantidad (al por mayor)
por sacos.  Ella los compra directamente en Camana.

Su deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.   
A ella le gusta la forma de trabajo en especial la responsabilidad de las demás socias.
texts.en:
Señora Hortensia is a member of the “Unión 28 de Julio” Community Bank which is located in the district of Yunguyo, Yunguyo province, Department of Puno. She is 33 years old, married with three children, and has completed high school. She lives in the Chacapata neighbourhood. She has worked with Kiva partner, Manuela Ramos, for ten years; her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy crafts. With this loan of 3,000 soles she plans to buy large bags of rice at wholesale prices in the town of Camana. Her wish is to be able to provide her children with a good education. She likes working with a community bank, especially the responsibility that the other members demonstrate.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice at wholesale prices

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: N. Sarah is the chairperson of Gambwa Akwata empola group in Mityana. She is a brave and hardworking lady with various businesses to earn a living. Sarah is a farmer and also buys produce like maize, beans and rice from fellow farmers to supplement the ones she gets from her farm. She also has a battery-charging business from her home. She has had all her businesses from  5-7 years after the death of her husband who was the sole breadwinner at the moment. She has three children who are all in school and in her businesses, she employs close to five people. They help her buy and transport the produce to her home from which it is transported to Kampala for resale. Sarah needs a loan to help with paying her children’s school fees, to help with her farming produce and buying more beans.

loans.use: To buy produce and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Мухиидин закончив свой займ хочет получить повторный кредит на закуп материала для пошива и продажи национальных утеплёных ватных халатов. Этим бизнесом он занимается вместе со своей матерью.Она шьёт и продаёт на рынке Худжанда, а он снабжает материалом для пошива и продаёт в отдалённых районах, сельскому населению.В сельской местности очень большой спрос на этот вид мужской национальной одежды. Вот и на снимке мама Мухиддина в день торговли , а сын в отъезде продажи в Матче.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Muhiddin has completed his loan and wants to receive another one to buy fabrics for sewing of national warm cotton robes. He is in this business together with his mother. She sews and sells on the market of Khujand and he provides the fabrics and sells on the remote markets to the village residents. In the villages the demand is very high for this type of men's national clothing. On the picture it's Muhiddin's mother during selling and her son is away selling in Machta.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Production and sales of men's national robes

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en: N. Scovia is the leader of Gambwa Akwata empola group2 in Mityana. She is a kind-hearted and hardworking lady with a restaurant as her business. Scovia has had the business for five years and she decided to join her lending group to improve her business. As a result, she has been able to buy more crates of sodas, saucepans, tables, chairs, forks, and spoons and this has enabled her to make more profit as compared to before the loans. Scovia is a married lady with seven children; five are still in school and the eldest two stopped in S.4 and started their own businesses due to lack of school fees. One child makes chapatti for sale by the roadside while the other is a motorcycle driver. Scovia’s husband is also a boda boda cyclist and together they ensure that their children are cared for. She also cares for her mother who stays nearby. With her share of the loan, Scovia hopes to invest in her business more by buying more foodstuffs.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Babughirana Women’S Group Kabugho Amina

texts.en: K. Amina is 30 years old and married with six children. Five of her children are schooling and she looks after three dependents who are also schooling. She has been selling tomatoes in big quantities for over ten years. She says even if tomatoes are perishable, she tries her level best to maintain them and supply them when they are in good condition and still fresh. She is using the loan to purchase tomatoes in bigger quantities for sale in markets. She is a happy business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land, a car and construct a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes.

loans.name: Jimmy's Group

texts.en: K. Jimmy is a hardworking and dependable 36-year-old man with a business selling produce for 15 years. He is a married man with three children all in school. He also cares for five dependants. His business is located in Mubende Town Council and being honest has won him good customers. Jimmy plans to build a warehouse for his business as well as build a second home that will be rented out for money. At the moment, Jimmy is making monthly profits of 220,000 and he hopes to increase it with future investments. For Jimmy, his loans have always helped him boost his business and enlarge his capital base, hence making more profits. He needs a loan so that he can buy more beans and maize to sell. Jimmy is the leader of the Mukisa group in Mubende.

loans.use: To buy more beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Babughirana Women’S Group Muhindo Jevina

texts.en: M. Jevina is 33 years old and married with five children. Four of the children go to school. She has had a retail shop for three years. She is using the loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, flour, salt, sweets, glucose, soap, etc, adding stock to expand her retail shop for more profit. She is a hardworking business lady who lives as an example to her community and her dream is to build a rental house.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: N. Rose is an honest and hardworking married lady who has a poultry farm and sells clothes in Mubende Town council. She is 38 years old and a mother of two children. One of her children is in University while the other is in Primary 7. She also cares for two dependants. She has been running both businesses for five years and, at the moment, with the help of loans to increase her capital, she is able to make 200,000 per month. The good customer care displayed to her clients has kept them with her and in future, she hopes to turn her shop into a wholesale dealer shop to have more sales and more profit. Rose needs a loan to buy more chicken feed and more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more chicken feed and more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Babwirana B Musoke Margaret Group

texts.en: M. Margaret is aged 22 and living with three dependents who go to school. She has dealt in cassava flour for over two years. She is using the loan to purchase cassava in bigger volume, take it for milling and then put it for sale, thus adding capital to her business. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase cassava in bigger volume for her business

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida sells women's shoes at one of the markets as well as at 2-3 day sales held in various places in Zaporozhye city. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is a very kind and sociable person. She knows her business sector well. Flexible discount policy help her to retain old clients and attract new ones.

Zinaida is married with one daughter. Zinaida has a wonderful family where everybody supports one another. This helps her to overcome business challenges and pressures. Zinaida would like to borrow 12,400 UAH to purchase summer inventory. She has used business loans many times and finds them very helpful.

loans.use: To purchase summer inventory

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en: A. Gairat is 46 years old and married with four children. He sells women’s shawls in the central market of Shahrituz. In the sixteen years of his activities he has managed to acquire his clientele. Now, Gairat‘s business is their main source of income, allowing him to improve their living conditions and provide his children with education. Gairat requests 7,400 Somoni to purchase new women’s shawls in order to increase his range of goods to sell. Gairat would like to thank everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan on time. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new women's shawls in order to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en:
E. Ismoil has been running a business manufacturing  wooden doors and window frames. He inherited this business from his father. Now, Ismoil wishes to improve his working conditions to be able to provide services of the best quality in the neighborhood. 

Ismoil is 38 years old, married with seven children. Now in his eighth year of operation, Ismoil is applying for a loan for the eighth time. He has gained a reputation for responsibility in his financial obligations and for keeping his word. Ismoil requests 3400 Somoni. He would like to thank everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan in a timely fashion. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist Ismoil with the operation of his business.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Hajida

texts.en:
Hajida Polić was born in 1955. She comes from a suburb of the town of Tuzla. She is married and her husband is retired. Her children live out of the house since they are married.

Hajida is a housewife who grows vegetables for her own use and raises chickens for her own use and for sale. She is our loyal client and she already took four loans from WWI (Žene za Žene International). All of these loans were invested in her poultry business.

Hajida requested her fifth loan from WWI to purchase more chickens and poultry food. The income from this business increases their home budget significantly.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and poultry food

loans.name: Kamol

texts.en: J. Kamol has a minivan with which he provides transportation services. Having attended to this business for eleven years, he has gained much experience. Initially he rented a car but, after making certain savings over time, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main, considerable income for Kamol’s family allowing improvement in their living conditions. Currently Kamol’s minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of 8,000 Somoni to purchase the spare parts. Kamol thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minivan

loans.name: Mihri

texts.en: J. Mihri is 45 years old, married, and the loving mother of ten children. She, together with her husband, produces national chests that are used for saving a bride’s dowry. The national chests in Tajikistan are made of wood and are very colorful. Mihri has been in this business already for thirteen years. The business stability allows her to have the income to ensure that the family has the possibility of improving its living conditions. Because of high demand for her products, Mihri now requests the loan of 5,000 Somoni in order to purchase raw materials for production of the chests. Mihri thanks all lenders who are giving her a chance to get ahead. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for the production of the chests

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
Nazokat K. is very persistent and dedicated to giving her children what's needed to get ahead in life. For this reason, she works daily in the fields tending and harvesting vegetables that she sells in the market. A lot of the time the chores in the fields result in little compensation, and so recently she set up a sales post in her home for fruits and candy. This allows her to tend to her home as well. Nazokat wishes to have more capital to invest in her work so that she can increase her income and improve her beloved children's well-being. She will use this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Begajeta

texts.en:
Begajeta Ćehajić is 46 years old and comes from the suburb of a town called Tuzla. She is married and her husband works in the coal mine. Begajeta keeps herself busy in the garden growing vegetables. Besides her garden, she has livestock and she fattens chickens.

Begajeta is one of our old clients and she has repaid four loans successfully. Two of these loans were invested in livestock and two in a poultry business. She is requesting her fifth loan through WWI (Žene za Žene International) in the amount of 1000 KM to purchase chickens and poultry feed.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr: Emefa K. est une femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. elle détient une boutique d’alimentation générale depuis 4 ans à Womé. Avec ce crédit Emefa souhaite augmenter la capacité de son entreprise en alimentant sa boutique de nouveaux produits lui permettant de mieux répondre aux exigences de ses clients et accroître par la même occasion son chiffre d’affaires.
texts.en:
Emefa K., 45, is married and the mother of 4 children. She has had a little general store in Womé for 4 years now. With this loan, Emefa wishes to expand her shop by buying new products that will permit her to respond better to the needs of her customers and at the same time, increase her sales volume.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her shop inventory

loans.name: Ni Luh Parwati

texts.en:
Ni Luh Parwati (DNR.M-0704) is 35 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu-Melaya. She is married with two school-aged children. To making a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 1,000,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Luh Parwati joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,200,000 IDR from DINARI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a loan of 3,600,000 IDR to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Luh Parwati - (DNR.M-0704) merupakan 35 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Luh Parwati memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Luh Parwati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Parwati menghasilkan sekitar 1,000,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Luh Parwati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Luh Parwati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,600,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Luh Parwati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Kurbonazar

texts.en:
Kurbonazar K. is 41 years old and married with eight children. Kurbonazar manufactures wooden doors and window frames. His shop is located in his house. Working in this business for seven years, he has became a rather experienced master. Because he produces goods of high quality and acceptable prices, Kurbonazar has many customers. In general, the business is successful and generates a stable income for the family.

Kurbonazar is now planning to purchase an additional woodworker to expand his business. With this purpose, he requests 2500 Somoni. His goal is to continue expanding and improving his business everyday and, more importantly, to ensure that his children will always be able to attend a good school. Kurbonazar is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a woodworker.

loans.name: Khursand

texts.en:
Khursand A. is a young man who has been a farmer for three years. He is happily married to a hardworking woman who always supports him. She has helped him get ahead in life and has given him three children. Like most other people in the zone who depend on the vegetable crop, Khursand needs to buy agricultural supplies that will allow for the maintenance and production of his crops for an optimum harvest.

With this purpose, Khursand applied to IMON International for a loan of 3000 Somoni to purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizer. Khursand and his beloved family sincerely thank you for your support.

loans.name: Ni Putu Sunantri

texts.en:
Ni Putu Sunantri (DNR.M-0705) is 48 years old and lives in the town of Manistutu-Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. To making a living, she raises pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Putu Sunantri joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a loan of 3,600,000 IDR to renovate the existing shelter for her livestock. This will be her third loan from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: To renovate the existing shelter for her livestock.

loans.name: Khosiyat

texts.en:
Khosiyat D. is a married woman with five children. She started her business as the result of economic pressure. Her husband's salary was not enough to meet their family's expenses. Khosiyat began to investigate what work she could do. About 15 years ago, one of her friends recommended that she sell children’s clothing. She decided she'd try that business. Little by little, she brought in more clients, which increased her income because her commissions increased as she sold more clothing.

Khosiyat is applying for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy merchandise and fill existing client orders. She hopes that you will collaborate with her. Together with her family, Khosiyat thanks you for supporting them and helping the family move ahead.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi A. est un jeune homme de 29 ans, marié et père d’un enfant. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. il souhaite avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto étant donné que la première est vétuste est lui cause d’énormes dépenses. Komi compte sur cette opportunité  pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi A. is 29 years old, married and the father of one child. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Womé, a village located roughly 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Given that his first motorcycle is run down and very costly to maintain, he hopes to purchase a new one with this loan. Komi is counting on this opportunity to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
Dilorom has a small business selling clothing. She is married with three children and has been in business for four years. Dilorom is an energetic, enthusiastic entrepreneur who operates her business simply but wisely. When she has needed to purchase new clothing inventory, she has paid other clothing vendors to buy for her so that she can stay and keep her business open rather than close her business to travel herself to buy inventory.

Dilorom has requested a loan to help renew her supply of clothing inventory. This loan will help her purchase a good supply of inventory so she can maximize her profits and continue working to develop her business.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for women for the summer season.

loans.name: Dondov

texts.en:
Dondov D. is 59 years old and married. She lives with her husband in Uvurhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces located 400 kilometers from the capital city. All her children are grown and live separately with their own families. In 1998, she started running a cosmetic sales business at the local market. She rents two stalls and hires a saleswoman. Once or twice she goes to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, to purchase cosmetic items at a wholesale prices. Most of her customers are local girls and women.

She has invested her profits in her children's life. Dondov says, "My husband and I have been running our small business although we have already retired. Staying at home doing nothing is hard for us. If we work everyday, then we feel healthy and good. With the profit I'm saving small amounts to purchase second-hand car for one of my children." With this loan, she will buy more cosmetic items from the capital city to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic items for sale.

loans.name: Soliyakhon

texts.en:
Soliyakhon K. is a 50 year-old married mother of four children. She has sold children's clothing at her local market for the past ten years. Because of her business, she will be able to pay for her children to finish school. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of clothes to sell. Soliyakhon would like to use the loan to buy more bales of clothes with greater variety to increase her stock. She hopes to raise enough income to support all of her children to finish school.

loans.use: To buy more bale of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma P. is a 38-year-old farmer and the mother of five children. She grows rice and currently needs additional capital to run her business. Her farm is mainly the source of their livelihood. With her farm, she is able to send all her children to school.

The 1.5 hectare (3.75 acre) farm that she tills needs five sacks of seeds and two quartz of Karate insecticides. So Emma is asking a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI to be able to sustain and improve her harvest.

With God's blessing, she is still able to support the growing needs of her family. Now, she is able to maintain her farm because CEVI is always giving her loan assistance, training and insurance coverage services.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of seeds and two quartz of Karate insecticides

loans.name: Davlatmurod

texts.en: K. Davlatmurod is 20 years old. He is not married and helps his parents with the family expenses. Davlatmurod has been the owner of a small general store for more than three years. He sells foodstuffs for everyday use such as flour, sugar, macaroni, soft drinks, sweets (candies), etc. His motivation for requesting a loan is to be able to purchase more merchandise to stock his business. A larger selection of goods will attract more clients and generate a good monthly income to help his family. Support this young and energetic guy of much strength and courage to keep working. loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sujani

texts.en: Ni Nengah Sujani (DNR.M-0706) is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Manistutu, Melaya. She is married and has one school-aged child. Ni Nengah Sujani owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month. In 2007, Ni Nengah Sujani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional piglets. Ni Nengah Sujani is now requesting a new loan of 3,600,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 3rd from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Mavdjiniso

texts.en: M. Mavdjiniso is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She has been running her grocery store for the past three years. She sells sweets (candies), dried fruits, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and other products in her store. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. She is respectful and patient with all of her customers which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Mavdjiniso is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 2,500 Somoni to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Mavdjiniso reach all of her aspirations. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase inventory to increase her range of goods

loans.name: Ashurali

texts.en: M. Ashurali is married with three children. He has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread. Ashurali has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff. Thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise five years ago with a starting capital of $200. Over time he expanded his business and now it has become domestic as his family helps him with the business. Today, Ashurali needs to buy additional foodstuffs for increasing the range of his goods. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of 2,300 Somoni. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Ni Putu Warnati

texts.en:
Ni Putu Warnati is 54 and lives in the town of Manistutu - Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Putu Warnati raises pigs for sale. Ni Putu Warnati has been engaged in this business for more than four years and earns approximately 450,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Warnati joined DINARI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Warnati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Ni Putu Warnati is now requesting a new loan of 3,600,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Putu Warnati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small-business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Putu Warnati - (DNR.M-0707) merupakan 54 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Manistutu - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Warnati memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Putu Warnati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Warnati menghasilkan sekitar 450,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Warnati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Warnati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 3,600,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Warnati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk menambah penghasilan keluarga.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Davron

texts.en:
S. Davron is 30 years old. He sells DVDs. He tries to have all the new movies and concerts of popular actors, singers and others. He also provides computer services, such as audio editing of video tapes and discs with records of his clients' family events. Davron tries to use modern, up-to-date technologies in his work to satisfy the demands and requirements of the customers. The business is successful, generating a good income for his family. 

Today Davron requests 2,500 Somoni. He is planning to purchase DVDs to increase the range of goods he can sell. Davron thanks all supporting him and promises to be accurate with loan payment.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing DVDs

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie shared that “opportunity knocks only once and blessed are those who open their door in welcoming every opportunity that comes along.” She is 40 years old and married to Milanio, who works as a farmer and carpenter.  They have three children: high-school graduates Mary Jane, 19, and Marina, 17, and Marissa, an elementary student.  

Elvie shared that she is a dreamer and a woman full of hopes.  She hopes that through her hardships in managing her hog-raising business, she could able to help her husband support the education of their children and uplift their poor living situation. She always wanted to maintain her livestock business to save something for emergency needs. 

Elsie is requesting a loan of at least PHP6,000 to have additional capital for supplying her livestock's daily feed and for buying at least one additional piglet to further improve her business for the future of her children.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en:
T. Dilorom is 25 years old. She is not married and in order to support her parents she runs her own business selling food items: fruits, vegetables, sweets, soft drinks, detergents and other items in her grocery. She is known among people of her community because of the attractive prices and fresh foodstuff. All of this allows Dilorom’s business to generate the stable, considerable incomes for her family. Today she is planning to purchase additional fresh foodstuff to fulfill the needs of a growing number of customers. With this purpose she requests 2500 Somoni. The well-being of this family is in your hands. Help them by contributing to the growth of Dilorom’s business, and they will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: Increasing of the range of fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Zainura

texts.en:
E. Zainura is married and has 4 children. She runs a business selling women’s clothing at the central market of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. Her clothing sales business exhibits good economic characteristics and fundamentals. Zainura has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in this trade for 3 years. Zainura would like to get a loan of 2500 Somoni to increase her working capital so that she can continue working to improve her business. We believe her natural ability to please her customers by perceiving their needs and offering speedy, courteous service will help Zainura achieve her goals, sustain her success and win as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To increase capital for business development.

loans.name: Suhbaatar

texts.en: Suhbaatar T., 27, is married and father to one daughter. His family lives in the "ger" (nomadic housing tent) district in Arhangay, one of Mongolian central provinces. His spouse, Narantsetseg, stays home to take care of their 2 month-old infant. Since 2007 he has been running a taxi service with his own second hand Japanese vehicle. With the profit, he takes care of his family. In addition, he is able to save small amounts. His wife, Narantsetseg, has a small clothing stall at the local market. She closed the stall down since she has an infant. This young couple's dream is to have their own general store. Suhbaatar says, "I am working hard for my child’s future life." He requests a loan to purchase spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old. She lives in Barangay Binarzang of Quiino, Isabela. She is married to Remigio who works as a farmer. They are blessed with five children: two already graduated from college and three are still studying.  Because of her good service to her community and to God, she still remains as one of the councilors in their respective place. Julieta loves serving in her simple ways. 

Julieta is again requesting for a loan of PHP4,000 for the maintenance of her hog raising business. She will use the loan to purchase feed supply and to buy one piglet. Hog raising has become of great help to her family. Julieta is hoping that the business will work longer through patience and assistance of Kiva lenders. Julieta also dreams to become successful in life for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and a piglet.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
“If others can, why can’t I?” This is what Maribel says about her business.  With her patience and hard work, she was able to sustain her business.  At the moment, she would like to request again for another loan amounting to PHP 7,000 from Kiva lenders.
