Le besoin des clients en maїs et en manioc et surtout le bénéfice réalisé, l’ont poussée à opter pour ces nouveaux produits. L’obtention des différents crédits de Hope RDC, ont renforcé son affaire et l’ont aidée à avancer dans la réalisation de son ambition d’ouvrir un jour un dépôt de maїs et de manioc à livrer aux mamans de son quartier. Le prêt qu’elle a  reçu ce mois lui a servi à acheter quelques sacs de mais et de manioc à revendre en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Actuellement, son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $15 par semaine. Véronique est âgée de 59 ans, mariée et mère de 9 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 40 et 17 ans. Deux seulement vivent avec eux et sont scolarisés. Tandis que d’autres sont indépendants.
texts.en:
Véronique T. sells maize and manioc in front of her property. Rice and beans were the first foodstuffs she sold in 1979. Over the years, Véronique acquired a solid experience in this business. The fact that her customers need maize and manioc and the profit she makes from these sales pushed her to opt for these new products.

Obtaining various loans from Hope RDC bolstered her business and helped her progress toward achieving her goal of one day opening a depot for maize and manioc that she would deliver to the mothers in her neighborhood. The loan that she has received this month will be used to buy several sacks of maize and manioc for resale so as to increase her profit.

Presently, her business is generating a profit of US$ 15 per week. Véronique is 59, marrried and the mother of 9 children whose ages vary between 40 and 17. Only two live with her and are enrolled in school, whereas the others are all independent.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing several sacks of maize and manioc for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Por Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
el gupo por un futuro mejor esta consyituido por tres mujeres las cuales son muy trabajadoras y tienen un espiritu de superacion muy grande, ellas se llevan muy bien, son muy amigas y confian mucho la una con la otra, una de las caracteristicas de este grupo es que son unas muejeres muy honrradas.
las actividades que ellas desarollan son las siguientes;
Martina C.: se dedica al comercio desde hace 10 años, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, negocio que tiene ebicado frente al bulevar las Democracias de la ciudad de danli, ella tiene 70 años de edad y mantiene un buen espiritu de trabajo.
Martina es soltera y con ella vive una nieta, la misma que ella le paga todo al 100%, para martina la edad no ha sido un obstaculo para trabajar y salir adelante, con los ingresos que ella genera de su negocio a construido su vivienda, ella hizo 3 cuartos para alquiler y con esos ingresos ella cubre sus gastos personales.
Maria Benita C.: tiene 2 años de haber iniciado con su negocio el cual se basa en la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, ella tiene su negocio en el mercado Nuevo Amanecer de la ciudad de Danli, ella es casada y madre d 4 hijos, su esposo labora para una fabrica de tabacos, ella tomo la desicion de dedicarse al negocio para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Maria C.: se dedica a la venta de verduras, arroz y pastas, desde que ella tenia 15 años de edad se dedica a este negocio, ella cuenta con 30 años de experiencia en este tipo de negocio, ella esta casada y tiene 9 hijos, cinco de ellos le ayudan a vender su producto en diferentes lugares cercanos de donde ella vive.
todos ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “Por un Futuro Mejor” (Towards a Better Future) is made up of three hard-working women. They have a strong will to overcome obstacles, get on well together, are great friends and trust each other. One of the characteristics of this group is that they are all reputable women. They wish to expand the following businesses: Martina C. has been in business for ten years, primarily selling new clothes and footwear. Her business is located opposite Democracias Boulevard in the town of Danli. She is 70 years old and still a hard worker. Martina is single and has a granddaugher living with her whom she supports 100%. Age has never been an obstacle to working hard and doing well. With the income that she earns from her business, she has built her own house in which she has three rooms to rent. The money she gets from them pays her personal expenses. Maria Benita C. began her business two years ago selling new clothing and footwear. It is situated in the Nuevo Amanecer market in the town of Danli. Maria is married with four children; her husband works in a tobacco factory. She made the decision to start a business so she could help her husband with the household expenses. Ever since she was 15 years old, Maria C. has earned her living by selling vegetables, rice, and pasta—she now has 30 years of experience doing this work. Maria is married with nine children, five of whom help her by selling the foodstuffs in different places close to where she lives. All of the women need a loan so that they and their families can improve their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear, clothing, and foodstuffs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fagbohun

texts.en: F. sells wine, drinks and juice in her shop. F. is 44 years old and she is married with three children. F. is requesting a loan of 140,000 nairas to purchase more wine, drinks and juice to sell. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more wine, juice and drinks to sell

loans.name: Shoyembo

texts.en: O. sells foodstuffs. She has been in this business for the past three years. O. has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years. O. has four children and she lives in Abulegba, Lagos. She is requesting a loan of 70,000 nairas to enable her to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es: La Asociación Comunal “San Juan” es parte del Centro Focal “Panamericana” sus integrantes se caracterizan por ser muy alegres y dinámicas. Constancia T. es la presidenta de la Asociación y le gusta organizar a sus compañeras bajo un orden del día, empezando por la asistencia y terminando con la limpieza de la sala. Todas las integrantes de “San Juan” invertirán el préstamo obtenido en sus negocios comprando mercadería. Ellas tienen diferentes  negocios  como: venta de comida, verduras, pescado, dulces y mantas, Constancia tiene el negocio de venta de mantas y necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería, especialmente por esta época de invierno, porque hace mucho frío y tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
The San Juan Community Association is part of the Pan-American Focus Center. Its members are very cheerful and dynamic. Constancia T. is the president of the association and she enjoys organizing her companions under a daily routine, beginning with the attendance and ending with the cleaning of the room. All of the members of "San Juan" will invest their loans in the purchase of merchandise for their businesses. They have different businesses, including the sale of food, vegetables, fish, sweets, and blankets. Constanta has a blanket business and she needs the loan to purchase more merchandise, especially during this winter season, because it is very cold and there is high demand.

Translated from Spanish by Leah Karlins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mabongisi Ya Nkolo Plus Group

texts.fr: Elise M. est une femme très courageuse qui a passé une bonne partie de sa vie à revendre de la braise depuis 1985. Son activité est très exigeante. Elle doit aller deux ou trois fois par semaine en brousse acheter la marchandise et revenir la revendre en ville. Son activité devient de plus en plus difficile pendant la saison pluvieuse à cause de mauvais état des routes surtout en brousse. En janvier 2008, Elise décide d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC en vue d’avoir un soutient financier permanent qui va lui permettre de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une boutique générale. Elle est cliente fidèle qui a reçu plusieurs fois les prêts de Hope qu’elle a remboursés totalement et à temps. Le dernier crédit qu’elle obtenu ce mois de juin lui a permis de diversifier son affaire en achetant des sacs de haricots, d’oignons, de l’huile végétale et des poissons salés à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le revenu. Elise dispose d’un capital propre de $130 et son activité lui procure un bénéfice de $40 par semaine qui l’aide à supporter les frais scolaires de ses enfants. Elle vend dans une zone montagneuse située au sud-ouest de Kinshasa. Elise a 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants âgés de 13 à 19 ans. Tous vont à l’école.
texts.en:
Elise M. is a very courageous woman who has spent most of her life, since 1985, selling charcoal. Her business is very demanding. She has to go two or three times a week to the country to buy her merchandise and bring it back for resale to the city. Her business becomes more and more difficult during the rainy season because of the bad condition of the roads, especially in the backwoods.

In January 2008, Elise decided to join one of the groups of Hope RDC in view of finding permanent financial support which will allow her to realize her dream of one day opening a general store. She is a faithful client who has received several loans from Hope, which she has reimbursed completely and on time.

The most recent loan which she has received this month of June permitted her to diversify her business by buying sacks of dried beans, onions, vegetable oil, and salted fish to re-sell in order to increase her profit. She has a working capital of US$ 130 and her business brings in a profit of US$ 40 per week which helps her pay the school fees for her children. She sells her wares in a mountainous zone in the south-west of Kinshasa. Elise is 45, married, and the mother of 4 children, aged between 13 and 19. All are enrolled in school.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying sacks of dried beans, onions, vegetable oil, and salted fish for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mamunatu

texts.en:
Mamunatu is a food vendor. She prepares and sell diewuo or what is popularly called tuozafi. Tuozafi is prepared from corn flour and eaten with soup together with fish and meat. It is enjoyed by many Ghanaians because it is an appetizing and tasty meal. She is requesting a loan to buy food ingredients like spices, meat, corn flour, leaves, etc. to prepare more food to serve her customers. She has been in business for eight years now and she is grateful for your assistance.

Mamunatu is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children. Four are currently in elementary and junior high school while her last born is still breastfeeding. She lives at Sefwi Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Sefwi is a farming community where most of the indigenous are into cocoa farming. She belongs to a village bank called Nkunimdie which means "Victory".

loans.use: To buy food ingredients like spices, meat, corn flour, leaves, etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa sells sachet mineral water in bulk. She buys the sachet water from suppliers and stores it in a fridge. She mostly carries it in a small pan on top of her head and sells through hawking. She has been in this business for five years now. She needs a loan to buy more bags of sachet water to upgrade her shop.

Yaa is 40 years old, married and the mother of five children. All her children are in elementary and junior high schools. She lives with her husband in the community of Sefwi Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Prayer is the key’.

loans.use: To buy sachet water in bulk

loans.name: Espirita

texts.es: Espirita tiene 52 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y madre soltera, vive en su casa propia con su hijo de 18 año y su hija de 11, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo. A temprana edad quedo huérfana de madre, era la mayor de 4 hermanos por lo que se hizo responsable de ellos, trabajando en la chacra de sus vecinos quienes le pagaban en productos (papa y maíz) que los compartía con sus hermanos. En vista de que le faltaba dinero se propuso criar cerdos y luego vendía la carne a sus vecinos. Al pasar los años, a base de mucho trabajo, compró sus propias tierras agrícolas, en ellas sembró papas y arvejas, algunas veces le resultó muy rentable, como también tuvo pérdidas, pero jamás desistió en su trabajo. Fue así que logró construir su casa e instaló allí una bodega y desde hace 9 meses también tiene una pequeña librería de la que se ocupa su hija en sus tiempos libres. Espirita atiende su bodega mientras va conversando con sus clientes y brindándole un buen trato, puesto que valora la preferencia que le tienen, lo que le permite acumular dinero para cubrir la educación superior de su hijo mayor, con los anhelos de que sea un buen profesional. Mientras tanto, Espirita sigue trabajando hasta terminar de educar a su hija menor a quien también ama mucho. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos pasados demostró puntualidad en cada una de sus cuotas. En una oportunidad en que a su hermano le faltaba dinero para cubrir sus cuentas (ambos pertenecen al mismo banco comunal) ella pagó la diferencia, lo que muestra que aún sigue pendiente de sus hermanos menores. El dinero que ahora viene solicitado es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos y en mayor parte para adquirir cuadernos y papales para su mini librería.
texts.en:
Espirita is 52. She is a very hard working woman, and she is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her 18 year old son and her 11 year old daughter. They are the motivation for her efforts. At an early age she was left as an orphan without a mother. She was the oldest of four siblings, so she became responsible for them. She worked on the neighbor’s farm, and they paid her in products (potato and corn), which she shared with her siblings. In light of the fact that she did not have money, she set out to raise pigs. She later sold the meat to her neighbors. As the years passed, and after much work, she bought her own fields to cultivate. She planted potatoes and peas. Sometimes it was very profitable. There were also losses. But, she never stopped worked. That was how she was able to build her house and set up a store in it. As of nine months ago, she also has a small bookstore, which her daughter takes care of in her free time. Espirita takes care of her store while she chats with her customers. She treats them well, and she appreciates them. This allows her to accumulate money to cover her son’s high school expenses. The goal is for him to be a professional. Meanwhile, Espirita will continue working until she finishes educating her young daughter, who she also loves very much. This is her fourth loan with MFP. During the past loan cycles she has demonstrated punctuality in all of her payments. One time her brother did not have the money to cover his accounts (they both belong to the same community bank), and she paid the difference. This shows that she still watches over her younger siblings. The money that she is now asking for is to buy fertilizers for her crops. The larger part of the money is to buy notebooks and paper for her mini bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Emeila

texts.en: Emelia is married and has two kids. She lives with her family at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana. She is 23 years old.  She runs a clothing stand and has been selling ladies' and children's wear like blouses and skirts, lingerie, underwear, slippers and dressing bags for the past nine years. She is constrained by funds to run the business. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business to scale up her business progress. She believes the loan will help her to purchase good quality and large quantity to upgrade her inventory. She says she would be grateful for that assistance and she also belongs to the village bank called ‘Prayer is the Key’.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Cereza Group

texts.es:
Foto: De izquierda a derecha, Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M. y María Dionisia Galán Pérez.

El grupo solidario Cereza está integrado por doña , Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M. y María Dionisia Galán Pérez .
Doña   Linda Urania es la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de comida como fritanga, refrescos y cajetas, tiene un niño, va la escuela, tiene tres años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Ella va a invertir su financiamiento en comprar alimentos como verduras, frutas, carnes, maíz y azúcar, estos los procesará en alimentos preparados que ofrece a sus clientes en la parada de buses de Masaya.
Ella es casada, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos del hogar, él es carpintero desde hace mucho tiempo,pero ella le gusta tener su negocio para tener su propio ingreso y así comprarse las cosas que a ella le gustan como ropa, zapatos y artículos para su casa. Fue elegida como coordinadora por estar cerca de la agencia de Adim y así poder llevar los abonos puntuales.

La otra integrante es doña María Milagros se dedica a la venta de repostería, café, café con leche, sándwich y truchas, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años, ofrece de forma ambulante en todo el mercado, ha crecido en su negocio, con el crédito compró leche, azúcar, panes, enchiladas, etc. estos productos los ofrece a sus clientes por las mañanas, su horario de trabajo es desde tempranas horas de la madrugada hasta las dos de la tarde, espera poder ofrecer otro tipo de comidas a sus clientes.

Doña María Dionisia Galán, ella se dedica a la venta de reposterías y refrescos en su lugar donde vive y ambulante por las mañanas en el mercado municipal, ella utilizó el  crédito en comprar reposterías de mejor calidad y frutas para elaborar refrescos.
La señora es persona conocida por vender estos productos, ella es sola y trabaja solo para ella y así tener para sus medicamentos cuando se enferma, sueña con mejorar una parte de su casita.

El grupo espera siempre ser un grupo puntual, esto les ha dado mucha satisfacción y oportunidad de trabajar.
texts.en:
Photo: from left to right, Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M., and María Dionisia Galán Pérez. The Cereza solidarity group consists of Linda Urania F. L., María Milagros A. M., and María Dionisia Galán Pérez. Linda Urania is the group’s coordinator. She makes a living selling foods such as fried snacks, soft drinks, and cajetas (caramels). She has a son who is in school. Linda Urania has worked in this activity for three years. She is going to invest her portion of the loan in the purchase of food ingredients such as vegetables, fruits, meat, corn, and sugar, which she will process into the prepared foods that she offers to her customers at the Masaya bus stop. Linda Urania is married. Her husband has worked as a carpenter for a very long time and helps her with the household expenses. Linda Urania likes having her business because it provides her with her own income and thus allows her to purchase things she likes such as clothing, shoes, and household items. She was selected as the group’s coordinator because her business is close to the ADIM agency and she can therefore make the payments on time. Another member of the group is María Milagros, who makes a living selling pastries, coffee, sandwiches, and trout. She has been involved in this activity for many years. She sells her foods as a street vendor in the market. Her business has grown, and she used a loan to purchase milk, sugar, breads, enchiladas, etc. She offers these products to her customers in the mornings. Her work schedule runs from the early hours of dawn until two in the afternoon. She hopes she can offer her customers other kinds of food. María Dionisia Galán makes a living selling pastries and beverages from her home, and in the mornings sells her foods in the local market. She used a loan to purchase higher-quality pastries and fruits for making beverages. María Dionisa is well known for selling these projects. She is single and works by herself, and thus has enough money for medicine when she becomes ill. Her dream is to improve part of her small house. The group hopes to always be punctual, and this has given them much satisfaction and the opportunity to work.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies for preparing meals

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es: Fidencio tiene 49 años, es un hombre noble y trabajador, está separado y tiene 3 hijos que viven con su ex pareja; él vive al cuidado de su madre en su casa propia. Su infancia está marcada por el labrado de la tierra, ya que sus padres fueron personas del campo y de niño le gustaba cultivar la papa. En sus siembras Dios le bendijo, menciona, pero en su vida conyugal primó la incomprensión, pero no renunció a su responsabilidad como padre. Fidencio se esforzó más en sus cultivos, incrementado sus sembríos hasta llegar a 4 hectáreas de papas, otras 3 de arvejas y en menor cantidad de maíz. Durante las cosechas tenía dificultad para preparar el refrigerio de sus peones, pero ahora ha optado por pagarles más y evitar esa preocupación. Fidencio ama mucho sus chacras, más cuando fructifican, porque gracias a sus tierras y a su trabajo él comercializa sus productos en el mercado de mayoristas de la ciudad de Tarma. Con estas ganancias puede cubrir la educación de sus hijos, aunque estén lejos no quiere que pasen necesidades. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, es muy responsable y cuando tiene el dinero paga por adelantado, mencionando “el dinero es ingrato y es mejor matar las deudas pronto”. Fidencio se ha acostumbrado mucho a sus compañeros de banco comunal, por lo que no le gustaría que alguno se vaya a retirar. El dinero que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de 30 sacos de fertilizantes, cree que le costará un aproximado de 2900 soles, con el resto comprará fungicidas para las hojas de sus cultivos de papas y arvejas.
texts.en:
Fidencio, a noble and hard working man, is 49. He is separated, and he has three children who live with their mother. He takes care of his mother in his own house. His childhood is marked by working the land. His parents were people of the fields, and as a boy he liked growing potatoes. God blessed him in his crops, but his marital life is incomprehensible. But, he did not renounce his responsibility as a father. Fidencio put more effort into his crops, increasing his fields until he had four hectares of potatoes, three of peas, and a smaller amount of corn. During the harvests he had difficulty preparing refreshments for his workers, but now he has decided to pay them more and avoid that worry. Fidencio really loves his farm; he loves it more when the crops bear fruit. Thanks to his fields and his work, he sells his products at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. With his earnings, he can cover the educational costs of his children. Even though they are far away, he does not want them to do without. This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is very responsible. When he has the money, he pays ahead of time. He says, “Money is unpleasant, and it is better to kill your debts quickly”. Fidencio is very at home with his colleagues in his community bank. Therefore, he would not like it if someone were to withdraw. He will use the money he is asking for to buy 30 bags of fertilizers, which he believes will cost approximately 2,900 PEN. With the rest of the money he will buy fungicides for the leaves of his potato and pea plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and fungicides

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widowed mother with seven children. Three are in school and the rest are working to earn a living. Abena is a 56-year-old trader. She prepares and sells pastries like doughnuts. She has been in the business for ten years now. People come to buy from her to resell and she sells the remaining at a stand in the community where she lives. She says prices of flour, margarine and other needed ingredients have gone up significantly. She requests the loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, margarine etc. to remain in business. She wants to save part of her profit for her children's educational needs. She belongs to the community group called ’Doduo’ which means ‘Plenty or More’

loans.use: To buy more ingredients

loans.name: Milca

texts.es: Milca tiene 31 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo, actualmente están viviendo en la casa de su suegra. Ella estudió la profesión de agronomía, una vez egresada hizo planes de sembrar numerosas hectáreas en su pueblo de Huasahuasi, denominado “La zona semillera del Perú”. Este proyecto lo hizo junto a su padre y a su esposo, quienes le brindaron todo el apoyo posible. Sembraron varias chacras de papas y en esa época el precio de la papa les favoreció. Desde entonces, cada cosecha la enviaba al mercado de mayorista de Lima, donde le generaba mejores ganancias, con las que adquirió su carro, fueron años de bonaza a base de trabajo duro. Pero desde que tuvo un embarazo y un parto riesgoso, aminoró sus siembras; entonces decidió instalar una bodega en la casa de su suegra en aras da captar dinero para su hogar. Mientras tanto su esposo sigue trabajando con su carro transportando productos desde La Merced (selva de Junín) a Lima. Ahora, esta pareja se ha propuesto comprar pronto un terreno y construir su casa propia. Este es el cuarto crédito de Milca con MFP, durante los 3 periodos anteriores consecutivos era la presidenta de su banco comunal, pero dejó el cargo debido a que se mudó a otro lugar más alejdo, pero para las reuniones asiste puntualmente y apoya en las cobranzas. Cabe resaltar que Milca es muy recta, vela por el ahorro de sus compañeros y los orienta con mucha paciencia para que usen su dinero sabiamente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y con la otra mitad comprará productos comestibles para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Milca, 31, is married and has a son. They are currently living in her mother-in-law’s house. She studied the profession of agronomy. Once she graduated she made plans to plant numerous hectares in her town of Huasahuasai, which is called “The seedbed of Peru”. She worked on this project together with her father and her husband, who offer her all of the support possible. They planted various fields of potatoes, and potato prices were favorable at the time. From then on she sent every harvest to the wholesale market in Lima, where it generated better earnings. She used the earnings to get a car. They were boom years. But, since she had a pregnancy and delivery that were high risk, she decreased her planting. She then decided to set up a store in her mother-in-law’s house in order to get more money for her household. Meanwhile, her husband continues to work with his car transporting products from La Merced (forest in Junín) to Lima. Now, her husband has suggested buying some land and building their own house soon. This is Milca’s fourth loan with MFP. She was the president of her community bank for the last three previous periods. But, she had to leave her post because they moved to another place that is farther away. But, she attends the meetings punctually, and she helps with the collections. Milca is very honest and upright. She watches over her colleagues’ savings, and she patiently guides them to use their money wisely. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy chemical fertilizers. With the other part of the money she will buy food products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita es una persona que siempre a buscado el bienestar de su familia en lo económico y en armonía. Ella todas las mañanas sale a trabajar en una casa como empleada domestica; para poder ganar un poco mas después de que termina su turno, se traslada a otra casa para recibir un poco mas de dinero, aunque su esposo labora en un pollo frito y le ayuda con los gastos familiares, ella piensa en darle una buena educación a sus hijos y dejarles un buen  patrimonio. Hace ya tiempo en su vivienda entraron a robar es por ello que opto por venir a esta institución y pedir un préstamo para poner en frente de su casa un portón para que así ni un extraño vuelva intentar meterse y robarle lo que con mucho esfuerzo a obtenido.
texts.en:
Margarita is a person who has always looked out for the economic and harmonious well being of her family. Every morning she goes to work in a house as a domestic employee. When she is done working there she goes to another house to make a little more money. Even though her husband works in a fried chicken establishment and helps with the family expenses, she plans to give her children a good education and leave them a nice inheritance. A while ago people entered her house to rob them. That is why she decided to come to this institution and ask for a loan to put in a gate in front of her house. She wants a gate so that not one stranger will again try to get inside and rob them of what they worked so hard to get.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a gate

loans.name: Roly

texts.es: Roly tiene 22 años, es un joven soltero, noble y muy trabajador. Es el mayor de 3 hermanos, vive en la casa de sus padres apoyándolos en los trabajos agrícolas. Cuando obtuvo la mayoría de edad (18 años) se dio cuenta de que tenía que trabajar duro en las chacras de su padre para ayudar a mejorar la economía de su casa, en vista de que les faltaba dinero para cubrir la educación de sus hermanas menores. Desde entonces se levanta muy temprano para que a las 8 de la mañana ya esté trabajando en sus cultivos. Durante los meses de verano inicia su labor removiendo la tierra y preparándola para las siembras del nuevo año; llegada la temporada de sembrar cava los surcos donde se entierra la papa. Esta dinámica de trabajo la realiza con el valioso apoyo de su padre, pero para los meses de cosecha su madre y sus hermanas se suman a la faena, recogiendo la papa y seleccionándola por tamaño para después enviarla al mercado de la ciudad de Tarma. Esta cosecha le resultó muy rentable, puesto que vendió cada saco de papa entre 70 a 80 soles, reuniendo dinero para las necesidades de sus hermanas y otra parte para su próxima siembra. Roly está feliz con su trabajo, ama sus cultivos y se siente útil para su hogar. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, durante los 3 ciclos anteriores demostró pagar puntualmente, y en este préstamo reitera su compromiso. Roly es el secretario de su banco comunal, por ello que en cada reunión anota los acuerdos en el libro de actas. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y pesticidas para el follaje de las hojas de sus plantas de papa.
texts.en:
Roly is 22-years old and single; he is a very noble and hard working young man. He is the eldest of 3 brothers and lives in his parents' house, helping them with farming work. When he came of age (18-years old) he realized he had to work hard on his father's farm to help improve his family's financial situation, considering that they don't have money to cover his younger brothers' schooling. Since then, Roly gets up very early so that by 8:00 a.m. he is already working his crops. During the summer he starts turning over the soil and preparing it for next season's planting. It is now time to plow the furrows where he will plant potatoes. Roly accomplishes this work with the valuable help of his father, but during the harvest his mother and sisters join him to work on the land, picking the potatoes and sorting them by size to send to the market in Tarma city. This harvest turned out very profitable, since he sold each sack of potatoes at 70 to 80 PEN. He put the money towards meeting the needs of his sisters, also setting aside a portion for the next planting season. Roly is happy with his work; he loves his crops and feels useful in his home. This is his fourth loan with MFP. In his prior loans he demonstrated that he makes his repayments punctually, and in this loan he will again follow through on his commitment. Roly is the secretary of his community bank, so he records minutes for each meeting in the group's log book (Libro de Actas). The money he requests is to buy chemical fertilizers and pesticides for his potato plants.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Francisco Joel

texts.es: Francisco Joel y su esposa son tienen dos hijos es una familia muy estable y emprendedora. El trabaja en una maquiladora dentro de la ciudad y la señora en una farmacia, para tener mas ingresos quieren iniciar un negocio de repostería casera para esto se necesita comprar la materia prima. Aunque ellos escuchan de la crisis esta afectando y las maquiladoras están cerrando en esta ciudad  y el trabajo es muy escaso prefiere tener este negocio para que en un determinado tiempo no les afecte en su economía.
texts.en:
Francisco Joel and his wife have two children and are a stable, hard working family. He works in an assembly plant in the city and she works in a pharmacy. To earn more income they want to start a home pastry business and for this they need to buy startup materials. Although they hear about the crisis that is having an impact and the assembly plants that are closing in the city and work is very scarce, they prefer to have this business so that after a period of time the economy won't affect them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for a baking business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena started her fish sales two years ago at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana where she lives. Abena takes delivery of fishes from Yeji in the eastern region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 50 years old. She is married with five children. She is currently taking care of two in school and the others are working. She wants to use the loan to buy more assorted fish to make increased sales and income to support her children’s education and her business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance. She belongs to the community group called ‘Prayer is the key’.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Gregoria es conviviente, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Gregoria junto a su esposo tienen una distribuidora de insumos de panadería y pastelería, que reparten a domicilio. Además Gregoria prepara tortas, queques, bocaditos, sus productos los vende en los cafetines y tiendas.
Gregoria necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar.
Los sueños de Gregoria son tener una pastelería y una tienda estable de insumos.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the community bank “Luz Divina”. She is 34 years old and has 2 children. She started a Bakery distribution business with her husband which has a home delivery service. Gregoria makes cakes, desserts, sandwiches that she sells coffee shops and stores.

She is asking for a loan of $500 that will be invested in the purchase of sugar. Gregoria’s dream is to have a pastry shop.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 34-year-old woman who is married with four children. All her children are in school currently. Joyce is a resourceful mother. She is motivated to support her children's education and to provide them with a better life in future careers. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. She balances her grocery shop with the sale of porridge like tom brown and rice with stew.  She sells the porridge early in the morning, but for the rice and stew, she sells that only on market day at her community, which is Tuesdays. The grocery shop is run every day. She has 20 years of sales experience in her current business.

She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her profit to finance the project she is embarking on. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame wo tumi’ which means God has Powers.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc.

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Flor de Maria es separada, tiene 50 años y 4 hijos, natural de la ciudad de Ica, de profesión enfermera y trabaja en el hospital de la ciudad, Flor de Maria vende vinos y pecanas que adquiere en la ciudad de Ica, sus ventas los realiza a los trabajadores de diferentes instituciones.
Flor de Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vinos y pecanas.
Los sueños de Flor de Maria son ampliar su negocio, tener su pecanal y vender al extranjero.
texts.en:
Flor de Maria is a member of the community bank “Luz Divina”. She is 50 years old, divorce and has 4 children; Flor was born in the city of Ica and works as a nurse at the City Hospital. Flor de Maria sells pecans and wine to employees of various institutions. She is asking for a loan of $675 that will be invested in the purchase of wines and pecans. Flor dreams are to expand her business, to have a pecan’s crop and export them.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wine and pecans

loans.name: Rosa Julia

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Rosa es viuda, tiene 50 años y 3 hijos, Rosa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, leña, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.  
Los sueños de Rosa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Banco Comunal Luz Divina. Rosa is a widow. She is 50 years old and has three children. Rosa has a store in her house where she sells groceries, produce, meat, and firewood every day. Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy firewood. Rosa's dreams are to see her children find good jobs, and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Chiltoma Group

texts.es: Foto De izquierda a derecha: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Consuelo del Carmen P. González e Idayda Carolina P.
texts.en: In the photo from left to right: Nubia Auxiliadora Obregón González, Consuelo del Carmen P. González, and  Idayda Carolina P.

loans.use: Pruchase fruit to sell

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is 31 years old. She is a married woman with two children who are in the elementary school. She lives at Sefwi in the western part of Ghana with the family. She has been a baker for eight years now. She bakes and supplies them to her customers who come to buy from her stand. She supplies them by herself in the market center to her customers. She has managed to increase her market share through hard work and commitment. Her only problem now has to do with adequate funds to buy raw materials as prices are shooting up. She requests a loan to remain in business. With the loan, she wants to buy sugar, flour, margarine, yeast, firewood etc. with which she can provide for her family and most especially her children's education. She belongs to a village bank called ‘God’s time is the best.

loans.use: To buy baking materials

loans.name: Karina

texts.es: Karina tiene 32 años, vive con su pareja David y sus 3 hijos; Joseline, Alison y Cielo en su casa propia. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer muy carismática y cordial, he ahí el secreto de su negocio, ella se dedica a vender carteras, chalinas, gorritos y otros accesorios en el mercado del distrito de Puente Piedra en la ciudad de Lima. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que puede aconsejar a sus clientes sobre las cosas que les quedan bien, distrayéndose mucho a lo largo del día. Además ya tiene 4 años de experiencia en esta labor, lo cual hace que se le facilite el trabajo, pero no por esto podemos decir que sea fácil, puesto que debe dedicarle prácticamente todo el día. Karina atiende desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche los días Lunes, Miércoles y Viernes, ya que los días Martes y Jueves lo hace en uno de los mercados más cercanos a su casa. Para el futuro le gustaría tener su propia tienda de ropa exclusivamente para niños, ya que los niños le gustan mucho; además piensa que este mercado es mucho más rentable porque hay más variedad de colores y diseños y no tendría competencia, puesto que no hay tiendas por su zona dedicadas a este rubro. Este es su primer préstamo individual con Microfinanzas PRISMA, teniendo anteriores experiencias en bancos comunales, pero por falta de tiempo para asistir a las reuniones de grupo, optó por esta modalidad. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más novedosas carteras para aumentar sus ventas y acercar a la realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Karina is 32 years old lives with her spouse, David, and their three children: Joseline, Alison, and Cielo, in their own home. She has always characterized herself as being a very charismatic and cordial woman, which is the secret to her business. She is dedicated to selling wallets, purses, caps, and other accessories in the market of the district of Puente Piedra in the city of Lima.

Her job gives her lots of pleasure, because she can make recommendations to her clients about what goes well with them, and it keeps her busy through the long day. Although she has four years experience in this work, which makes her able to do her job, we cannot say that it is easy, because she dedicates practically her whole day to it. Karina works from eight in the morning until nine at night on Monday, Wednesday, and Friday, since on Tuesdays and Thursdays she does her job at a market closer to her home.

In the future she would like to have her own clothing store exclusively for kids, because she loves kids a lot. Furthermore, she thinks that this market will be more profitable, because there is more variety in colors and designs and she wouldn't have competition because there are no stores in her area dedicated to this market. This is her first individual loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, having previous experience in community banks, but due to lack of time to attend group meetings, she has opted for this choice. With the money that she is requesting, she will buy more novel wallets and purses to increase her sales and come closer to realizing her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Querer Es Poder Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer “Los Andes”, se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Querer es poder”, con aproximadamente 7 años de vida , una de las fundadoras de la asociación es Rita C. y recuerda  que el grupo nació invitando a  amigas y vecinas de la zona Los Andes,  a Rita le gusta mucho participar de las reuniones con su grupo porque es un momento de expansión y recreación, compartir con las amigas y olvidarse de los problemas, también le gusta asistir al consultorio para hacerse una revisión general. Las integrantes del grupo en su mayoría se dedican a la venta de ropa como: abrigos, chamarras, pantalones y otros, aseguran que utilizarán el préstamo para la compra de mercadería.
texts.en:
In one of the Focal Centers of Pro Mujer (For Women) Los Andes the communal association Querer es Poder (To Want is to Be Able) is found, with approximately seven years in existence. One of the founders of the association is Rita C. and she remembers that the group was born by inviting friends and neighbors from the Los Andes neighborhood to join. Rita enjoys participating in the meetings with her group because it is a moment of relaxation and recreation to share with friends and forget about problems. She also likes to attend the large meetings to get a general overview. The members of her group for the most part work in the sale of clothing like overcoats, jackets, pants, and other articles. They assure that they will use the loan for the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
Yadira es socia del Banco Comunal Luz Divina.
Yadira es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hija, Yadira viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, productos que proceso en molinos alquilados y los comercializa en los mercados.
Yadira necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, trigo.
Los sueños de Yadira son mejorar su negocio para brindar todo lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Yadira is a member of the Banco Comunal Luz Divina. Yadira lives with her partner. She is 27 years old and has a daughter. She travels to various markets in the area, where she buys grains and has them processed at mills, and then sells them in the markets. Yadira needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to buy barley and wheat. Yadira's dream is to improve her business so she can offer her daughter the best.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley and wheat

loans.name: Nelly Nedy

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Nelly es conviviente, tiene 19 años y esta esperando su primer hijo, Nelly tenia una tienda en su casa, actividad que dejo de realizar por su estado, Nelly junto a su esposo tienen un carro con el cual realiza taxi y también trabaja como conductor para otras empresas.
Nelly necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de artefactos para su hogar.
Los sueños de Nelly son que su hijo sea profesional y brindarle todo lo mejor.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the community bank “Legioncito”. Nelly is 19 years old, has a partner and is expecting her first child. Nelly had a shop in her house, which she closed because of her pregnancy. Nelly and her husband own a taxi that her husband drives; he works as a driver for some companies too. Nelly is asking for a loan of $275 which will be invested in the purchase of appliances. Nelly's dreams are for her child to be a professional and give him all the best.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy appliances

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.es:
Yasmín es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Yasmín es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, de profesión Obstetriz, Yasmín junto a su esposo tienen Consultorios Obstétricos que se llama Clínica de la Mujer y Familia Los Jazmines, para lo cual cuenta con personal técnico que trabajan con ella, tiene 3 sucursales los cuales están equipados.
Yasmin necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos.
Los sueños de Yasmin son que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir una clínica.
texts.en:
Yasmín is a member of the Legioncito communal bank group. She is 39 years old, has 3 children, and lives with her partner.

Yasmín is an obstetrician. She and her spouse have an obstetrics practice called “Jasmine’s Clinic for Women and Families”. They have 3 fully-equipped locations and employ technical staff to assist them.

She needs a loan of 600 soles so that she can purchase medicines. Yasmín dreams of building a clinic and that her children grow up to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines

loans.name: Marilyn Aracel

texts.es:
Marilyn es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Marilyn es soltera, tiene 31 años y 1 hija, Marilyn vende ropas interiores en las diferentes ferias de la región de manera ambulatoria, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de un personal.
Marilyn necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medias.
Los sueños de Mariliyn son mejorar su negocio y salir adelante para apoyar a su hija.
texts.en:
Marilyn is a member of the Legioncito communal bank group. She is 31 years old, single, and has one daughter.

Marilyn sells undergarments in the various walk-by markets within the region. She has one employee that helps her with her business.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles in order to buy stockings. Marilyn dreams of improving her business and moving it forward so that she can support her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stockings

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to two kids. Currently they are both in school. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or taken with what we called Kose. Kose is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to raise a good income to support her kids in school. She belongs to the village bank called ‘United we Stand’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica vive con su esposo el señor Sergio Aguirre y son padres de familia de un pequeñín de 6 años; el señor Sergio labora para una empresa y la señora Verónica tiene su negocio propio establecido desde hace 3 años, el negocio se llama “Abarrotes Verónica”, negocio que requiere de tiempo, esfuerzo pero sobretodo mucha dedicación. 
Ellos están solicitando este crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de más mercancía e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Verónica lives with her husband Sergio Aguirre and together they are parents to a little one of 6 years. Sergio works for a business and Verónica has her own business which she established three years ago. The business is called "Abarrotes Verónica" (Veronica's Grocery). It's a business which requires much time, effort, and above all, dedication.

They are seeking this loan to invest in the business and to purchase more merchandise and increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her store

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is 39 years old. She is a married woman who is blessed with three children. All her children are in school. She is a resourceful mother. Her daily dream is to be able work hard to provide her kids with a quality education for better future careers. She owns and operates a grocery shop in one of the busy local markets of Sefwi and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, canned foods, peanuts, evaporated milk etc. With the loan, she wants to buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc. to increase her stock. She hopes to save more to finance her kids’ school fees. She is a member of the community group called ‘Nyamedaye’ which means God never sleep.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and sugar, cartons of evaporated milk, cartons of vegetable oil etc.

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila T. is a vegetable farmer in the village of Dolchoky. Sushila grows a variety of vegetables but at the moment, she only grows enough to feed her family and does not make a profit from her produce.

Sushila is requesting a loan of Rs.10,000 so that she can purchase a variety of vegetable seedlings. She hopes to grow cauliflower, broccoli and carrots and have enough vegetables to make the transition from being a subsistence farmer to making a profit from her produce.

Sushila has three daughters and one son. Her husband works as a meat supplier in the city of Patan where he collects meat from suppliers and delivers it to butcher shops around town.

Sushila hopes to be able to generate enough income from selling vegetables so that her children can look to her as a successful businesswoman. This is the first time that Sushila has taken out a loan and she is excited about the prospect of running her own business.

loans.use: Purchase vegetable seedlings

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 36 years old. She is married with five children. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for the children’s education. She lives in a cocoa farming community in the western region of Ghana. It is her utmost desire to increase her sales to expand her shop also. She belongs to the village bank ‘Nyadaye’ which means God never sleep.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Sangeeta

texts.en:
Sangeeta T. is a vegetable farmer and owns her own small plot of land adjacent to her house.

Sangeeta is applying for a loan of Rs. 10,000 to buy vegetable seedlings so she can plant more vegetables in time for the harvest. Because it is monsoon season in Nepal right now, it is the best time for planting.

Sangeeta has two sons, both of whom are still too young to attend school. Sangeeta’s husband works as a taxi driver in the city and is often away for several nights at a time with work. To help her on the farm when it gets busy, Sangeeta will employ one or two workers for a few hours each day.

With the profit from selling vegetables, Sangeeta hopes to be able to buy some livestock including a buffalo and a few goats. Sangeeta would also like to earn enough money from her vegetable farm so that she can provide her sons with a good education when they are ready to go to school.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings

loans.name: El Mamon Group

texts.es: Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Filena del Rosario
texts.en: Photo from left to right: Filena del Rosario

loans.use: Purchase of footwear, basic products and pillows to resell

loans.name: Flor De Verano Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha:  María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López  y Juana Antonia Méndez.

El grupo solidario FLOR DE VERANO , está conformado por las siguientes personas: :  María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López  y Juana Antonia Méndez.

Doña  María Fidelina López vende verduras y frutas en el mercado Oriental de Managua, su horario de trabajo es desde temprana horas de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde que regresa a su casa.Espera poder crecer en su negocio para alcanzar sus metas de mejorar su vivienda.

Doña Candida Rosa López vende frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de Masaya, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad que la aprendió de sus madre, ella desde tempranas horas compra sus productos a camiones que llegan con verduras de la zona norte del país y luego en el día revende estos productos. Tiene dos hijos en edad adolescentes y le ayudan en la venta. Su esposo trabaja por cuenta propia y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su crédito lo ocupó para comprar más variedad de frutas y así incrementar sus ventas.

Doña Juana Antonia al igual que sus compañeras vende frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya ella es la coordinadora del grupo por ser muy responsable y además tiene el respeto de todos en su comunidad,  tiene hijos a su cargo pero son independientes, sueña con mejorar su casa y siempre depender de si misma.
Ella invirtió en la compra de más productos perecederos y así variar productos para vender mas, su esposo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, él se dedica al oficio de acarreo en el mercado.
Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.Se proponen trabajar con Adim en varios ciclos y están claras que para esto es solamente si son disciplinadas en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López, and Juana Antonia Méndez. The group "Flor de Verano" is formed by the following people: María Fidelina López, Candida Rosa López, and Juana Antonia Méndez. María sells fruits and vegetables in the market Oriental de Managua. Her work schedule is from very early in the morning until three in the afternoon when she goes home. She hopes to grow her business in order to achieve her goals of improving her home. Candida Rosa López sells fruits and vegetables in the municipal market of Mayasa. She has many years' experience in this business, which she learned from her mother. From the very early hours of the morning, she purchases her products from the trucks that arrive with vegetables from the northern zone of the country and later in the day, she resells these products. She has two adolescent children and they help her with her sales. Her husband works for himself and he helps with the expenses of the home. Her loan she will use to purchase a wider variety of fruits and thus increase her sales. Juana Antonia, just like her fellow group members, sells fruits and vegetable in the market in Masaya. She is the coordinator of the group, as she is very responsible and she has the respect of the whole community. She has children, but they are independent. She dreams of improving her home and always being able to support herself. She will invest in the purchase of more perishable products and this way vary the products she will sell. Her husband helps with the expenses of the home. He works in the transportation business for the market. The group members tell us that Adim has taught them to better control and improve their businesses with the training they have received, and that they have helped them in their personal lives as well. They propose to work with Adim for several cycles and are clear that this will be the case only if they can be disciplined in their repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty es una mujer de 56 años, los últimos años ha trabajado mucho para tener los ingresos necesarios para la construcción de su casa propia, la cual está en proceso y espera pronto se termine para tener seguridad y comodidad, ya que por el momento vive en la casa de su suegra. En el tiempo que lleva casada aprendió el oficio de su esposo, ahora es un apoyo dentro del negocio, puesto que es la encargada de la administración de los contratos. Ellos se dedican al alquiler de andamios (soportes de metal) que requieren para las construcciones, de la misma forma apoya en el negocio que tiene con sus hijos en el mercado de la ciudad donde atienden los pedidos de elaboración o reparación de diversos materiales de construcción. Esta actividad la viene desempeñando con mayor compromiso desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el que, junto a su esposo e hijos, atienden su taller desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Betty menciona que en compañía de su familia las labores son menos pesadas y juntos tienen proyectado ampliar su negocio para dar mejores servicios bajo el rubro de construcción. En Microfinanzas PRISMA este es su crédito número 18 y como parte de su banco comunal trata de apoyar a todas sus compañeras para trabajar en conjunto por el desarrollo y crecimiento de ellas mismas. Los 3200 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de algunos materiales que tiene pensado adquirir para alquilar y ampliar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Betty is a 56 year-old woman. Recently, she has worked very hard in order to earn the necessary income for the construction of her own home, which is still in progress. She hopes that it will be finished soon so that she can have security and comfort. Right now she lives in the home of her mother-in-law.

In the time that she has been married, she has learned the business of her spouse, and now has a support role in his business, a role where she is in charge of the administration of the contracts. They rent scaffolding (metal supports) which are required for construction. In the same way, the business, which they have with their children in the city market, serves the requests for the creation or repair of diverse construction materials. This venture began 3 years ago, during which, along with her spouse and children, Betty works in the shop from 9 in the morning until 6 in the evening. Betty says that in the company of her family, the work seems less tedious. Together they plan to grow their business so that they can provide better services in the field of construction.

This is her 18th loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and as part of her community bank, Betty tries to support all of her fellow members to help them develop and grow. The 3200 Peruvian Soles she seeks she will us to invest in the purchase of some materials which she plans to rent to improve their services.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials to rent

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 59 years old. She is widowed and has three children. All her children are currently working. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits etc. in her neighborhood. It has been her dream to make an expansion by adding other foodstuffs to her existing products. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits etc to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support herself for old age. She would be grateful for your assistance and belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyamedaye’ which means God never sleep.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her store

loans.name: Mca Primary School, Massesebeh Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of the MCA Primary school of Masesebeh village, about three miles from Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. MCA Primary school is the only school in Massegbeh village. The school was established in 2004 by the Missionary Church of Africa. Currently, it has ten staff and a total of 182 pupils. 

These teachers, like many of their counterparts in Magburaka and other parts of the country, have applied for a loan from SMT/Kiva in order to invest in something meaningful. And gradually, out of their monthly salaries, their school bursar repays SMT on a monthly basis on behalf of the teachers.

As teachers’ salaries are usually small in Sierra Leone, needless to say that SMT/Kiva loans are of a great importance to these teachers. Some of them will use this loan to either purchase a piece of land in order to build a house, or complete a house building project they have started. Some will use theirs to buy pieces of furniture, like a bed, chairs etc.  Some will use theirs to pay school fees either for themselves pursue further studies or for their children. While others will use theirs to invest in businesses in order to supplement their meager monthly salaries.

Abdul K. (back row second from left) is the head master at the school. Abdul is 47 years of age. He was born in Yoni village, about 40 miles from Massesebeh village. He is married to a businesswoman and they have four children. One of their children is in Senior Secondary School III (SSS III), the other in Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), one in class six and the other in class one. Mr. K. has been a teacher for twenty-three years now. With this loan, he will invest it in business. He sells items like cigarette, sugar, soaps and so on.

loans.use: Invest in his business

loans.name: Jachaptañani Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal  “Panamericana” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal  “Jachaptañani” que significa “Creceremos”, cuenta con once integrantes que tienen variados negocios como: venta de colchas, comida, manta, calzados, helados y otros. Su presidenta es Martha C., quien menciona que el grupo es muy unido y lo que más les gusta a todas es la capacitación que les imparten en cada reunión, en temas que les hace reflexionar como el sobreendeudamiento. 

Todas las integrantes están muy motivadas a invertir el préstamo en sus negocios, específicamente para comprar mayor mercadería y así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
The “Jachaptañani” group, which means "we will grow," is located in the Panamericana Community Center. The group has 11 members who have a variety of businesses, such as selling blankets, food, shoes, and ice cream, among others. The group's president is Martha C., who notes that the group is very united and what they all like best is the learning they do each meeting about topics that make them think, such as over-indebtedness. All of the members are very eager to invest the loan in their businesses, specifically in order to buy more merchandise and achieve higher incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 31 años, la base D. su desarrollo como familia es primordial, ya que su esposo y sobre todo su hijo son sus mayores amores. Por ahora viven en la casa D. su suegra, lo cual es un ahorro mientras consiguen su casa propia. DesD. que contrajo matrimonio tuvo la necesidad D. apoyar a su pareja, quien como comerciante no se daba abasto con los gastos D. la familia. Gracias al apoyo D. su madre pudo adquirir un coche D. comida con el cual sale a vender en la puerta D. su casa todos los días desD. hace 5 años. DesD. entonces, a partir D. las 3 D. la tarD. prepara lo necesario para su venta diaria, luego a las 5 D. la tarD. venD. hasta la media noche, ya que la mayoría D. sus clientes son trabajadores que regresan a sus hogares a altas horas D. la noche con deseos D. degustar algunos platillos en el camino. Esta demanda está creciendo y Lourdes desea aprovecharla instalando un restaurante dentro D. su casa. Microfinanzas PRISMA le ha otorgado 13 créditos a Lourdes y junto a sus compañeras con quienes trabaja en su banco comunal tratan D. que estos créditos sean bien aprovechados en sus negocios y para el desarrollo D. su grupo. Con los 3000 soles que solicita comprará los comestibles necesarios para incrementar la cantidad D. porciones que venD. al día.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 31 years old and loves her husband and son very much – they are the loves of her life. Right now they live in her mother-in-law’s house which helps them save while they try to get their own home. Lourdes has worked to help her husband since she got married because he is a shopkeeper and they cannot cover their household expenses on what he makes. She has sold plates of food from a cart (her mother helped her get) in front of her house for the past five years. She starts preparing everything she will need for her sales at three o’clock in the afternoon and then sells from five until midnight. Most of her clients are workers who are returning home late at night and are hungry for something on the way. Demand is increasing, so Lourdes would like to take advantage of this and start a restaurant in her home. Microfinanzas PRISMA has authorized loan money for Lourdes and her fellow communal bank members who hope to take advantage of this money to develop their businesses and their group. With the 3,000 soles asked for, Lourdes will buy the food necessary to increase the amount of portions she can serve each day.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de comestibles

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia es una mujer muy trabajadora y entregada a su labor como madre, esposa y abuela. Lucha constantemente por el bienestar de su hogar y ahora aun más porque está en plena construcción de su casa propia. El no tener un puesto estable donde vender no es limitación para ella, sino que es un reto que alcanzar. Su trabajo durante estos 4 años como ambulante es muestra de sus ansias de progresar, ya que todos los días sale desde las 11 de la mañana a vender los platillos de comida que previamente prepara en su casa para llevarlos a las puertas de los colegios, donde los estudiantes son sus principales clientes, ya que la gran población estudiantil es quien le brinda las ganancias a su negocio. Y debido a que las porciones de comida que vende son a precios cómodos puede vender mayores cantidades, lo cual ha mantenido hasta hoy estable su negocio. Lucia se está proyectando para instalar una tienda en su casa, la cual está en construcción y espera que pronto sea realidad. Sus 13 préstamos con Microfinanzas PRISMA son gracias a la integración de su banco comunal, donde cada miembro aporta lo necesario para el desarrollo de la organización, que es lo que más le agrada a Lucia. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará los utensilios y comestibles que requiere para incrementar las porciones de comida que vende.
texts.en:
Lucia is a very hard-working and devoted mother, wife and grandmother. She continually strives to ensure the well-being of her household and even more so now that her house is under construction.
Not having a fixed business location is not a limitation for her, but a challenge to overcome. Her work over these last 4 years as a street vendor demonstrates her desire to keep moving forward. She goes out at 11 am every day to sell homemade meals at the entrances of high schools. Students are her main customers- her business makes a profit off of the large student population. She is able to sell in large quantities thanks to her affordable prices, which have given her steady business to this day.
Lucia is planning to set up shop in her home, which is currently under construction, and hopes it will soon become a reality. Her 13 loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA are thanks to the integration of her communal bank. Each member contributes what is necessary for the organisation’s growth, which is what Lucia likes best. With the money she is requesting, Lucia will purchase the utensils and food she needs to increase the amount of food she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and utensils for her business

loans.name: Flor Del Campo Group

texts.es:
Foto de Izquierda a derecha: Angela del Rosario J. F., Paula del Socorro C. y Julia Margarita M...

 Este grupo tiene su domicilio en  la ciudad de Masaya en comarca San Blass, estas tres mujeres tienen actividades comerciales diferentes, se conocen desde hace muchos años y tienen una gran confianza una en la otra. 

Doña Angela vende perecederos en el mercado de Masaya, vende frutas, las compra al por mayor y ella vende al detalle durante el día, tiene dos hijos de edad adolescentes  que van a la escuela, su esposo es comerciante en el mismo mercado y es agricultor, le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Se dedica desde muy joven a su actividad comercial y ella piensa hacer crecer su negocio y así un día mejorar su casa.

Doña Paula del Socorro es la coordinadora del grupo, ella tiene un puesto de perecederos en el mercado donde ofrece productos como: chayotes,  ayotes , sandías etc., sueña con terminar la casa que está construyendo en terreno propio y muy pronto trasladarse a vivir ahí.
Tiene un hijo pequeño, no tiene esposo, ella vive con su mamá y se propone hacer crecer el negocio para salir adelante.

Doña Julia Margarita al igual que las otras dos se dedica a la misma actividad, ella es una mujer joven y tiene dos hijos pequeños, vive con su esposo y están terminando de comprar un terreno para un día construir su casa.
Ella invierte el crédito en comprar verduras que vienen de la zona norte del país.

Expresan que en Adim le han enseñado a controlar mejor su negocio con las capacitaciones que reciben y también a mejorar de manera personal.
texts.en:
Photo from left to right: Angela del Rosario J. F., Paula del Socorro C. y Julia Margarita M..
This group resides in the city of Masaya, in the San Blass district. These three women run separate businesses, have known each other for many years and have a great deal of confidence in each other.
Angela sells perishable goods at the Masaya market. She purchases fruit wholesale and sells it retail during the day. She has two teenaged children who attend school. Her husband is a farmer and works in the same market; she helps him with household expenses. She has been in this trade since she was very young and plans to grow her business in order to improve her home.
Paula del Socorro coordinates the group. She has a perishable goods stall in the market where she offers products like: chayotes, squash, watermelons, etc. She hopes to finish building a house on the land she owns and move in very soon. She has one small child, she isn’t married and lives with her mother. She plans to make her business grow in order to succeed.
Julia Margarita is in the same business as the other two. She is a young woman who lives with her husband and two small children. They have almost finished purchasing land to one day build their home. She is using the loan to purchase vegetables from the northern part of the country.
They say that Adim’s training has taught them to better manage their businesses, as well as helped them grow personally.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables wholesale to sell retail

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer emprendedora que a pesar de estar separada supo educar a sus hijos y brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Una de las cosas que les pudo ofrecer  aparte de su amor y cariño es una casa propia donde habitar como una familia feliz. Cuando empezó su labor como comerciante no tenía la capacidad adquisitiva para hacerlo, pero tuvo mucha fe en que las cosas mejorarían y fue así, ya que pasó de ser ambulante a tener un puesto propio donde vender. Dejo de visitar el mercado de su distrito y rodearlo, para ubicarse en un puesto agradable donde puede vender sus productos tranquilamente e incrementar sus ventas. Ahora está convencida de que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa y es por ello que desea seguir trabajando todos los días desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche atendiendo su puesto con mucha alegría. María cuenta con el apoyo de su hija, con quien se turna para atender su puesto mientras prepara los alimentos por las mañanas. Es así como viene realizando su actividad de venta de juguetes por más de 10 años. El compañerismo y las ganas de progresar son las características que le agradan dentro de su banco comunal, puesto que en estos 18 créditos que ha tenido con Microfinanzas PRISMA le han sido de gran apoyo para su desarrollo social y económico. Con los 3000 soles que solicita planea incrementar la cantidad de juguetes que vende para atender la demanda de sus pequeños clientes, pues en su mayoría son niños.
texts.en:
María is an enterprising woman who, although she was separated from her husband, made an effort to educate her children and offer them living conditions beneficial to their development. One of the things she was able to offer them, apart from her love and attention, is a house of their own where they can live like a happy family. When she began selling things to earn money, she didn't have the purchasing power to do much, but she had a lot of faith that things would get better -- and they did. She went from being a street vendor to having her own space. She stopped going to the local market and set up in a pleasant space where she can sell her products in peace and increase her sales. Now she is convinced that every sacrifice is repaid and because of that wishes to continue working every day from 9 in the morning to 8 at night, happily tending her shop. Maria is assisted by her daughter, who watches the shop while Maria prepares food in the morning. That's how she's been able to continue selling toys for more than 10 years. A sense of comradeship and a desire to improve one's life are two of the qualities she likes about her communal bank, since the members have given her a lot of support for her social and economic development with the 18 previous loans she's gotten from Microfinanzas PRISMA. She plans to use the 3000 soles requested to increase the quantity of toys she sells to meet her little customers' demands, since most of them are children.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte is a businesswoman at Sefwi. She trades in Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials. She is 47 years old, married and lives with her husband. She has one child (girl) who is currently in school. Charlotte is very supportive to her family through her trading business. She has been selling for the past four years but progress has persistently been low due to insufficient funds. She hopes the loan will enable her to revive the business and make a more viable profit. She wants to purchase Dumas clothes, linen and lace materials in bulk to increase her inventory. It is her desire\ to rent a store in the community market. She would be grateful for your support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Aver Maria’.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is thirty years old and single with one child. She owns and operates a beauty salon in her neighborhood. She is a very skillful and talented hair dresser. She has five years of experience and has had a few apprentices pass through her hand during her career.

She believes in efficient and effective service and therefore wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products, like weavons, pomade, shampoo, and activators, with which to serve her customers. She belongs to a village bank called Nyame Tumi, meaning God’s Power.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products, like weavons, pomade, shampoo, and activators.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 27 year old young lady. She is married and the mother of one child. She is currently in school and is also a very hard-working trader. She enjoys selling and cosmetics sales has been her major source of livelihood for the past four years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. She does not have a shop at the moment, so she sells on top of a table at the community market.

Gladys believes that with this loan, she would be better able to purchase more stock of cosmetics to increase her inventory, and income, for that matter. She is a member of a group called Nyame Tumi, which means God’s Power.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cosmetic products.

loans.name: Fuerza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
